properties.notes: On 31 December 2026, 2 groups (described as sections of Panawuol and Panthier of the same clan and coded as Yirol Communal Militia based on location) clashed over the Aliet cattle camp in Yirol East County (location coded to Nyang, the Yirol East County headquarters, in Lakes State), resulting in 5 fatalities and 6 injuries. Security forces were deployed to calm the situation at the camp and arrested 35 suspects.

On 25 December 2026, suspected Murle armed youth from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) ambushed local youth (coded as Duk communal militia) but were repulsed by the latter on the outskirts of Duk Padiet Town in Pachoknyieth area of Duk Padiet Payam (Duk, Jonglei). The incident resulted in 3 fatalities and 6 injuries to the local youths. Motivation unknown/not reported. Authorities in the GPAA have denied that their youth were involved.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 25 December 2026, a group of 18 armed individuals ambushed a truck transporting food items, to a church hosting IDPs in Ngboko, in an area near Muzungu and Ngboko in Source Yubo Payam (location coded to Source Yubo, the nearest known location, in Tambura County, Western Equatoria State), resulting in an armed clash with SSPDF soldiers (assumed to be escorting the truck). 1 soldier was killed in the incident. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 24 December 2026, armed individuals suspected of coming from Warrap State's Tonj North County (coded as Tonj North communal militia) ambushed individuals traveling along Naam River in Riaah Payam of Mayom County (location coded to Mayom, the Mayom County Headquarters, in Unity State), killing 1. The attackers attempted to abduct the other individuals but the latter were rescued by Mayom County youth (likely from the Bul Nuer who are predominant in the area) in a likely clash. The victims were mostly women and children affected by the Cholera outbreak and were going to seek treatment in Mankien Payam.

On 24 December 2026, armed assailants suspected of being from the Luach-Jang Dinka community from Pahol Payam shot at members of the Akook/Akok sub-section of the Aliap section of the Rek Dinka in Ngap-Aneet village of Ngap-Agook Payam (location coded to Ngap-agok, the nearest known location, in Tonj East County, Warrap State). 5 locals were wounded while 1 of the attackers was shot and injured by one of the victims' relatives. The incident is suspected to be linked to the ongoing conflict between Luachjang, Akok Deng Achuil, and Thiik communities.

On 20 December 2026, a group of residents stoned a 58-year-old woman to death in Ame/Amee Boma of Iwire Payam (Magwi, Eastern Equatoria), after she was accused of beheading a 48-year-old relative. Before the stoning, the 58-year-old confessed to being part of a group conducting similar incidents.

On 20 December 2026, unidentified assailants suspected of coming from Pochalla County (coded as unidentified armed group) ambushed 3 traders at an unspecified location between Jebel Boma and Jebel Raad in Pibor County (location coded to Boma, the nearest known location, in Jonglei State). The attackers killed 1 person while the other 2 escaped. The victims were going to a trading point in Jebel Raad along the Ethiopia-South Sudan border. Motivation unknown/not reported. The incident happened near the same location where the commissioner of Jebel Boma County was ambushed and killed in March 2026 (coded separately).

On 18 December 2026, unidentified armed assailants (coded as unidentified armed group) attacked the residence of Tambura's County Commissioner in Tambura (Tambura, Western Equatoria), but were repelled by SSPDF soldiers and the leader's bodyguards (assumed to be military too). There were no casualties but several civilians were injured as they scampered for safety. The commissioner accused SPLA-IO soldiers of involvement. More SSPDF forces were deployed to the area to quell violence. Motivation unknown/not reported.

properties.source: Sudans Post; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 17 December 2026, youth from Duk County (coded as unidentified communal militia) clashed with suspected Murle armed individuals at an unspecified location towards Pibor in Duk County (location coded to Duk Padiet, the Duk County headquarters, in Jonglei State). The Duk youth recovered 42 cattle stolen by the Murle youth in Duk County on 15 December 2026 (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

On 17 December 2026, unidentified assailants armed with heavy weapons, including rocket-propelled grenades, (coded as unidentified armed group) attacked Tambura Market (Tambura, Western Equatoria), but were engaged in an exchange of fire by SSPDF forces and other security personnel in the area. There were no casualties. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 16 December 2026, unidentified armed assailants (coded as unidentified armed group) shot and killed a 53-year-old woman on her way to the market at an unspecified location in Tambura County (location coded to Tambura, the Tambura County headquarters, in Western Equatoria State). It is unclear if the killing is linked to recent incidents in the County. The county commissioner accused an SPLA-IO soldier of committing the murder. Motivation unknown/not reported.

properties.source: Sudans Post; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 15 December 2026, youth suspected of being from the Murle community from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area attacked an unspecified location in Duk County (location coded to Duk Padiet, the Duk County headquarters, in Jonglei State), injuring 1 person and raiding 42 cattle. Local youth recovered the stolen animals on 17 December 2026 (coded separately).

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 15 December 2026, clashes between armed youth (described as white army militia and suspected to be from Duk, Uror, and Ayod counties, and coded as Nuer ethnic militia who are predominant in the area) and Murle community members continued in Nyalima, Kibali, and Thamarac villages in Gumuruk area (location coded to Gumuruk, the nearest known location, in Pibor County, Jonglei State). The clashes which lasted for 3 days (13, 14, and 15 December 2026, all coded separately) resulted in at least 35 fatalities, 4 Murle and 31 Nuer, and an unspecified number of injuries while an unknown number of people were displaced. Following the end of the clashes on 15 December 2026, the attackers left with at least 3027 cattle and headed towards Gadiang Town in Jonglei State. 11 fatalities coded for this event. Jonglei State authorities denied that their youth attacked Pibor.

On 15 December 2026, armed cattle keepers from Unity State (likely from the Nuer community who live in the area) attacked an SSPDF soldier (assumed off duty) who was fishing in Yaar of Pariang in the Ruweng Administrative Area (location coded to Pariang, the Pariang County headquarters, in Unity State), killing him. Motivation unknown/not reported.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 14 December 2026, clashes between armed youth (described as white army militia and suspected to be from Duk, Uror, and Ayod counties, and coded as Nuer ethnic militia who are predominant in the area) and Murle community members continued in Nyalima, Kibali, and Thamarac villages in Gumuruk area (location coded to Gumuruk, the nearest known location, in Pibor County, Jonglei State). The clashes which lasted for 3 days (13, 14, and 15 December 2026, all coded separately) resulted in at least 35 fatalities, 4 Murle and 31 Nuer, and an unspecified number of injuries while an unknown number of people were displaced. Following the end of the clashes on 15 December 2026, the attackers left with at least 3027 cattle and headed towards Gadiang Town in Jonglei State. 12 fatalities coded for this event. Jonglei State authorities denied that their youth attacked Pibor.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 13 December 2026, armed youth (described as white army militia and suspected to be from Duk, Uror, and Ayod counties, and coded as Nuer ethnic militia who are predominant in the area) attacked Nyalima, Kibali, and Thamarac villages in Gumuruk area (location coded to Gumuruk, the nearest known location, in Pibor County, Jonglei State), resulting in an armed clash with local Murle youth. The clashes lasted for 3 days (13, 14, and 15 December 2026, all coded separately) resulting in at least 35 fatalities, 4 Murle and 31 Nuer, and an unspecified number of injuries while an unknown number of people were displaced. Following the end of the clashes on 15 December 2026, the attackers left with at least 3027 cattle and headed towards Gadiang Town in Jonglei State. 12 fatalities coded for this event. Jonglei State authorities denied that their youth attacked Pibor.

On 10 December 2026, armed individuals suspected to be from the Toposa community from Eastern Equatoria State's Kapoeta area were engaged in an armed clash with local youths (likely from the Murle community, which is predominant in the area) in Jebel Boma Town in the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (location coded to nearest known location, Boma in Pibor County, Jonglei State). The assailants raided 87 cattle which were recovered by the local youth and there were no casualties.

properties.source: Catholic Radio Network; Eye Radio (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 10 December 2026, unidentified armed individuals (coded as unidentified armed group) shot and killed a civilian and injured a woman and her child at an internally displaced persons (IDP) camp at St Mary Help of Christians Catholic Parish in Tambura (Tambura, Western Equatoria). The incident led to the displacement of civilians from the camp. Motivation unknown/not reported.

Other: On 9 December 2026, 5 South Sudanese opposition groups, left out of the Kenya-led Tumaini Peace Initiative, formed the National Opposition Alliance (NOA) to unite and address the country's conflict's root causes (location coded to Juba in Juba County, Central Equatoria State). They criticized the government for not implementing past peace accords and expressed dissatisfaction with the 2022 Khartoum peace agreement. The coalition includes Patriots' Resistance Movement-Army (PRM/A), led by General Laraka Machar Turoal; the South Sudan National Liberation Movement/Army (SSNLM/A), headed by Hoth Guor Lual; the South Sudan United National Front/Army (SSUNF/A), led by Philip Stephen Dak Onwar; the South Sudan Rescue Front (SSRF), headed by Kamin Vigilio Vurve; and the Union Party of South Sudan/Army (UPSS/A), led by Dhoal Tutlual Larjin. They announced a commitment to federalism, democracy, and justice.

properties.source: East African (Kenya); Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Reuters; Sudan Tribune; Sudans Post; The City Review (South Sudan); Twic Media Reports; VOA
properties.notes: Other: On 9 December 2026, President Salva Kiir of South Sudan issued several decrees aired on the state-owned South Sudan Broadcasting Corporation (SSBC), in Juba (Juba, Central Equatoria), removing General Santino Deng Wol from his position as Chief of Defense Forces and reassigned as Undersecretary in the Ministry of Defense and Veterans Affairs. General Paul Nang Majok was appointed as the new Chief of Defense Forces. Atak Santino Majak was also dismissed as Undersecretary of the Ministry of Defense and Veterans Affairs. General Atem Marol Biar was fired as Inspector General of Police (IGP), and General Abraham Peter Manyuat was appointed as his replacement. At the Central Bank, Garang Alic was relieved of his duties as Governor of the Bank of South Sudan (BOSS), and Johnny Ohisa Damian, who previously held the position, was reappointed as the new Governor. Garang Majak was also dismissed as the first undersecretary of the finance ministry, and Arop Nuoi Arop was appointed in his place.

On 9 December 2026, unidentified armed assailants suspected to be from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (likely from the Murle community who live in the area) ambushed 9 civilians, who were traveling from Partet to Pieri to pick up food assistance, in the outskirts of Pieri (Uror, Jonglei). The attackers abducted four women and a baby who later was killed, three of the victims comprising of two women and one man managed to escape. Local youth pursued the assailants and rescued one of the abductees. Victims are likely from the Lou Nuer community who are predominant in the area.

On 9 December 2026, a group of 14 youths who were protesting in Pariang (Pariang, Unity) were dispersed by security officers (assumed to be police, the means of dispersal was not reported). The group called for the removal of the Chief Administrator of the Ruweng Administrative Area, but local authorities termed the protest politically motivated. 7 of the protestors were later arrested.

On 8 December 2026, unidentified individuals shot and killed 3 people at an unspecified area on the road leading to Tambura Town (location coded to Tambura in Tambura County, Western Equatoria State). Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 6 December 2026, armed individuals suspected of being Murle community members attacked Pamai village in Weikol Payam (location coded to nearest known location, Yuai in Uror County, Jonglei State), resulting in 2 fatalities and 5 injuries. The attackers also raided an unspecified number of cattle from the victims (likely members of the Lou Nuer community who live in the area). An official from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) where the Murle are predominant refuted claims that their youth were involved. A similar incident occurred in the same area on 5 December 2026 (coded separately).

On 5 December 2026, armed individuals suspected of being Murle community members attacked Wickol village in Pamai Payam (location coded to nearest known location, Yuai in Uror County, Jonglei State), killing 1 person and injuring 5 others. The attackers also raided 500 cattle from the victims. Local youth (likely members of the Lou Nuer community who live in the area) unsuccessfully attempted to recover the cattle. An official from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) where the Murle are predominant refuted claims that their youth were involved.

On 5 December 2026, 2 communities (both coded as unidentified communal militia) clashed in Tiac-Tiac Payam, north of Cueibet (location coded to Cueibet in Cueibet County, Lakes State). The fighting had begun on 4 December 2026 (coded separately) after 2 individuals were involved in a fight. Security personnel were deployed to the area but tension between the 2 groups remains high. Casualties unknown.

On 5 December 2026, Titweng armed youth clashed with SSPDF forces deployed in Aneet, in Athony area (location coded to Athony (Tiitcok boma) in Twic County, Warrap State), resulting in 5 fatalities on the Titweng side. Shortly after, another clash between the 2 groups occurred in the Madiau area near Yin Deng Ayuel (coded separately). The soldiers also captured an unspecified number of Titweng youth. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 5 December 2026, Titweng youth clashed with SSPDF soldiers in Madiau area near Nyin Deng Ayuel (location coded to Nyin Deng Ayuel in Twic County, Warrap State). This clash followed a similar incident on the same day in Athony (coded separately), which resulted in 5 fatalities. The soldiers also captured an unspecified number of Titweng youth. Casualties unknown. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 4 December 2026, 2 communities (both coded as unidentified communal militia) clashed in Tiac-Tiac Payam, north of Cueibet (location coded to Cueibet in Cueibet County, Lakes State), resulting in at least 7 fatalities. The clash erupted following a fight between 2 people. The clash continued until 5 December 2026 (coded separately) and has created tension in the area. Security officers have also been deployed to ease the situation.

On 3 December 2026, armed individuals (coded as unidentified communal militia) ambushed and killed a cattle trader, taking his cattle for sale, at an unspecified location between Mayom County and Ajakkuach Payam in Warrap State (location coded to Mayom in Mayom County, Unity State). The incident is linked to revenge.

On 2 December 2026, armed youth suspected of being Murle community members abducted 4 children in Kuacdeng Payam (location coded to Bus in Ayod County, Jonglei State). Victims are likely members of the Long section of the Gawaar Nuer community who live in the area.

On 2 December 2026, unidentified individuals (coded as unidentified communal militia) ambushed a group of civilians traveling in an unspecified location in Panyijiar County (location coded to Panyijiar in Panyijiar County, Unity State), killing 4. The attack is linked to revenge following a 2018 incident (further information unknown/not reported).

properties.source: BBC News; Radio Tamazuj; Twic Media Reports
properties.notes: On 30 November 2026, Sudan Armed Forces (SAF) dropped an unspecified number of bombs using an airplane along the Sudan-South Sudan border area, near al-Tadamon locality in Sudan's Blue Nile State, in Kosovo, Dong-Tim Payam, Renk County (location coded to Renk in Renk County, Upper Nile State), injuring 3 civilians. SSPDF forces responded to the scene and transported the victims to a nearby medical facility. Motivation unknown/not reported. Local officials are engaging with their Sudanese counterparts to establish motive.

On 30 November 2026, unidentified communal groups clashed at an unspecified location in Ulang county (location coded to the county capital, Ulang, Ulang, Upper Nile), resulting in the injury of an INGO aid worker who was caught in the crossfire.

On 27 November 2026, unidentified armed assailants (coded as unidentified armed group) ambushed an SSPDF officer and his bodyguard traveling along the Abyei-Twic Road at an unspecified location between Rum-kor and Majak-kol (location coded to Majak-kol of Ajakkuac Payam in Twic County, Warrap State), injuring the 2 and carting away their rifles. The victims, who were in civilian attire, were deployed to the area to maintain security. Security forces responded and pursued the attackers unsuccessfully.

On 27 November 2026, unidentified assailants (coded as unidentified armed group) attacked the residence of the Tambura County Commissioner in Tambura County (location coded to Tambura in Western Equatoria State), using rocket-propelled grenades (RPGs). There were no casualties. The commissioner noted that this was a politically motivated assassination attempt on him.

On 25 November 2026, armed youth suspected of coming from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (likely members of the Murle community who are predominant in the area) attacked and killed 2 local youth (likely from the Lou Nuer community based on incident location) guarding cattle in Diror Payam of Akobo West (Akobo, Jonglei). The assailants also stole an unspecified number of cattle from the victims, however, local youth recovered the stolen animals.

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 25 November 2026, hundreds of youth peacefully protested in Jaak Payam (Koch, Unity), over Gatkuoth Kun Dar's recent appointment as the Sudd Petroleum Operating Company (SPOC) vice president in the Tharjiath oilfield. Gatkuoth was appointed by the National Ministry of Petroleum, however, the protesters insisted that the position should be held by someone from Koch, Guit, Mayendit, Panyijiar, or Leer counties, which are under SPOC arguing that Gatkuoth, who is from Bloc 5B and Rubkona County, should not hold a position meant for someone from Bloc 5A.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 23 November 2026, 6 unidentified armed individuals (coded as unidentified armed group) ambushed a commercial vehicle traveling from Juba to Uganda along the Juba-Nimule Highway in Bai-Bai, between Nesitu and Jebelain, of Lokiliri Payam (location coded to Nesitu in Juba County, Central Equatoria State). The incident, which occurred between 2 security checkpoints, resulted in 3 fatalities, among them 1 Ethiopian national, and at least 8 injuries. The attackers first robbed the occupants of their personal belongings before shooting at them. SSPDF acknowledged the occurrence of the incident noting that they have begun investigations to establish the perpetrators.

Around 23 November 2026, individuals suspected of coming from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (likely from the Murle community who are predominant in the area) abducted 3 children (likely members of the Lou Nuer community based on incident location) at an unspecified location in Uror County (location coded to Yuai, the Uror County headquarters in Jonglei State).

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Sudans Post; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 23 November 2026, unidentified armed assailants suspected of coming from Unity State (coded as unidentified armed group) ambushed a Greater Nile Petroleum Operating Company (GPOC) truck, carrying construction materials from Pariang town to Unity oilfield, in Pith Makuei area (location coded to Pariang in Pariang County, Unity State). The attackers shot and injured the driver and Ethiopian national, before fleeing the scene as security officers responded to the incident. Motivation unknown/not reported.

properties.source: AFP; BBC News; Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Miraya; Radio Tamazuj; Reuters; Sudans Post; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 21 November 2026, SSPDF soldiers attempted to arrest the former head of the Internal Bureau of the NSS, General Akol Koor Kuc, at his residence in Tongping area near the Nimule Resort Hotel (Juba, Central Equatoria), resulting in an armed clash with other security members loyal to General Akol (assumed to be military). The incident resulted in 4 fatalities, 2 soldiers and 2 civilians, and 2 injuries. SSPDF leadership acknowledged the incident noting that the clash was a result of a misunderstanding between the 2 groups and the issue has been resolved. Additionally, General Akol was transferred to his other residence in Jebel.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Miraya; Radio Tamazuj; Sudans Post; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 20 November 2026, hundreds of residents held protests in Akobo town, Bilkey Payam (Akobo, Jonglei), over the government's neglect and the absence of medical services in the area. The protests were organized by local activists and community leaders with the protesters noting that the absence of necessary healthcare services has resulted in the death of residents. The protesters called on the government and its partners to provide assistance.

On 19 November 2026, unidentified individuals suspected to be landgrabbers (coded as unidentified armed group) sexually assaulted and then killed a 19-year-old female student in Molobur area of Jebel Lado Payam (location coded to Jebel Lado in Northern Bari, Juba County, Central Equatoria State). The victim had stepped out of a classroom where she was studying with her friends when the incident happened.

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: Around 18 November 2026, (between 17 and 18 November) unidentified armed youth (coded as unidentified communal militia) shot at a police vehicle traveling along the Hiyala-Torit Road in Hiyala Payam (location coded to Hiyala in Torit County, Eastern Equatoria State), injuring 3 people, including a soldier (assumed to be on duty). 1 of the 3 victims later succumbed to her injuries. The vehicle was transporting the body of an individual who had been previously killed in Haforiere on 17 November (coded separately) during an attempted cattle raid and the incident is assumed to be revenge.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: Other: On 18 November 2026, President Salva Kiir of South Sudan issued a decree aired on the state-owned South Sudan Broadcasting Corporation (SSBC), in Juba (Juba, Central Equatoria), reshuffling officials of the SPLM-IO in Western Equatoria, Northern Bahr el Ghazal, and Upper Nile states. In Western Equatoria, President Kiir removed ministers William Andiako Baiki, Isaac Morsali Tion, and Bazia Tito Morisi, appointing Bazia Tito Morisi, Elia Osini Donato, and Isaac Morsali Timon to new roles. He also replaced Gabriel Mbolo Fedriano with Henry Banga Hasaya in Nagero County. In Northern Bahr el Ghazal, President Kiir sacked Aweil West County Commissioner Garang Peter Maduok, replacing him with Abuoi Akok, and appointed Richard Kwac to the state parliament. In Upper Nile, he removed Akiet Chol Lual from the HIV/Aids Commission, appointing Jolli Teng Jolli Lual, and revoked Akier Kuot Thon's appointment in the state parliament without naming a replacement. No reasons were given for these changes.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Sudans Post; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 18 November 2026, SPLM/A-IO soldiers clashed with cattle keepers (likely from the Nyong Nuer community based on location) at a cattle camp in Pachienjok area (Panyijiar, Unity), when the soldiers attempted to recover 46 cattle stolen from Lakes State's Yirol East County. The clash resulted in 6 fatalities and 5 injuries while 16 cows were recovered.

On 17 November 2026, youth from Hiyala (coded as unidentified communal militia) clashed with youth from Haforiere (coded as unidentified communal militia) when the former attempted to raid cattle and carry out a revenge attack in Haforiere (Torit, Eastern Equatoria). The incident resulted in 1 fatality.

On 17 November 2026, members of the Luach-Jang Dinka, Thiik, and Akook/Akok sub-sections of the Aliap section of the Rek Dinka and Deng Achuil communities of Tonj East County signed an agreement in Tonj South town (location coded to Tonj in Tonj South County, Warrap State), to cease hostilities following recent communal clashes between them. The agreement followed a 3-day dialogue between the communities and was facilitated by local authorities in Warrap State's Tonj East County.

Other: On 17 November 2026, suspected Ugandan soldiers confiscated an unknown number of cattle from civilians and carted away an AK-47 rifle belonging to a herder in Nangolojore, near the Uganda-South Sudan border (location coded to Tseretenya in Ikotos County, Eastern Equatoria State). The military accused the South Sudanese herders of grazing in Ugandan territory illegally, thus the seizure. The situation created tension in the area, Ugandan and South Sudanese authorities are planning to engage to ensure the cattle are returned.

On 11 November 2026, a mob killed an SSPDF soldier in Malith Market (location coded to Nyamlell in Gomjuer Centre Payam, Aweil West County, Northern Bahr el Ghazal State) after he got intoxicated and detonated a grenade which killed a civilian during an argument. 6 other people were injured in the explosion, 4 of the wounded civilians were taken to Aweil Civil Hospital while the 2 others were hospitalized in Nyamlel.

On 11 November 2026, members of the Chieng-dumin and Chieng-puol sections of the Lou Nuer community reached an agreement in Lankien (Nyirol, Jonglei) to cease violence between themselves. The agreement follows a clash on 29 October that resulted in 7 fatalities (coded separately). The 2 groups also requested the establishment of a police station in the area. Additionally, they agreed that those found culpable of recent killings be tried in court.

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 10 November 2026, 7 individuals suspected of being from the Logir community from Ikotos County attacked a civilian at his farm on the outskirts of Chukudum Town (Budi, Eastern Equatoria), killing him. The suspects then moved towards Kidepo Valley of Ikotos County. Motivation unknown/not reported. The deceased is likely a Didinga community member who reside in the area.

On 10 November 2026, armed individuals suspected of coming from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (likely from the Murle community who live in the area) attacked 3 fishermen in Baidit Payam (Bor South, Jonglei), injuring 2. Police forces were deployed to pursue the attackers (further information unknown/not reported). Motivation unknown/not reported. Victims are likely members of the Athoc section of the Bor Dinka who reside in the area.

On 9 November 2026, armed youth suspected of coming from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (likely from the Murle community who are based in the area) abducted 2 children in Nyandit area (location coded to Burmath in Akobo County, Jonglei State). One of the abductees later escaped. Victims are likely members of the Yoal subsection of the Mor Section of the Lou Nuer who live in the area.

Other: On 8 November 2026, President Salva Kiir of South Sudan issued a decree in Juba (Juba, Central Equatoria), replacing Western Bahr el Ghazal State Governor Sarah Cleto with Emmanuel Primo Okello. The outgoing governor was then appointed to the Upper House of Parliament's Council of States. The reason for the change was not disclosed.

On 8 November 2026, SSPDF troops from the 4th Infantry Division, led by General Matthew Puljang Top, clashed with a splinter faction of the SSUF/A (described as the South Sudan United Army (SSUA), a military faction of the South Sudan United Front - Nairobi Declaration (SSUF-ND) led by General Dickson Gatluak Jock Nyuot), at the latter's base in Pan-Akuach of Budang Payam (Rubkona, Unity). The SSUF/A splinter faction accused the SSPDF of attacking their base resulting in the clash and thereafter abducting 5 of their soldiers. Casualties unknown.

Around 8 November 2026, (between 7 November - 9 November) suspected SSPDF soldiers sexually assaulted a female before killing her, her husband and child of about 8 years old in Toli, Lobeli Boma of Wonduruba Payam (location coded to Wonduruba in Juba County, Central Equatoria State). Motivation unknown/not reported. The incident created tension in the area with some locals fleeing their houses.

On 8 November 2026, a Rocket Propelled Grenade accidentally exploded in one of the vehicles escorting Yei County Commissioner, 100 meters from the county headquarters in Yei (Yei, Central Equatoria).1 student was killed and 2 NSS officers were wounded.

Other: On 6 November 2026, the President of South Sudan, Salva Kiir, issued a decree aired on the South Sudan Broadcasting Corporation (SSBC) in Juba (Juba, Central Equatoria), relieving Unity State's Koch County Commissioner Gordon Koang Biel of his duties and replacing him with Gatmai Wal. The reason for the replacement was not disclosed.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: Other: On 6 November 2026, South Sudan's President, Salva Kiir, issued a decree in Juba (Juba, Central Equatoria) replacing Unity's State Minister for Local Government and Law Enforcement Agency (SPLM) William Dak Koch, Christine Kubai Kom of Parliamentary and Legal Affairs (SPLM), David Gai Jiechjor Nguweny of Information and Communication (SPLM), Gatluak Gatwech Pin of Culture Youths and Sports (SPLM) Angelina Nyakuoth Jal, Minister for Cooperatives and Rural Development (SPLM), Michael Mathiang Dak, Minister for Roads and Bridges (SPLM). The President then appointed Toch Turoal Jiedor, Minister for Local Government and Law Enforcement Agencies, (SPLM), William Ruei Lok Jakok, Parliamentary and Legal Affairs (SPLM), Gatwech Bipal Both Information, Communication Technology (SPLM) Geng Kuony, Culture, Youth and Sports (SPLM), Wol Chan Ruai, Cooperative and Rural Development (SPLM), Bayak Ruai Wer, Minister for Roads and Bridges, (SPLM) and Stephen Gatjiek, Minister for Land, Housing and Public Utilities (SPLM). Additionally, the President also relieved Luka Chearey Riek, Mayom County Commissioner and Kawai Chany Bol, Guit County (SPLM) off their duties replacing them with James Liyliy Kuol, Mayom County Commissioner, and Simon Diu, Guit County Commissioner. The reason for the replacement was not disclosed. The President also relieved the Unity State's Koch County Commissioner Gordon Koang Biel and the Presidential Special Envoy and Ambassador Albino Mathom Ayuel of their duties. Mathom served as the government's head during mediation between Juba's Government and holdout opposition groups and the decree comes before a resumption of the peace talks in Nairobi, Kenya.

Other: On 6 November 2026, President Salva Kiir of South Sudan issued a decree which was aired on state-owned SSBC TV in Juba (Juba, Central Equatoria), relieving Albino Mathom Ayuel off his duties as presidential special envoy and ambassador. Mathom has been serving as the government's head during mediation between Juba's Government and holdout opposition groups and the decree comes before a resumption of the peace talks in Nairobi, Kenya. The reason for the sacking was not disclosed.

properties.source: BBC News; Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Sudans Post; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 6 November 2026, unidentified armed assailants, some dressed in military uniforms (coded as SSPDF), and suspected to be from Jonglei State (presumed to be Bor Dinka community members who are closer to the area) attacked Murle cattle traders resulting in a clash along the Bor-Juba Highway in Mogiri area of Mangalla South Payam (Juba, Central Equatoria). The incident resulted in 22 fatalities (drawn from the attackers, the traders and locals), an unspecified number were injured while around 600 cattle were raided and taken toward Mangalla area. The clash also resulted in the temporary suspension of transport along the Bor-Juba Highway but security forces were deployed to the area to beef up security.

Change to armed group: On 6 November 2026, at least 764 officers led by Brigadier General Chiok Moses Mun Kuon defected from the Real SPLM to the main opposition SPLM/A-IO at the SPLA-IO Sector Four and Five Infantry Division military headquarters in Wangkuarbiey (location coded to the state's capital Malakal in Malakal County, Upper Nile State), citing leadership failures under Real-SPLM's Pagan Amum. The defection was confirmed in a statement by SPLA-IO's 5th Infantry Division of Sector Four.

On 4 November 2026, an unspecified number of students at the Rumbek University of Science and Technology (RUST) held a protest at the institution in Rumbek (Rumbek Centre, Lakes), issuing a 1 week ultimatum to the government to pay academic and non-academic staff their salary arrears so that learning can resume.

Property destruction: On 1 November 2026, unidentified individuals (coded as unidentified communal militia) set the house of a UNMISS staff on fire in Tambura, near the County Commisioner's residence (Tambura, Western Equatoria). Further details unknown/not reported. Motivation unknown/not reported.

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 29 October 2026, at least 3 armed individuals suspected of coming from Haforiere (likely Lotuko ethnic militia based on those who reside in the area) clashed with local youths in the area, raided and killed an unspecified number of cattle at a kraal in Hiyala (Torit, Eastern Equatoria). The clash happened in an area between Loguruny and Haforiere resulting in 1 fatality. Both groups are likely members of the Lotuko community who reside in the area.

On 29 October 2026, members of the Cie-Pual and Cie-Khertut sections of the Cie-Dumin community (coded as unidentified clan militia) clashed in Lankien (Nyirol, Jonglei), resulting in 7 fatalities and 3 injuries. The clash was a retaliation following a past incident in August 2026 when a Cie-Dumin member killed a Cie-Pual (further information unknown/not reported). Following the recent incident, local authorities organized dialogue between the 2 groups to de-escalate the matter.

On 27 October 2026, armed individuals suspected to be Buya/Boya community members shot at a vehicle belonging to a road construction company between Lobira in Ikotos County and Tuhubak in Torit County along the Torit-Kapoeta Highway location coded to Lobira (Huma boma), (Ikotos County, Eastern Equatoria State). The incident left a soldier from the Internal Security Bureau (ISB) of the National Security Service (NSS) dead while a Sudanese national, was injured. The victims were returning from an assessment of the Juba-Torit-Kapoeta-Nadapal Highway for an upcoming construction, the deceased was among officers escorting the group. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 26 October 2026, youth from Kapoeta South County (presumed to be from the Toposa community) clashed with local youth (likely from the Didinga community based on location) in Marira Boma of Ngauro/Lauru Payam (Budi, Eastern Equatoria). The clash followed an attempted a cattle raid by youths from Kapoeta South County at a cattle camp, 3 persons were killed and 3 others were injured. A local chief disputed the fatalities noting that only 1 individual was killed.

On 26 October 2026, an unidentified assailant dressed in military uniform (coded as unidentified armed group) stormed a pub where he randomly shot at the revelers in Tambura, near the IDP camp (Tambura, Western Equatoria). 1 person was killed and unspecified number of others were injured. Following the incident, local authorities imposed a 2200hrs-0600hrs curfew to hunt for the suspect. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 25 October 2026, (as reported) an unspecified number of students from Nile Modern Secondary School held a protest along Kokora Road in Juba (location coded to Juba in Juba County, Central Equatoria State), against an unspecified cause. The protest turned violent (further details unknown/not reported) leading police to intervene by firing shots in the air. Normalcy later returned to the area.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Sudans Post
properties.notes: On 25 October 2026, unidentified armed individuals (coded as unidentified communal militia) attacked Tambura (Tambura, Western Equatoria), killing 4 civilians and injuring 1 other. This incident and another one on 1 November (coded separately) have led to displacement of civilians in the area. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 24 October 2026, youth from Uror County (presumed to be Lou Nuer community members) pursued and engaged in an armed clash with unidentified individuals (presumed to be Murle community militia who had raided cattle in Uror on 21 October (coded separately)) at an undisclosed location, (coded to Yuai in Uror County, Jonglei State). The incident resulted in 3 fatalities and 7 injuries.

On 23 October 2026, youth from Akobo County (likely members of the Lou Nuer community who live in the area) who were pursuing abductors from the Murle community from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area confronted the latter at an unspecified location (location coded to Walgak in Akobo County, Jonglei State), and rescued 2 of the abductees. 1 of the abductees was killed by the Murle during the incident. The 3 abductees, all girls, had been abducted on 19 October 2026 in Akobo County (coded separately).

On 23 October 2026, an unidentified assailant (coded as unidentified armed group) ambushed a humanitarian vehicle traveling from Juba to Magwi along the Torit - Magwi Road, near Kormush, through Imurok in Torit (location coded to Imoruk in Torit County, Eastern Equatoria State), leaving 1 humanitarian worker with a gunshot wound. Motivation unknown/not reported.

Looting: On 21 October 2026, Murle ethnic militia raided an unspecified number of cattle in Juet village, east of Yuai, (Uror, Jonglei). Victims of the raid are likely Lou Nuer community members who reside in the area. Local youth pursued the raiders (coded separately).

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 19 October 2026, armed individuals suspected of being Murle community members from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area abducted 3 girls (likely from the Lou Nuer community who live in the area) in a forested area known as Tut, between Walgak and Lankien, (location coded to Walgak in Akobo County, Jonglei State). Local officials confirmed the abduction noting that it was a violation of a peace agreement between communities in the region. Local youth pursued the attackers and on 23 October 2026 rescued 2 abductees while 1 was shot dead (incident coded separately).

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Miraya; Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 18 October 2026, unidentified armed assailants suspected to be NAS militants stormed a market in Leikor Boma, Kangapo (Kajo Keji, Central Equatoria), where they shot and killed 4 civilians. The attackers also looted shops in the area and set several houses on fire. SSPDF (military) responded to the scene and pursued the perpetrators but further information is unknown/not reported. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 17 October 2026, armed youth from Ayod County, Jonglei State, (likely Gawaar Nuer community members who live in the area) clashed with armed youth suspected of being from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (likely from the Murle community based on location), at an unspecified location in a bush between Duk and Ayod counties (location coded to Ayod in Ayod County, Jonglei State). The Gawaar Nuer youth had pursued the Murle after the latter had abducted 2 children in Ayod on 16 October 2026 (coded separately). During the clash, 1 of the abductors was killed and the abductees were rescued.

On 16 October 2026, youth suspected of coming from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (likely from the Murle community based on location) abducted 2 children (likely from the Gawaar Nuer community who live in the area) from a residence at an unspecified location in Ayod County (location coded to Ayod in Ayod County, Jonglei State), while their guardian was in the farm. Local youth pursued the attackers and rescued the abductees a day later (coded separately).

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; VOA
properties.notes: On 16 October 2026, SSPDF (military) soldiers clashed with Nuer community militia (described as 'White Army' militants) in Nasir (Luakpiny/Nasir, Upper Nile), resulting in the death of 13 soldiers and 3 - 4 civilians while at least 16 civilians and 7 soldiers were injured. The incident left 20,000 civilians displaced from the area. According to Nasir County Commissioner James Gatluak, the clashes targeted civilians in the main market, airstrip, riverside, and his office, however, SSPDF spokesperson Major General Lul Ruai Koang noted that the clashes erupted when an SSPDF senior officer and his bodyguards were ambushed and killed following a session in a traditional court over a marital dispute involving the senior officer and another SSPDF soldier. One source has also noted that the commissioner claimed that another attack occurred on 17 October 2026, but further details are unknown/not reported. Fatalities coded as 16 (13 soldiers + 3 civilians).

On 13 October 2026, at least 49 NAS members led by Captain Likambo Stephen Remo along with an unspecified number of SPLM-In Opposition/SPLA-IO soldiers defected into the SSPDF (military) and were received by Major General John Lual Tong, the SSPDF Area Commander for Greater Yei, in Morobo (Morobo, Central Equatoria). This followed the signing of a peace agreement on 17 September 2026 at the Bazi border with the Democratic Republic of Congo.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Sudans Post
properties.notes: On 12 October 2026, clashes erupted between 2 groups of the Lou Mawien/Ariik sub-section of the Akop section of the Rek Dinka in Alabek Payam (Tonj North, Warrap), resulting in at least 20 fatalities, 38 injuries, and the displacement of an unknown number of civilians. One source reports 40 deaths and over 100 injuries. According to local officials, the incident erupted following incitement by individuals who recently returned to the area and is connected to previous clashes fuelled by ethnic disputes, especially the latest one on 28 September 2026 (coded separately). Normalcy has since returned to the area. Security forces have set up roadblocks along roads leading to the area and have arrested 3 suspects who attempted to transport ammunition into the area.

On 11 October 2026, at least 160 health workers held a protest at an unspecified location in Panyijiar County (location coded to Panyijiar in Panyijiar County, Unity State), over 4 months' salary delays by the County Health Department (CHD) and UNICEF. The County Health Director held a meeting with the protesters pledging that the issue would be resolved in the coming week.

On 10 October 2026, 2 youth groups (described as Isaru and Hiyu sections and likely from the Lotuko/Otuho community who live in the area) clashed in Oronyo/Loronyo village (Torit, Eastern Equatoria), resulting in the death of 1 person and injuries to several others while 18 houses were set on fire and destroyed. The incident also left several individuals from the Hiyu side displaced and created tension in the area. The incident is suspected to be politically motivated as both sections have pre-existing communal disputes that likely triggered the clash. Following the incident, on 13 October 2026, local officials facilitated a peace dialogue between the 2 sections with several attendees pledging to co-exist peacefully. On 15 October 2026, a suspect surrendered himself to police on allegations of committing the murder during the clash.

properties.source: AFP; Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Miraya; Radio Tamazuj; Sudans Post
properties.notes: On 9 October 2026, SSPDF (military) forces clashed with members of the NAS splinter group, Lo Buron faction, in Logwerele area, Logoko Boma of Wonduruba Payam, near Wonduruba (Juba, Central Equatoria), resulting in the death of at least 9 SSPDF soldiers, unspecified fatalities on the LoBuron faction (coded as 3) and 9 civilians. Between 17-20 individuals were also injured in the attack. Additionally, an SSPDF vehicle was later destroyed after falling into an ambush set by the LoBuron militants while traveling to Lainya to obtain medicine for injured soldiers. The incident happened soon after Governor General Augustino Jadalla Kamilo had visited the area. The SSPDF troops involved in the incident are under the command of former NAS leader, General Kennedy Kenyi Abdu, also referred to as Kenyi Warrior, who switched allegiance to the SSPDF in June 2023. Fatalities coded as 21 (9 SSPDF + 3 LoBuron + 9 civilians).

properties.source: AFP; Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Miraya; Radio Tamazuj; Sudans Post
properties.notes: On 9 October 2026, unidentified armed individuals dressed in military attire (likely soldiers) attacked Wonduruba Payam (Juba, Central Equatoria), where they shot and used machetes to kill at least 27 civilians, mainly youths. 4 other civilians were injured during the incident while at least 100 others have been displaced from the area. The incident followed an armed clash between the NAS splinter group (LoBuron faction) and SSPDF soldiers on the outskirts of Wonduruba on 9 October 2026 (coded separately) and is suspected to be a retaliation by either of the 2 groups.

Looting: On 5 October 2026, unidentified armed assailants (coded as unidentified armed group) ambushed a private vehicle and a lorry in Mankaro (20 miles from Yei) of Loka Boma, near Loka (Lainya, Central Equatoria). The assailants ordered the civilians to alight and march into a nearby bush before looting their items, including clothes. They then fired into the air leading the civilians to scamper for safety. Following the incident, government forces were alerted and responded to the scene.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Sudans Post; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 3 October 2026, armed individuals suspected of being members of the Nielniel sub-section of the Pakam section of the Agar Dinka shot at civilians in Deng-Nhial residential area of Rumbek Town Payam (Rumbek Centre, Lakes), killing 1 and injuring another. The incident is suspected to be a revenge attack following a past event (further details unknown/not reported), but the victims were not the intended targets.

On 3 October 2026, for a third day, SSPDF (military) soldiers clashed with NAS militants in Latta area (Yei, Central Equatoria), resulting in the deaths of 15 people including 13 soldiers, 2 NAS, injuries of 7 soldiers and 3 NAS. The clash erupted when SSPDF soldiers returned to the area to retrieve the bodies of their dead officers incurred during their previous 2 altercations with NAS militants on 1 October 2026 (coded separately). NAS militants also carted away assorted weapons left by the SSPDF and accused the latter of setting to fire civilian houses, looting property and causing displacement of civilians in the area.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Sudans Post
properties.notes: On 2 October 2026, 3 armed individuals, 2 SSPDF (military) soldiers from the Tiger Division, and 1 police officer, shot at a passenger vehicle traveling to Juba from Akon town of Warrap State at Pacong (Rumbek East, Lakes), resulting in the death of a mother. Motivation unknown/not reported. The officers have since been arrested.

On 2 October 2026, members of the Akop section of the Rek Dinka clashed with members of the Luach-Jang Dinka (described as the Thiet of Luanjang/Luach-Jang of Nabagok Payam) in Tonj East, near Romich (Tonj East, Warrap), resulting in an unspecified number of casualties. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 1 October 2026, armed individuals (coded as unidentified communal militia) raided 100 cattle from traders along the Juba-Bor Highway, on the outskirts of Mogiri Town (Juba, Central Equatoria). The traders pursued the attackers who had moved towards Mangalla Town, recovered 50 of the stolen animals, and killed one of the assailants. The traders were from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (likely from the Murle community based on location) and were traveling to Juba to sell the animals.

On 1 October 2026, SSPDF (military) soldiers clashed with NAS in Latta area, west of Ombaci Boma (Yei, Central Equatoria), resulting in an unspecified number of casualties. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 1 October 2026, for a second time, SSPDF (military) soldiers carried out an operation from Senema toward Kula-Rima, near Latta (Yei, Central Equatoria), resulting in an armed engagement with NAS militants that left an unspecified number of casualties. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 30 September 2026, for the third day, attackers (described as Pan Arek and coded as Dinka ethnic militia based on incident location) killed an individual (described as being from the Pan Kuei Section and coded as Dinka ethnic group based on incident location) in Alabek Payam (Tonj North, Warrap), at least 16 people were killed and 37 others were injured. 16 fatalities split across 2 days, coded as 8 for this event.

Around 30 September 2026 (as reported), representatives of the Luach-Jang Dinka community met with those of the Akook sub-section of the Aliap section of the Rek Dinka at an unspecified location in Tonj East (location coded to Romich in Tonj East County, Warrap State) where they engaged in a peace dialogue and later signed a communique to stop violence and emphasized the importance of the government giving early alerts about possible conflicts, encouraging voluntary disarmament, and offering special protection for women and children. The dialogue was facilitated by Warrap State authorities and the United Nations Mission in South Sudan.

On 29 September 2026, 5 unidentified armed assailants dressed in military attire (coded as unidentified armed group) shot at the vehicle of Jonglei State's minister of parliamentary affairs in the vicinity of Mogiri military post along the Juba-Bor Highway, near Mogiri (Juba, Central Equatoria). The minister's driver drove for a short distance before the vehicle stalled due to the damage it had incurred. The 2 occupants then fled the vehicle and the attackers looted their items from the vehicle. There were no casualties.

On 29 September 2026, for the second day, armed youth (described as Pan Arek and coded as Dinka ethnic militia based on incident location) attacked individuals (described as being from the Pan Kuei Section of Alabek Payam and coded as Dinka ethnic militia based on incident location) in Alabek Payam (Tonj North, Warrap), at least 16 people were killed and 37 others were injured. 16 fatalities split across 2 days, coded as 8 for this event.

On 28 September 2026, an individual (coded as unidentified armed group) attacked and sexually assaulted a 10-year-old girl who was herding cattle in a forest in Thiangtok village (location coded to Cueibet in Cueibet County, Lakes State). The perpetrator was later arrested on 2 October 2026.

On 28 September 2026, two groups of Dinka clashed after an individual (described as being from the Pan Kuei Section of Executive Chief Marol Akech and coded as Dinka ethnic militia based on location of the incident) killed an individual (described as being from the Pan Arek Clan of the Muoc Section and coded as Dinka ethnic group based on location of incident) in Alabek Payam (Tonj North, Warrap), as a retaliation following the death of a relative 2 years ago, during which more than 17 people were killed (no further details provided).

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Sudans Post
properties.notes: On 27 September 2026, a clash ensued between 2 sub-clans of the Aniin section of the Agar Dinka of Rumbek North County in Amer Village and spread to Mathiang Village (Rumbek Centre, Lakes), resulting in at least 5 fatalities and 4 injuries. The incident was caused by the death of an individual on 26 September 2026 after he had been in hospital for 2 years after sustaining injuries during a clash described as the Fih and Anin clash. Security forces were deployed to the area (means unspecified) and restored normalcy.

On 27 September 2026, SPLM-IO claimed to have clashed with youths led by a spiritual leader called Gai (Gaw), coded as unidentified armed group, as they were headed to the border area between Pankiyang county and Ruweng Administrative Area (location coded to Pakwar, Panyikang, Upper Nile). The group were mobilized from Jonglei and were headed to the Wunkur area with the suspected aim of raiding cattle. 2 persons were killed, 6 others were injured, and 22 members of the group were arrested by the SPLM-IO who claimed to have stopped the advancement.

On 27 September 2026, Pakam section of Agar Dinka militias from Rumbek North clashed in a revenge-related incident at Matangaii Payam, Rumbek Central Payam (Rumbek County, Lakes). 5 people were killed, and several others were injured.

On 27 September 2026, a suspected Murle ethnic militia attacked a group of Lou Nuer fishermen in Mantor Village, located between the Walgak and Boung areas, Walgak Payam (Akobo County, Jonglei). Two people were killed.

On 26 September 2026, an unidentified armed individual (coded as unidentified clan militia) shot and killed another individual over livestock disputes in the Loyoro village, coded to Narus (Narus Payam, Eastern Equatoria).

On 26 September 2026, a suspected Akook clan militia (likely Akook sub-section of the Alip section of the Rek Dinka based in the location) shot and killed a member of the Thiik (likely Thiik sub-section of the Aliap section of the Rek Dinka based on location) in his garden in Chol-Nyin Village, Malual-cum Payam (Tonj East Count, Warrap).

On 25 September 2026, two unidentified communal militia (described as two sections from Paveen and Juach ) clashed at the Wunkuel Ador cattle camp in Jal-Wau East, Ayak Payam (Tonj North County, Warrap). Three people were killed, 11 people were injured from the Paveen side, and six others were wounded from the Juach side.

On 24 September 2026, police clashed with three armed men (coded as an unidentified armed group) near the home of the National Minister of Animal Resources and Fisheries in Juba (Juba county, Central Equatoria state). The police responded to an attack in which the armed men assaulted the minister's wife, looted over 3 million SSP, three guns, seven phones, and other personal belongings from the residence. The family members were threatened at gunpoint. During the attack, the assailants stated that they were suffering because of the government. There were no casualties.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); National Salvation Front; Radio Dabanga; Radio Miraya; Radio Tamazuj; Sudan Akhbar; Sudans Post; The City Review (South Sudan); VOA
properties.notes: On 24 September 2026, gunmen suspected to be members of NAS ambushed and set fire to a commercial bus operated by Bebeto Coach, which was traveling to Uganda along the Juba-Nimule highway near Lakarakak, between Nyerjebe and Kubi (located in Kubi, Juba county, Central Equatoria state). At least one Ugandan was killed, and 8 to 14 people, including an off-duty security officer who was a passenger, were injured. Valuables and passengers' belongings were looted. Between 7 and 14 individuals (with one source claiming 20) were abducted, but 6 to 12 hostages, including 2 Sudanese, 2 Ugandans, and 1 Rwandan, were later released. The bus was carrying 44 - 60 passengers, including two conductors and the driver. A NAS spokesperson denied involvement in the attack and instead accused the SSPDF.

On 23 September 2026, an unidentified armed group abducted three children, aged between 8 and 12, in Kapoeta East county (location coded to Narus, the Admin2 HQ in Eastern Equatoria state). The whereabouts of the abducted children remain unknown/unreported.

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 23 September 2026, two armed groups from Haforiere and Hiyala payams (likely from the Lotuko community inhabiting both areas) clashed in Hiyala, Hiyala Payam (Torit county, Eastern Equatoria state), in an act of revenge. One person was killed, and another was wounded.

On 23 September 2026, an unidentified armed individual (coded as unidentified armed group) killed an INGO-contracted security guard (presumed to be off-duty) at the entrance of a medical facility in Hiyala (Torit, Eastern Equatoria). Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 23 September 2026, a group of staff from the health ministry protested in central Malakal Payam (Malakal County, Upper Nile). The motive for the protest was linked to a dispute over payment of salary arrears.

On 23 September 2026, students from the chapel school protested against school authorities after their teachers had been suspended at New Site, Northern Bari Payam (Kapoeta East County, Eastern Equatoria). The students clashed with the security personnel (coded as police officers). Six people were injured, including a student.

On 23 September 2026, an unidentified clan militia opened fire on fishers in the Burbiei area, Jikmir Payam, along the Sobat River (location coded to nearest known location, Mading, Luakpiny/Nasir County, Upper Nile). Casualties unknown. The incident is linked to a revenge attack (further details unknown/not reported).
On 23 September 2026, an unidentified armed group ambushed a military vehicle traveling along Apet-Rumbek Road in Malek Payam (Rumbek Centre County, Lakes). Two people were injured.

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; Sudans Post; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 22 September 2026, assailants, suspected to be youth from Ngauro Payam (coded as an unidentified armed group due to the area's diverse clans), stabbed, shot and killed an SSPDF soldier who was burning charcoal in Kimotong, Kimotong Payam (Budi county, Eastern Equatoria state). The motive remains unknown/unreported. The soldier's gun was stolen.

On 22 September 2026, armed members of the Jie community from Jebel Boma killed a Murle cattle keeper and a 10-year-old boy at a cattle camp on the outskirts of Muruou/Marow village (coded to Labarab, the nearest area to Marow, in Pibor county, Jonglei state). The motive remains unknown/unreported.

On 22 September 2026, local people staged a protest at the United Nations (UN) House in Rejaf Payam (Juba, Central Equatoria), demanding compensation for the injury suffered by a goat that was suspected to have been hit by a UN agency vehicle.

On 22 September 2026, unidentified armed individuals suspected to be from the Jie community attempted to raid an unspecified number of cattle in Giro village/Maruwa Hills under Verteth Payam (Pibor, Jonglei). 2 people were killed.
On 22 September 2026, an unidentified armed individual was suspected to have killed a member of the military (SSPDF) near Camp 15 (Budi, Eastern Equatoria). Motivation of the killing is not known.

Around 21 September 2026 (between 21 September - 22 September), the National Security Service (police) clashed with the SSPDF unified forces in Rubkona, Rubkona (Rubkona county, Unity state). One police officer was killed, and three people were wounded. The clash stemmed from a misunderstanding between the two groups following a road accident last month.

On 21 September 2026, armed assailants, suspected to be from the Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle), ambushed and killed three students and abducted a 10-year-old child while they were en route to Nyirol county (location coded to Lankien, the Admin 2 HQ in Thol payam, Jonglei state). The whereabouts of the abducted child remain unknown/unreported.

On 21 September 2026, unidentified armed individuals suspected to be from the Murle community were suspected of ambushing and attacking members of the Nuer community in Piath area (Nyirol, Jonglei). 3 people were killed, one person was injured, and three children were abducted.

On 21 September 2026, a member of the military (SSPDF) was suspected of killing a member of the National Security Service (police) at a checkpoint in the vicinity of the UNMISS compound in Eastern Malakal Payam (coded as Hai Sah, Malakal, Upper Nile). Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 21 September 2026, two government security personnel (military) clashed with each other, close to the Unity Oil Field, in Budang Payam (coded as Palpiny, Rubkona, Unity). 1 person was killed and three others were injured. The motivation behind the clash is not known.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Miraya; Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 20 September 2026, armed men suspected of being NAS abducted two MSF staff members, described as humanitarian and health workers, and looted valuables and personal belongings from MSF vehicles at gunpoint at an unspecified location close to Yei town in Yei Payam (Yei county, Central Equatoria state). The abductees were released after 24 hours, MSF suspended their activities in Yei County following the incident.

On 20 September 2026, armed individuals, suspected to have come from Ying Payam (coded as unidentified armed group), were suspected of killing the Executive Chief of the Barmach area in the Ulang Payam (Upper Nile). The motivation of the attack is suspected to be revenge.

On 20 September 2026, unidentified armed individuals abducted two humanitarian aid workers, one from an International Non-Governmental Organization and the other from a local Non-Governmental Organization, along the Yei-Tore Road, in Tore Payam (Yei, Central Equatoria). The abductors demanded ransom, which they did not receive. The abductees were released the following day. Injuries unknown/not reported.

Looting: On 20 September 2026, unidentified armed individuals suspected to be from the Muok section of the Rek Dinka raided an unspecified number of cattle from local people (likely from members of Thony section of the Rek Dinka community based on location) in Ameth Chok village (Tonj South, Warrap). The local people retrieved the raided cattle (no clashes reported). There were no casualties.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; VOA
properties.notes: On 19 September 2026, two units of the SSPDF, the demolition unit also described as military intelligence and the anti-land grabbing force (described as land grabbers) exchanged gunfire during a land demolition at Molobur area in Ladu/Lado, Northern Bari payam (Juba county, Central Equatoria state), in what has been described as a case of miscoordination. One SSPDF member was shot and wounded. Over the years, local authorities in Juba county payams have accused senior officers of involvement in land grabbing.

On 19 September 2026, government security forces clashed with civilians along the Juba-Terekeka Road in Northern Bari Payam (coded as Gurei, Juba, Central Equatoria) during an eviction and demolition drive in the area (likely caused by the civilians' resistance to the demolition drive). 1 person was killed and 3 others were injured.

On 19 September 2026, unidentified armed individuals were suspected to have ambushed and attacked cattle traders in Padiet Payam (coded as Duk Padiet, Duk, Jonglei). 2 people were killed, one woman and two girls were abducted, and one person went missing. The motivation behind the attack is unknown.

On 19 September 2026, unidentified armed assailants suspected to be from the Bor Dinka community raided over 100 cattle from members of the Murle community, and clashed with them, in the Manyabol area (coded as Manyabol (West), Pibor, Jonglei). One person was injured.

On 18 September 2026, NAS members abducted an Episcopal priest from his garden in Morobo, Morobo payam (Morobo county, Central Equatoria state). The priest was released on September 20 after his family paid a ransom that included two goats, sacks of beans, and money.

Around 18 September 2026 (as reported), members of community watchdogs (informal police) killed a 24-year-old suspected thief whom they beat to death in the Hal Atlabara neighborhood of Nzara in Nzara Centre (Nzara county, Western Equatoria state). Six people were arrested. The incident has sparked anger and fear among local residents. These community watchdog groups were originally established to assist with minor cases.

On 17 September 2026, an unconfirmed number of military personnel (SSPDF) deserted their barracks and exchanged gunfire with security guards after attempting to break into an ammunition store in Maiwut Payam (Maiwut, Upper Nile). 1 person was killed and two others were injured. The motivation behind deserting the barracks and attempting to break into an ammunition store is unknown.

On 17 September 2026, armed young people suspected to be from the Toposa community killed a man from the Didinga community in Nauro Payam (coded as Lauru, Budi, Eastern Equatoria) over a gold mining dispute.

Looting: On 16 September 2026, armed members of the Ayiel sub-section of the Langdiing section of the Gok Dinka community raided an unspecified number of cattle from members of the Ruop section of the Agar Dinka community in Mayom Payam (Rumbek Centre, Lakes). There were no injuries.

On 15 September 2026, armed men, suspected to be from Kapoeta North in Eastern Equatoria state (likely members of the Toposa community, who predominantly inhabit Kapoeta North), attacked Murle pastoralists at Gero in Maruo (location coded to Labarab the nearest area to Maruo/Marow Payam, Pibor county, Jonglei state). Two children were abducted, and around 500 cattle were raided. The Commissioner of Kapoeta North County denied any involvement of local youths in the attack.

Movement of forces: Around 15 September 2026 (between 1 September - 28 September), the Uganda People's Defense Forces (UPDF) conducted unauthorized patrols in multiple areas of Magwi County, including Abuloro (location coded to Magwi, the Admin2 HQ, Eastern Equatoria state), as well as Pogee/Pugee, Patoko, Adodi, Paragadwanya and Melijo (each coded separately). An unspecified number of farmers were displaced.

Movement of forces: Around 15 September 2026 (between 1 September - 28 September), the Uganda People's Defense Forces (UPDF) conducted unauthorized patrols in multiple areas of Magwi County, including Pogee/Pugee in Pajok (Magwi county, Eastern Equatoria state) as well as Abuloro, Patoko, Adodi, Paragadwanya and Melijo (each coded separately). An unspecified number of farmers were displaced.

On 15 September 2026, members of the Thiik sub-section and Akook sub-section of the Aliap section of the Rek Dinka community were suspected to have clashed with each other in Ananatak Payam (Tonj East, Warrap) in a suspected case of revenge attack spurred by previous clashes (coded separately). 12 people were killed and six others were injured.
Looting: On 15 September 2026, a group of people suspected to be from the Jie community, from Eastern Equatoria, raided cattle in Verteth area (Pibor, Jonglei). There were no injuries.

On 15 September 2026, a group of people suspected to be from the Jie community, from Eastern Equatoria, abducted two children in Giro village under Verteth Payam (Pibor, Jonglei). There were no injuries. Motivation of the abduction is unknown.

On 15 September 2026, suspected Gok Dinka militia raided six cattle and clashed with members of the Agar Dinka militia in Citcok Payam (Cueibet, Lakes). 1 person was killed and another was injured. The members of the Agar Dinka community recovered three cattle.

On 15 September 2026, armed young people from the Muok section of the Rek Dinka community from Malual Muok Boma shot and wounded a member of the Thony section of the Rek Dinka community in Manyang-Ngok Payam (Tonj South, Warrap). Four people were injured. Motivation of the attack is unknown.

On 15 September 2026, unidentified armed assailants suspected to be from the Lotuko community clashed with military personnel (SSPDF) along the Torit-Kapoeta Road in the Lobir area under Torit Payam (Eastern Equatoria). There were no injuries. Motivation of the clash is unknown.
On 14 September 2026, the Guzule age set of the Murle clashed with the Kurenen age set of the Murle in Lokorthuk/Kongor village, Likuangole (Pibor, Jonglei). Two people were killed.

On 14 September 2026, the Luch Jang Dinka, together with the Adoor subsection of the Jalwau section of the Rek Dinka, attacked civilians in the Akook subsection of the Aliap section of the Rek Dinka in Paliang payam (Tonj East, Warrap). Eight people were killed, and about 18 people were wounded.

Other: On 13 September 2026, South Sudan's transitional government announced in Juba (Juba county, Central Equatoria state) the postponement of the December 2026 elections and an extension of the transitional period for two years to implement critical remaining protocols in the R-ARCSS. These include the permanent constitution process, the census, and the registration of political parties. The extension will begin in February 2025 and end in February 2026.

Around 13 September 2026 (between 13 - 14 September), members of SPLM-IO arrested, tortured and wounded 17 members of the Episcopal Church at Wath-Lel/Wath-Lelo in Jur River county (location coded to Roc Roc Dong, where the SPLM-IO has a military base in Western Bahr el Ghazal state) three pastors were critically wounded and received treatment at a hospital. SPLM IO is accused of closing 29 churches since 2018 and mistreating Christians. While the SPLM-IO commander confirmed the arrests, he denied the accusations of torture, stating that the action was taken after the local community reported misconduct by the Episcopal members, including the alleged rape of 40 girls.
On 13 September 2026, suspected members of NAS militants shot and wounded three civilians in Wonduruba payam (Juba, Central Equatoria) for unknown or unreported reasons.

On 13 September 2026, armed youth from the Akook subsection of the Aliap section of the Rek Dinka from Ngabagok attacked civilians and looted cattle from the Thiik subsection of the Aliap section of the Rek Dinka at Ugel cattle camp in the Malual Chum/Malual-Cum area (Tonj East, Warrap). Four people were killed, and seven people were wounded.
On 11 September 2026, suspected armed Murle youths wounded one person and abducted two Lou Nuer girls who were walking with a man in Walgak Payam (Akobo, Jonglei).

On 10 September 2026, dozens of people staged a protest in Bunj, Buong payam (Maban county, Upper Nile state), demanding the immediate removal of the Maban County Commissioner. They called for the return of public vehicles, money, and property extorted from traders and humanitarian organizations. The Commissioner was accused of leading a campaign that caused a scarcity of goods, increased commodity prices, abuse of power, and embezzlement of funds. However, the Commissioner denied any involvement in malpractice and instead accused community leaders, youth groups, and the women's union of wrongdoing.

On 10 September 2026, the Cie Duop/Duop subsection of the Bul Nuer clashed among themselves in the Kiech Kuon area of Kiech Kuon (Luakpiny/Nasir, Upper Nile) in retaliation for an incident that occurred on 2 September (coded separately). Casualties are unknown.

On 10 September 2026, armed Gok Dinka suspected of being from Cueibet county in Lakes state attacked civilians and looted cattle from the Thony section of the Rek Dinka at Manyang-Ngok Payam (Tonj South, Warrap). One person was killed, one person was wounded, and two people were abducted and their whereabouts is unreported.

On 8 September 2026, government joint security forces (military) arrested 25 individuals described as suspected bandits in Kapoeta South (location coded to Kapoeta, Kapoeta Town, Eastern Equatoria state). The detainees are accused of harassing, ambushing, killing, and looting vehicles along the Kapoeta-Torit, Narus, and Camp 15-Ngauro roads.

On 8 September 2026, security forces (military) arrested 100 youths described as members of gang groups in Malakal, Malakal North payam (Malakal county, Upper Nile state), in an effort to control the unruly youths who were disrupting peace.
On 8 September 2026, armed youths suspected to be from Cie Lath killed three members of the Bool/Bol Mor subsection of the Lou Nuer at Matot/Motot payam (Uror, Jonglei) in a revenge incident.

On 8 September 2026, suspected armed youths from Luch Jang abducted a boy and looted an unspecified number of cattle at Midheer cattle camp in Pagor (Tonj East, Warrap). The youths from Akook retrieved the cattle. No interactions were recorded, and the whereabouts of the abductee remain unknown.

On 8 September 2026, people suspected of being from Paweng Payam (coded as unidentified clan militia) attacked Luch Jang Dinka at Paliang (Tonj East, Warrap). Seven people were killed in retaliation for an incident that occurred on 7 September, though no further information is available on the incident.
On 7 September 2026, suspected armed Murle groups ambushed and killed two Nuer individuals walking from Malakal to Nyirol in Chuil payam (Nyirol County, Jonglei) for unknown or unreported reasons.

On 6 September 2026, an unspecified number of refugees from the DRC, Ethiopia, and Sudan staged a protest at the Gorom Refugee Settlement Camp on the outskirts of Juba (Juba county, Central Equatoria state) against the UNHCR and WFP's decision to reduce the food aid rations.

On 6 September 2026, chiefs, ministers, lawmakers, commissioners, women, and cattle keepers representing Panyijiar county in Unity state (likely Nyuong/Nong Nuer, who predominantly inhabit the county), Yirol East county in Lakes state (likely Ciec Dinka and Atuot communities), and Rumbek Central/Centre county (likely Agar Dinka, who reside in the county) signed a peace agreement in Yirol East ( location coded to Nyang, Lekakedu payam, Lakes state). The peace dialogue was facilitated by the Ministry of Peace Building in collaboration with international partners and resulted in a peace agreement with 21 resolutions aimed at mitigating cattle raids, and revenge attacks and encouraging peaceful coexistence between the communities.

On 5 September 2026, suspected NAS militants abducted an NGO staff member along the Yei-Tore road in Otogo payam (location coded to Ombasi, Yei, Central Equatoria). The abductee was en route to negotiate the release of 2 colleagues who had been abducted on 4 September (coded separately).

On 5 September 2026, pastoralists (both likely Nuer based on the location) clashed during an attempted raid at a cattle settlement in Rubkona (Rubkona, Unity). One attacker was killed, and an unspecified number of livestock were recovered.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Miraya; Radio Tamazuj
properties.notes: Around 4 September 2026 (as reported), the Commissioner of Raja County claimed that RSF took control and began exploiting natural resources in Kafia Kinji/Kafia Kingi (Raja county, Western Bahr el Ghazal state). The SSPDF commander in Raja County, Brigadier General, denied the presence of RSF in South Sudan. No clashes reported.

On 4 September 2026, NAS militants abducted 2 NGO aid workers at an unnamed location along the Yei-Tore Road, near Baranga (Yei, Central Equatoria). The militants later abducted a third aid worker who was negotiating the release of the 2 abductees.

On 4 September 2026, NAS militants abducted two NGO staff from a car along the Yei-Maridi Road in Otogo Payam (location coded to Ombasi, Yei, Central Equatoria). The abductees were among four staff members on a field mission at Logo village.

On 4 September 2026, suspected Murle armed youth from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area abducted one boy and looted an unspecified number of cattle at Karukomuge, Karukomuge (Kapoeta North, Eastern Equatoria).

On 4 September 2026, armed youth from the Pagok subsection of the Langdiing section of the Gok Dinka attacked Abiriu payam (Cueibet, Lakes) in retaliation for an incident that occurred on 2 September (coded separately). There were no casualties. Security forces were deployed to the area to normalize the situation.

On 3 September 2026, members of Cheing Malek clashed among themselves in Nasit, Nasir payam (location coded to Nasir, Luakpiny/Nasir, Upper Nile), in a revenge incident. 4 people were killed, and 4 others were wounded.
On 3 September 2026, the Palong and Pachol sections of the Rek Dinka clashed in Tonj (Tonj South, Warrap) for unknown or unreported reasons. 1 person was killed, and 2 others were wounded.

On 3 September 2026, an unidentified armed group of three clashed with and opened fire on SSPDF soldiers stationed at their base in Yambio Town (Yambio, Western Equatoria) for unknown or unreported reasons. There were no casualties.

On 2 September 2026, people from two unidentified payams in Cueibet county (both actors are likely Gok Dinka, who predominantly inhabit Cueibet county) clashed at Cueibet in Malou Pec (Cueibet county, Lakes state).
