At least five people were killed. 15 were wounded. An unspecified number of people were displaced.

Looting: On 2 September 2026, suspected armed Turkana youths from Kenya looted an unspecified number of cattle from Toposa pastoralists at Mogilla cattle camps in Kauto (Kapoeta East, Eastern Equatoria).

On 2 September 2026, members of Cie Biliew clan attacked a group of Cie Jang at Diror in Diror (Akobo, Jonglei) in a revenge incident. Three people were wounded. The victims were attending a wedding negotiation.

On 2 September 2026, suspected armed Murle militia attacked Bor Dinka traders along the Poktap-Panyagor Road, near the Hontok area of Kongor payam (Twic East, Jonglei). Four people were wounded, and an unspecified number of cattle were stolen.

On 2 September 2026, the Pagok and Pathiong/Pathiang subsections of the Langdiing section of the Gok Dinka clashed at Majok Kubir cattle camp in Abiriu (location coded to Abiriu, Cueibet, Lakes). 2 people were killed, and an unspecified number of others were wounded.

On 2 September 2026, two groups from Kiechkuon Payam (coded as an unidentified clan militia) clashed in the Kiech Kuon area of Kiech Kuon (Luakpiny/Nasir, Upper Nile) in a revenge incident. 2 people were killed, and an unspecified number of people were arrested.

On 2 September 2026, two unspecified sections of the Burbiei community clashed in a revenge-related incident at Jikmir Payam (location coded to Torpot, Luakpiny/Nasir, Upper Nile). One person was killed, and authorities arrested an unspecified number of people.

Looting: Around 1 September 2026 (as reported), armed youth suspected to be from the Muok section of the Rek Dinka raided an unspecified number of cattle (victims are likely from the Muok section of the Rek Dinka based on location) in Tonj Payam (location coded as Tonj, Tonj South, Warrap).

On 1 September 2026, members of the SSPDF and armed youth suspected to be from the Muok section of the Rek Dinka clashed in Tonj Payam (location coded as Tonj, Tonj South, Warrap). The clash occurred during a joint operation to retrieve cattle that the armed youth had raided (coded separately). 1 soldier was killed.

On 1 September 2026, an armed individual suspected to be an SSPDF member shot and killed a police officer in the Nagori area in Yambio Town Payam (location coded as Yambio, Yambio, Western Equatoria). Motivation unknown/not reported. It is unclear whether the police officer was on-duty or off-duty. The suspect was arrested.

Around 31 August 2026 (between 31 August - 1 September), raiders suspected to be from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle) ambushed cattle owners from Yuai town in Uror county (likely Lou Nuer, who inhabit Uror county) while they were en route to sell cattle in Bor town, at an unspecified location between Twic and Bor counties in Jalle Payam (location coded to Jalle in Bor South county, Jonglei state). Three traders were shot and wounded and received treatment at a hospital. An unspecified number of cattle were raided.

On 30 August 2026, an unidentified armed group ambushed and killed a member of the SPLM-In Opposition while on his way home in Kuach-deng Payam (location coded as Kuachdeng, Ayod, Jonglei). Motivation unknown/not reported.
On 29 August 2026, an unidentified armed group attacked SSPDF soldiers at the Takaniyang mine area in Lotukei Payam (location coded as Lotukei, Budi, Eastern Equatoria). 2 soldiers were injured.

On 29 August 2026, Louy sub-section of the Mor section of the Lou Nuer clashed with members of Ciemandeng (coded as unidentified ethnic group) at Walgak market in Walgak (Akobo, Jonglei). The police discharged warning shots into the air to disperse the crowd. No injuries were reported.

On 29 August 2026, an unidentified armed group shot and killed a local administrator at an INGO nutrition Centre in Likuangole Payam (location coded as Likuangole, Pibor, Jonglei). The victim was killed after refusing and opposing the armed group's forceful attempt to seize nutrition supplies from the nutrition center.

On 28 August 2026, members of the Maban ethnic group who fled the conflict in Sudan protested in Renk (Renk, Upper Nile) against inadequate service delivery and delays in transport from Renk to Maban. The protesters dispersed after UN Agency representatives intervened (means unspecified).

On 28 August 2026, members of the Murle Kurenen age set clashed with Murle Thubezwa age set clashed with bladed weapons in Monchak village in Lekuangole Payam (location coded as Likuangole, Pibor, Jonglei). 3 people were killed.
On 28 August 2026, two unidentified communal militia groups clashed over a land dispute in Amadi Village in Amadi (Juba, Central Equatoria). 1 person was killed and 1 person was injured.

On 28 August 2026, armed youth from Rubkona county (likely Leek Nuer, based on the county) and armed youth from Leer county (likely Dok Nuer, based on the county) clashed in Rejaf Payam (location coded as Rejaf, Juba, Central Equatoria) over ongoing disputes between the two communities. Casualties unknown.

On 28 August 2026, members of the SSPDF attacked and injured three Dinka Twic Mayardit civilians at a checkpoint in Wunrok Payam (location coded as Wunrok, Twic, Warrap). Extent of injuries unknown/not reported.

On 28 August 2026, Dinka community members suspected to be from the Thony section of Rek Dinka sexually assaulted two women from the Muok section of the Rek Dinka community in Tonj Payam (location coded as Tonj, Tonj South, Warrap). This was in retaliation after members of the Dinka Muok community raided an unspecified number of cattle from the Dinka Thony community (coded separately).

Looting: On 28 August 2026, members of the Muok section of the Rek Dinka raided an unspecified number of cattle from the Thony section of the Rek Dinka community in Tonj Payam (location coded as Tonj, Tonj South, Warrap).

On 28 August 2026, an unidentified armed group abducted a community leader from his home in Yeiba Village in Ombasi Boma (location coded as Ombasi, Yei, Central Equatoria). Motivation unknown/not reported.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); International Crisis Group; Radio Tamazuj
properties.notes: Other: On 27 August 2026, the UPDF established eight barracks and deployed an unspecified number of patrol forces in several locations along the South Sudan-Uganda border, including Katoko, Gotlela, Arambeel, Adodi, and Paragadwanya (location coded to Pugee in Pajok, Magwi county, Eastern Equatoria state). An unspecified number of people were displaced. A different source reported that nearly 200 villages are currently being occupied by UPDF forces.

Around 27 August 2026 (as reported), raiders described as hailing from Uror county (likely Lou Nuer, who predominantly inhabit the county) attacked Ayod (Ayod county, Jonglei state). A woman was killed. Over 4,000 cattle were raided, with some recovered. An unspecified number of dwellings were destroyed.

On 27 August 2026, unidentified age-set members (likely from the Murle community based on incident location) clashed in Kongor area of Likuangole Payam (Pibor, Jonglei), resulting in 1 injury. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 27 August 2026, unidentified armed assailants suspected to be from Unity State (likely members of the Nuer community who are predominant in the State) attacked civilians and raided an unspecified number of cattle in Alabek Payam (Tonj North, Warrap). The incident resulted in 1 fatality and 1 injury.
On 27 August 2026, an unidentified armed individual (coded as unidentified armed group) shot and injured a civilian in Alabek market area (Tonj North, Warrap). Motivation unknown/not reported.
On 27 August 2026, SSPDF and suspected NAS members clashed along the Lainya-Wonduruba Road in Wonduruba Payam (location coded as Wonduruba, Juba, Central Equatoria). 2 SSPDF members were injured.

On 26 August 2026, raiders from Logir in Ikotos county, described as bandits, were pursued by local youths (coded as an unidentified clan militia) and clashed at Chukudum in Komiri (Budi county, Eastern Equatoria state) after a cattle raid. One raider was killed. An unspecified number of cattle were raided and later recovered. Four granaries/stores were burnt.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Risk and Strategic Management, Corporation
properties.notes: On 26 August 2026, Pathuyith subsection of the Athoc section of the Bor Dinka clashed with Angakuei subsection of the Athoc section of the Bor Dinka at torch fishing area in Baidit, Baidit Payam (Bor South county, Jonglei state). The incident is connected to a disagreement about a fishing location that both communities claim as their own. At least 4 people were killed, two from each side and three people were wounded. Four suspects were apprehended and 11 chiefs from Pathuyith and Angakuei were arrested. Government forces were deployed to the area to calm the situation.

On 26 August 2026, unidentified individuals (coded as unidentified communal militia) attacked civilians suspected to be from the Murle community who were traveling along the Mogiri-Mangala Road, in the vicinity of Mogiri Boma in Mangalla South Payam (Juba, Central Equatoria). 1 person was injured. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 26 August 2026, unidentified assailants (coded as unidentified armed group) shot at a commercial vehicle transporting civilians and an SSPDF soldier (assumed off duty) from Narus to Kapoeta South, at an unspecified location near Naknak bridge, between Naknak and Kapoeta in Pwata Payam (location coded to Kapoeta in Kapoeta South County, Eastern Equatoria State). The incident resulted in 1 fatality.

On 26 August 2026, an armed guard of a governor (coded as SSPDF) clashed with members of PFM at the Yambio airstrip area in Yambio Town (Yambio county, Western Equatoria state). At least one soldier was killed, and an unspecified number of people were injured. The PFM group made a statement claiming responsibility for the three incidents (each coded separately) in Yambio.
On 26 August 2026, an SSPDF soldier shot and killed a civilian during a disarmament exercise in Akorogbodi 1 of Yambio Town Payam (Yambio, Western Equatoria). Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 25 August 2026, for two hours, the Cie Manbath section of the Lou Nuer clan clashed with Cie Rom section of the Lou Nuer at Puak in Doma payam (location coded to Doma, Ulang county, Upper Nile state) over long-standing tensions between the two communities. Eight people were killed, and five were wounded. Thousands of people were displaced.

On 25 August 2026, armed individuals suspected of being Murle community members raided an unspecified number of cattle in Pajut area of Panyang Payam (Duk, Jonglei). Local youth (coded as Duk Pajut communal militia) responded and recovered all the stolen animals. There were no casualties.

On 25 August 2026, 2 groups (described as sections of the Muut and Chiepuochduay communities of Nyirol County and assumed to be part of the Lou Nuer who are predominant in the area) clashed in Thol Payam (location coded to Thol in Nyirol County, Jonglei State), resulting in 3 fatalities. The incident is related to revenge (further information unknown/not reported).

On 25 August 2026, armed youth from the Akook subsection of the Aliap section of the Rek Dinka community shot and killed 3 people at Pabur Cattle Camp in Paliang Payam (location coded to Paliang in Tonj East County, Warrap State). The incident is linked to the ongoing intercommunal conflict between Tonj East and Tonj North counties. Victims are likely members of the Luach-Jang Dinka who are predominant in the area.

On 25 August 2026, in the evening, PFM clashed with the SSPDF at Masia/Masiya in Yambio (Yambio county, Western Equatoria state). The reason is unknown/not reported. 1-9 SSPDF soldiers were killed. Fatalities coded as 1. Five people, including two SSPDF soldiers and three civilians, were wounded. The PFM group made a statement claiming responsibility for the three incidents (each coded separately) in Yambio.

On 24 August 2026, unidentified armed individuals suspected to be Murle community members ambushed civilians traveling from Akobo East to Akobo West in Dengjok area of Dengjok Payam (Akobo, Jonglei), injuring 1 person. Motivation unknown/not reported.

Looting: On 23 August 2026, unidentified armed assailants suspected of being Turkana community members from Kenya raided an unspecified number of cattle from a cattle camp owned by Toposa community members in Lomunyen Village of Narus Payam (location coded to Narus in Kapoeta East County, Eastern Equatoria State).

On 23 August 2026, the Lango and Kurenen age-sets of the Murle clashed in Pibor Payam (location coded to Pibor in Pibor County, Jonglei State), resulting in 1 fatality. Security officers arrested 3 individuals for investigations. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 22 August 2026, armed individuals (coded as unidentified armed group) suspected to have shot and killed a local on 20 August while attempting to take over his land (coded separately) shot at youths from Jebel Lado (Juba, Central Equatoria) while they retaliated by destroying their house. 2 youths were killed and 1 was injured.

On 22 August 2026, unidentified armed assailants suspected of being land grabbers (coded as unidentified armed group) exchanged fire with security personnel (assumed to be military) along the Juba-Lainya Road, in Kwarijik village of Rejaf Payam (location coded to Rejaf in Juba County, Central Equatoria State), resulting in 5 fatalities.

On 21 August 2026, PFM members shot and killed an SSPDF soldier and wounded another at Suok Siro/Sugu Siro (Yambio county, Western Equatoria state). The reason is unknown/not reported. One shooter was arrested. The PFM group made a statement claiming responsibility for three incidents (each coded separately) in Yambio.
On 20 August 2026, gunmen (coded as unidentified armed group) shot and killed a man in Jebel Lado payam (Juba, Central Equatoria) in an attempt to take over his land.

On 20 August 2026, unidentified armed individuals (coded as unidentified communal militia) abducted 2 children and raided an unspecified number of goats in Piny-baar-khow village of Manyang-Ngok Payam (location coded to Manyang-Ngok in Tonj South County, Warrap State). Victims are likely members of the Thony section of the Rek Dinka who are predominant in the area.

Looting: On 20 August 2026, armed assailants suspected to be Luach-Jang/Luanyjang Dinka community members of Warrap State's Tonj East County raided an unspecified number of cattle in Ayiek-leng village of Rualbet Payam (location coded to Rualbet in Tonj North County, Warrap State). Victims of the raid are likely Rek Dinka community members who live in the area.
On 19 August 2026, gunmen (coded as unidentified armed group) abducted 2 children (likely Lou Nuer, based on the county) from Ket boma (Nyirol, Jonglei).

On 19 August 2026, unidentified armed assailants (coded as unidentified communal militia) killed a security officer (assumed to be police and off duty) at a farming area in Bazungua village of Yambio town Payam (Yambio, Western Equatoria). Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 19 August 2026, armed youths (including an individual in military uniform, likely SSPDF and an unidentified armed group) attacked the Jonglei state SPLM deputy chairman and a member of Jonglei transitional legislative assembly in Bor (Bor South, Jonglei) and looted their belongings as they were on their way to their hotel. The member of the legislative assembly was injured.
On 18 August 2026, unidentified armed individuals suspected to be Murle community members killed a man and abducted a teenager in the Imehejek area of Imehejek Payam (Lafon/Lopa, Eastern Equatoria).

On 18 August 2026, unidentified armed youth (coded as unidentified communal militia) killed a Payam Administrative Officer at his residence in Likuangole Payam (Pibor, Jonglei). Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 18 August 2026, an unidentified armed individual (coded as unidentified armed group) killed an SSPDF officer (assumed on duty) in Lobonok Payam (Juba, Central Equatoria). Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 18 August 2026, unidentified armed individuals suspected to be Murle community members ambushed civilians and abducted 2 girls, traveling along the road between Duk Padiet and Patuet, in Panyang Payam (location coded to Panyang in Duk County, Jonglei). Victims are likely members of the Dinka community who are predominant in the area.

Looting: On 18 August 2026, unidentified armed assailants suspected to be Murle community members raided an unspecified number of cattle from Twic East Dinka community members in Wanglei village of Nyuak Payam (Twic East, Jonglei).

On 17 August 2026, the Akok section of the Anei Atak clan clashed with the Luach Jang Dinka at an unspecified location in Tonj East county (location coded to Romich the Admin2 HQ in Paliang, Warrap state) in a revenge attack. The clash resulted in 23 fatalities over two days (12 and 17 August), 23 fatalities were split across two days and coded as 12. 16 people wounded.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Risk and Strategic Management, Corporation
properties.notes: On 17 August 2026, suspected SSPDF clashed with armed youth (coded as unidentified communal militia) in Dhuording of Nasir Payam (location coded to Nasir, Luakpiny/Nasir, Upper Nile). 2 people were killed and several civilians were displaced. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 17 August 2026, members of the Guzule and Kurenen age-sets of the Murle community clashed during a road ambush in Likuangole Payam (Pibor, Jonglei), resulting in 1 fatality. Motivation unknown/not reported.
On 17 August 2026, unidentified armed assailants suspected to be Murle community members abducted 2 children from the Lou Nuer community in Pading Payam (Nyirol, Jonglei).

On 17 August 2026, unidentified armed individuals suspected to be from Uror County (coded as Uror communal militia) raided an unspecified number of cattle and killed a woman in Wau Payam (Ayod, Jonglei). Local youth (likely members of the Gawaar Nuer community who live in the area) responded and recovered several of the stolen animals, while 1 individual was killed.

On 17 August 2026, members of the Muok and Thony sections of the Rek Dinka and another group (described as Yar Akotwut and coded as unidentified communal militia) clashed in Manyang-Ngok Payam (Tonj South, Warrap), resulting in the death of 2 police officers while 4 others were injured. The incident is linked to revenge. It is unclear how the officers incurred casualties.

On 16 August 2026, suspected members of the Murle community killed two people at an unspecified location in Kapoeta North county (location coded to Riwoto the Admin2 HQ, in Najie payam, Eastern Equatoria state). The motive for the attack is unknown/unreported. The victims are likely Toposa, who predominantly inhabit Kapoeta North county.

On 16 August 2026, Luac-Jang Dinka clashed with the Akook subsection of the Aliap section of the Rek Dinka in an unspecified location in Tonj East county (location coded to Romich, Tonj East, Warrap) in response to a similar clash between the groups in Tonj East on 9 August (coded separately). 13 people from both groups were killed and 12 were wounded.

On 16 August 2026, members of the Guzule age-set of the Murle clashed with another age-set of the Murle (described as Monchak and coded as Murle ethnic militia) following a suspected cattle raid by the former in Likuangole Payam (Pibor, Jonglei). The clash resulted in 2 fatalities and 1 injury.

On 16 August 2026, unidentified armed youth suspected of being members of the Muok section of the Rek Dinka community raided an unspecified number of cattle and injured 4 people in Manyang-Ngok Payam (Tonj South, Warrap). Victims are likely members of the Thony section of the Rek Dinka who live in the area.

On 16 August 2026, armed Luach-Jang/Luanyjang Dinka youth shot and killed 1 civilian and injured another in Marial-Lou Payam (Tonj North, Warrap). The victims were both Luach-Jang/Luanyjang Dinka community members and the perpetrators attacked them thinking they were members of the Akook subsection of the Aliap section of the Rek Dinka who usually raid cattle in the area.

On 16 August 2026, members of the Akook/Akok sub-section of the Aliap section of the Rek Dinka community together with the Ador section of the Rek Dinka and another group described as Bac community attacked members of the Luach-Jang/Luanyjang Dinka community at Ngadiang cattle camp, Manyangic and Lol-lith areas in Paliang Payam (location coded to Paliang in Tonj East County, Warrap State), resulting in at least 33 fatalities and 69 injuries. Additionally, the presence of Akook/Akok members along the Ngapagok route between Tonj South (Town) to Tonj East/Tonj North disrupted activity on the road. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 16 August 2026, unidentified armed youth suspected of being Luach-Jang/Luanyjang community members killed 4 people in Mayen Payam (location coded to Mayendor in Tonj East County, Warrap State). The incident is revenge-related. Victims are likely members of the Dinka community which is predominant in the area.

On 16 August 2026, members of the Akook/Akok sub-section of the Aliap section of the Rek Dinka, the Ador section of the Rek Dinka, and the Luach-Jang/Luanyjang Dinka communities clashed in Meer Village of Ananatak Payam (location coded to Ananatak in Tonj East County, Warrap State), resulting in 19 fatalities and 22 injuries. Motivation unknown/not reported.
On 16 August 2026, military intelligence abducted a young man in Torit (Torit county, Eastern Equatoria state). The whereabouts of the abductee remain unknown. No additional information is available.

Other: On 15 August 2026, Jonglei State authorities in collaboration with local chiefs and police recovered 11 children, 6 male, and 5 female, in an unspecified location in the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (location coded to Pibor in Pibor County, Jonglei State), suspected to have previously (no date specified) been abducted by Murle youth. The abductees, from the eastern side of Kapoeta in neighboring Eastern Equatoria State (likely from the Toposa community who live in the area), were handed over to the United Nations to facilitate their return. Officials from both states noted that efforts are ongoing to ensure all abducted individuals are found and returned to their homes.

properties.source: Radio Miraya; Radio Tamazuj; Risk and Strategic Management, Corporation
properties.notes: On 15 August 2026, SSPDF clashed with suspected White Army (coded as Nuer) in Wei-Yar-Adiu northwest of Nasir (Luakpiny/Nasir, Upper Nile) after the group raided military barracks in the area. SSPDF arrested an armed individual. Conflict reports mentioned 0 to 3 fatalities (from soldiers). Motivation unknown/not reported. Fatalities coded as 0.

On 15 August 2026, unidentified individuals suspected to be from Doro Refugee Camp (coded as unidentified communal militia) raided an unspecified number of cattle from the host community (coded as Maban ethnic militia based on location) resulting in a clash with the latter at a location East of Bunj airstrip in Buong Payam (location coded to Bunj in Maban County, Upper Nile State). The cattle owners recovered all the cattle. Casualties unknown.

On 15 August 2026, an unknown individual (coded as unidentified armed group) assaulted a Bari community member at Bori Primary School in Northern Bari payam (location coded to Kenyi, Juba county, Central Equatoria state) over a land dispute.

Movement of forces: Around 14 August 2026 (week of), up to 20 Uganda People's Defense Forces (UPDF) entered Patoko village in Pugee (Magwi, Eastern Equatoria) and forcibly removed civilians from their homes by threatening them, claiming it was their territory.

Movement of forces: Around 14 August 2026 (week of), up to 20 Uganda People's Defense Forces (UPDF) entered Abiloro village in Pugee (Magwi, Eastern Equatoria) and forcibly removed civilians from their homes by threatening them, claiming it was their territory.

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; Risk and Strategic Management, Corporation; VOA
properties.notes: On 14 August 2026, SSPDF clashed with gunmen described as 'White Army' (coded as Nuer) in Nasir (Luakpiny/Nasir, Upper Nile). 4 people were killed (including 3 SSPDF), another was injured, and civilians were displaced. SSPDF shelling was reported. The violence was triggered by the killing of a student on August 11 near Kaajiok-Wecyaradiw (coded separately). The SSPDF spokesperson denied that the national army clashed with the White Army, stating instead that they engaged with an unidentified armed group.

On 14 August 2026, a member of the Lou Nuer assaulted a Dinka community member (likely Padang Dinka, based on location) in Gel Achiel payam (location coded to Gel Achel, Baliet county, Upper Nile state). The Dinka confiscated the attacker's livestock.

On 14 August 2026, unknown armed individuals suspected to be from Unity state (coded as unidentified armed group) killed 3 Dinka (likely Akop section of the Rek Dinka, based on location) and stole their fishing boats in Akop payam (location coded to Akop, Tonj North county, Warrap state).

On 13 August 2026, SSPDF shot and injured a civilian on his way from Ethiopia to Ulang near Kaajiok Wechyaaradiw in Nasir county (location coded to Nasir, Luakpiny/Nasir, Upper Nile). Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 12 August 2026, the Akok section of the Anei Atak clan clashed with the Luach Jang Dinka at an unspecified location in Tonj East county (location coded to Romich the Admin2 HQ in Paliang, Warrap state) in a revenge attack. The clash resulted in 23 fatalities over two days (12 and 17 August), 23 fatalities were split across two days and coded as 11. 16 people wounded.
On 12 August 2026, suspected armed Luacjang/Luach-Jang Dinka youth attacked a military post in Ananatak payam (location coded to Ananatak, Tonj East county, Warrap state). 2 people were injured.

On 12 August 2026, unidentified individuals (coded as unidentified armed group) assaulted and injured a UN aid worker in Hai Longhute area of Torit (location coded to Torit, the nearest known location in Torit County, Eastern Equatoria State). Motivation unknown/not reported.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Miraya; Radio Tamazuj
properties.notes: On 11 August 2026, the Uganda People's Defense Forces (UPDF) detained and assaulted 6 South Sudanese civilians farming at an unspecified location near the South Sudan border in Kajo Keji county (location coded to Kajo-Keji, Kajo Keji, Central Equatoria), claiming the area was Ugandan territory according to their GPS after Ugandan civilians accused the 6 civilians of encroaching into their farmland. They were released on the same day. No information on injuries.

Around 11 August 2026 (between 11 August - 12 August), unidentified gunmen (described as from the Logir community) shot at motorcycles traveling on Ikotos-Tsertenya road in Murrum in Ikotos county (location coded to Ikotos, Ikotos, Eastern Equatoria) during an ambush. Motivation unknown/not reported. At least 3 civilians were killed and 1 was injured, and one of the shooters was arrested.

Other: On 11 August 2026, suspected armed Ugandan soldiers crossed into South Sudan territory and arrested and briefly detained 6 civilians in Kangapu/ Kangepo ll payam (location coded to Jale, Kajo Keji county, Central Equatoria state). Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 11 August 2026, suspected armed Nuer attacked a cattle camp in Aliiny (Aliiny, Panriang, Unity). 3 people were killed and 1 was injured. The victims of the attack are likely Padang Dinka, based on the location.

On 11 August 2026, an armed individual (suspected to be from Tonj South and likely Rek Dinka) injured a tax collector in Tonj payam (location coded to Tonj, Tonj South county, Warrap state) in a revenge attack. The perpetrator was arrested.
On 11 August 2026, a suspected South Sudanese soldier killed a youth that was riding a motorcycle home in Ikotos (Ikotos, Eastern Equatoria). The motive is unknown. Officials arrested the soldier.

On 11 August 2026, individuals wearing military uniforms (coded as SSPDF) ambushed and killed a student traveling from Ethiopia to Ulang County at Kaajiok- Wecyaradiw village in Mading payam (location coded to Mading, Luakpiny/Nasir county, Upper Nile state). Motivation unknown/not reported.

Around 10 August 2026 (between 10 August - 11 August), suspected Murle youths killed a man and abducted a child in Imehejek (Lafon, Eastern Equatoria). The local youth pursued the perpetrators (no interactions reported), who entered the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA).

On 10 August 2026, suspected Murle youth (described as gunmen from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area) clashed with 2 community police members between Ngalapicha and Makarwil near Kongor (Twic East, Jonglei) while community police were on patrol. 1 member of the community police was killed. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 10 August 2026, for the second day, Luac-Jang Dinka clashed with the Akook subsection of the Aliap section of the Rek Dinka in Pajing near Ngabagok (Tonj East, Warrap), killing 6 during a revenge attack linked to a similar clash in Tonj East on 30 July (coded separately).

On 10 August 2026, members of the Dongdur sub-sub-section of the Angakuei sub-section of the Athoc section of the Bor Dinka clashed with members of the Thony ka Anyier sub-sub-section of the Pathuyith sub-section of the Athoc section of the Bor Dinka over access to fishing sites in Baidit payam (location coded to Baidit, Bor South county, Jonglei state). Authorities arrested 12 local chiefs and 2 youth leaders for not stopping the violence.

On 10 August 2026, Luacjang/Luach-Jang Dinka clashed with members of the Akok/Akook sub-section of the Aliap section of the Rek Dinka in Ngap payam (location coded to Mayenthon, Cueibet county, Lakes state) over an incident between the two communities in July of this year (further details unknown/not reported). 12 people were killed and 10 were injured.
On 10 August 2026, suspected armed NAS abducted a Kakwa community member in Mugwo payam (location coded to Mugwo, Yei county, Central Equatoria state).

On 10 August 2026, unknown armed individuals ambushed and killed 1 person traveling along the road between Bor county and Twic East county in Kongor payam (location coded to Kongor, Twic East county, Jonglei state).

On 9 August 2026, overnight, armed cattle raiders (described as being from Unity state, likely Bul Nuer) killed 1-3 civilians and injured another in Gabnom in Aliny county (location coded to Aliiny, Panriang, Unity) and stole 500-700 head of cattle.

On 9 August 2026, Luac-Jang Dinka clashed with the Akook subsection of the Aliap section of the Rek Dinka in Ngabagok (Tonj East, Warrap), killing 4-10 and injuring 2-4 others during a revenge attack linked to a similar attack in Tonj East on 30 July (coded separately).

On 9 August 2026, suspected armed youth of the Luacjang/Luach-Jang Dinka attacked Pateew village in Ananatak payam (location coded to Ananatak, Tonj East county, Warrap state) in a revenge attack related to an incident between the two communities in July of this year (further details unknown/not reported). 4 people were killed (the victims are likely Rek Dinka, based on location).

On 9 August 2026, suspected armed youth of the Luacjang/Luach-Jang Dinka killed 6 civilians (likely Gok Dinka, based on location) in Mariek village in Ngap payam (location coded to Mayenthon, Cueibet county, Lakes state).

On 8 August 2026, a police investigator assaulted a public prosecutor in an unspecified location in Yirol West county (location coded to Yirol, Yirol West, Lakes) after the prosecutor requested the release of an individual accused of stealing a gun and later unlawfully detained. The prosecutor was hospitalized and had his arm broken. The police investigator was detained and dismissed.

On 8 August 2026, suspected armed youth from Loupheer/Lou Paher sub-section of the Akop section of the Rek Dinka killed 1 civilian and wounded another (likely Dinka, based on location) at Mangan village in Mayen payam (location coded to Mayendor, Tonj East county, Warrap state). The reason is unknown/not reported.

On 8 August 2026, unidentified armed individuals (likely Agar Dinka, based on location) killed a civilian from the Nielniel sub-section of the Pakam section of the Agar Dinka in Jiir payam (location coded to Abarkou, Rumbek Centre county, Lakes state). The motive is unknown/not reported.

On 7 August 2026, an unidentified armed group ambushed, shot, and killed a fish trader at an unspecified location near the Ayod-Urur border (coded to Panyang), Mogok payal (Ayod, Jonglie). The victim was traveling with his daughter from a fishing village in Ayod to his hometown of Pading, Uror County when the assailants attacked him. His belongings were looted while the daughter escaped unharmed.

On 7 August 2026, government security forces (coded as SSPDF) clashed with an unidentified armed group in Lojulo / Lujulu payam (location coded to Lujulu, Morobo county, Central Equatoria state). Two civilians were injured in the crossfire.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Miraya; Radio Tamazuj; South Sudan Voice of Voiceless; Sudan Tribune
properties.notes: On 6 August 2026, SAF conducted air strikes targeting RSF and SPLM-North (led by Joseph Tuka) in the Khor Tombak area, Maban county (Upper Nile). 2 young herders and several cattle were killed. The strike also injured an unspecified number of other civilians. The SSPDF spokesperson stated that the airstrikes were intended to target those engaged in combat with SAF but mistakenly fell on the South Sudanese side.

On 6 August 2026, a group of six gunmen (coded as unidentified armed group) opened fire and attacked four NGO workers from AVSI while they were traveling from Wulu to Gurmar in Wulu County (Lakes State). One of the AVSI staff members was shot in the head and admitted to a hospital. The armed group also assaulted and robbed the other three staff members of their belongings, including iPhones.

On 6 August 2026, for the second day NAS clashed with SSPDF in Imatong in Ikotos county (location coded to Ikotos, Ikotos, Eastern Equatoria). NAS claimed the clash occurred after SSPDF looted and burned civilian property. NAS claimed that 8 SSPDF were killed and 15 injured between 5 and 6 August. 8 fatalities split across two days and coded as 4.

On 6 August 2026, young people from the Pari area of Lafon County forcefully stormed and sealed off the Commissioner's office in Lafon (Lafon, Eastern Equatoria) to express their strong opposition to the commissioner's decision to suspend and reorganize the community leadership in the county. The demonstrators made threats against the commissioner and stated that they no longer wanted him to govern the area.

On 6 August 2026, SSPDF forces clashed with an unknown armed group (coded as Ikotos communal militia) near Geria area in Hatire payam (location coded to Lomogoro, Ikotos county, Eastern Equatoria state). 11 people were killed, 6 people were injured, and 2 people were arrested.

On 6 August 2026, suspected armed Murle youth abducted seven civilians from the Tut section of the Lou Nuer in Waat payam (location coded to Waat, Nyirol county, Jonglei state). Tut armed youth pursued the abductors and recovered three children and a woman (coded separately).

On 6 August 2026, suspected armed Murle youth clashed with armed youth from the Tut section of the Lou Nuer in Waat payam (location coded to Waat, Nyirol county, Jonglei state) after the Murle kidnapped seven civilians (coded separately). The Tut youth recovered three children and a woman. There were no injuries.
On 6 August 2026, armed youth (likely Murle, based on location) clashed in Lawol (Gumuruk, Pibor, Jonglei). 3 people were killed and 5 were injured. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 5 August 2026, NAS clashed with SSPDF in Imatong in Ikotos county (location coded to Ikotos, Ikotos, Eastern Equatoria). NAS claimed the clash occurred after SSPDF looted and burned civilian property. NAS claimed that 8 SSPDF were killed and 15 injured between 5 and 6 August. 8 fatalities split across two days and coded as 4.

On 5 August 2026, suspected Murle (described as armed assailants from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area) shot and killed a man near the South Sudanese-Ethiopia border in Pochalla (Pochalla, Jonglie), while he was traveling to Gambella (Ethiopia) with three family members to purchase food. The three family members managed to escape.

On 5 August 2026, unknown armed individuals (coded as unidentified armed group) killed a child and wounded an adult (likely Gawaar Nuer, based on location) in Wau payam (location coded to Wau, Ayod county, Jonglei state). The motive is unknown.

On 5 August 2026, an unknown armed individual (suspected to be from Marial-Lou payam and likely Dinka) killed a member of the Luach-Jang Dinka in Puol-baar/Pulbar village (Marial-Lou, Tonj North, Warrap). The motive is unknown.
On 5 August 2026, Sudanese refugees protested over poor services in Transit Center number 2 in North Renk payam (location coded to Renk, Renk county, Upper Nile state).

On 4 August 2026, suspected armed Murle ambushed traders traveling on the road between Pochalla and Pinyudu in Pochalla payam (location coded to Pochalla, Pochalla county, Jonglei state). 1 person was killed.

On 4 August 2026, SSPDF soldiers exchanged fire with an unknown armed group (coded as Ikotos communal militia) while traveling by foot between Torit and Imotong in Imotong payam (location coded to Imotong, Ikotos county, Eastern Equatoria state). 1 person was injured.

Other: On 3 August 2026, around 60 IDPs who were recently displaced from Sudan and IDPs who have been in the Juba camp arrived at Rubkona airport and returned back home to Bentiu town, Bentiu (Rubkona county, Unity state), following the improvement of the security situation.

On 3 August 2026, an armed police officer shot and wounded five civilians in a restaurant in the Hai Cinema area in Juba payam (Juba county, Central Equatoria state). The shooting was related to a dispute over payment of a bill. The officer was arrested.

On 3 August 2026, armed individuals (coded as unidentified armed group) fired on civilians at the Seventh Days roundabout in Munuki payam (Juba county, Central Equatoria state). 1 person was killed and 1 was injured. The motive is unknown.
On 2 August 2026, an unidentified armed group shot and wounded a UN aid worker at Munuki in Muniki ( Juba county, Central Equatoria state). The motive for the attack is unknown/unreported.

Looting: On 2 August 2026, suspected Murle raided an unknown number of cattle at Pheripery village in Kongor payam (location coded to Kongor, Twic East county, Jonglei state) (victims are likely Kongor section of the Twic East Dinka, based on location).

On 1 August 2026, Cietiang and CieRuei Gol sections (both likely from the Gun section of the Lou Nuer, based on location) clashed in Dengdor village in Thol payam (location coded to Thol, Nyirol county, Jonglei state). 2 people were killed.

Other: Around 31 July 2026 (as reported), Uganda People's Defense Forces (UPDF) and game rangers established military barracks and build centers in various locations in Budi county, including Kanangorok and Tebokoi (location coded to Kikilai in Komiri, Eastern Equatoria state) and Karua and Bira (coded separately). The administrator of Budi Hospital stated that the Ugandan army had established outposts, opened roads into South Sudan game reserves, and installed Global Positioning Satellite (GPS) systems. The UPDF has previously been accused of planning to grab lands in South Sudan.

Other: Around 31 July 2026 (as reported), the Uganda People's Defense Forces (UPDF) and game rangers established military barracks and are building centers in various locations in Budi county, including Bira in Komiri (Eastern Equatoria state) and Kanangorok, Karua and Tebokoi (coded separately). The administrator of Budi Hospital stated that the Ugandan army had established outposts, opened roads into South Sudan game reserves, and installed Global Positioning Satellite (GPS) systems. The UPDF has previously been accused of planning to grab lands in South Sudan.

Around 31 July 2026 (end of month), government security forces (coded as Military), prison guard officers, and pastoralist militias (likely Gok Dinka based on their settlement area) clashed with cattle raiders who came from Rumbek Center county (likely Agar Dinka militias, due to their settlement in the area) in Alel-tual village (location coded to Abiriu) in Abiriu payam, Cueibet county (Lakes State), to recover the cattle stolen in Agngrial village (coded separately). 2 people were killed, including a sergeant from the prison service and a member of the pastoralist militias from Rumbek center. All the stolen cattle were recovered after the clash.

Around 31 July 2026 (end of month), suspected cattle raiders from the Panyar section of Tiaptiap payam (likely from the Macar section of the Gok Dinka clan due to the location) shot and killed a cattle herder at Cuei cattle camp in Mayath Payam (Cueibet, Lakes) and raided an unspecified number of cattle.

Around 31 July 2026 (end of month), an unidentified armed group who came from Rumbek Center County (likely Agar Dinka militias due to the location) attacked Agarial village (Agngrial), Ngap payam, Cueibet county (Lakes State) and raided nine head of cattle. Casualties unknown. The victims are likely Gok Dinka militias based on their settlement area. The cattle owners and security personnel pursued the raiders and clashed with them in Alel-tual village (coded separately).

Around 31 July 2026 (end of month), suspected cattle raiders from the Panyar section of Tiaptiap payam (likely from the Macar section of the Gok Dinka clan due to the location) shot and killed a cattle herder in Makuei, Pagoor payam (Cueibet, Lakes State), and raided an unspecified number of cattle.

Other: Around 31 July 2026 (as reported), the Uganda People's Defense Forces (UPDF) and game rangers established military barracks and are building centers in various locations in Budi county, including Karua in Lotukei payam (location coded to Lotukei in Eastern Equatoria state), Kanangorok and Bira and Tebokoi (coded separately). The administrator of Budi Hospital stated that the Ugandan army had established outposts, opened roads into South Sudan game reserves, and installed Global Positioning Satellite (GPS) systems. The UPDF has previously been accused of planning to grab lands in South Sudan.

On 31 July 2026, suspected armed members of the Panyar sub-section of the Macar section of the Gok Dinka attacked members of the Waat sub-section of the Macar section of the Gok Dinka and raided an unspecified number of cattle in Citcok payam (location coded to Citcok, Cueibet county, Lakes state). The cattle were later recovered. 2 people were killed.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Risk and Strategic Management, Corporation; Sudans Post
properties.notes: On 30 July 2026, armed raiders (described as being from Ngabagok, likely Akook/Akok sub-section of the Aliap section of the Rek Dinka, based on the county) attacked Luach-Jang Dinka pastoralists at Ramathieng cattle camp in Romich (Paliang, Warrap state) in a suspected revenge incident. At least seven people, including two women, one man, three children, and a teenage girl, were killed. Six to twelve people were wounded, 3 critically, and received treatment at a hospital.
On 30 July 2026, an unidentified armed group abducted two individuals on the Yei-Maridi road in at Yei payam (location coded to Yei, Yei county, Central Equatoria state).

Movement of forces: On 29 July 2026, SSPDF deployed an unspecified number of military personnel to major streets in Juba (Central Equatoria state), to ensure a peaceful Martyrs' Day commemoration on July 30 and as a precautionary measure, a curfew prohibiting the movement of civilians at night was imposed. The presence of the military in Juba caused panic among civilians.

On 29 July 2026, unknown individuals (coded as unidentified armed group) ambushed a motorcycle rider transporting an NGO worker and a patient along the Yei-Kaya road in Lujulu payam (location coded to Lujulu, Morobo county, Central Equatoria state). The motorcycle rider and one passenger were abducted.

On 29 July 2026, unknown armed individuals (likely Gawaar Nuer, based on location) killed an individual (likely Gawaar Nuer, based on location) at his residence in a revenge attack in Ayod (Ayod, Jonglei).

On 29 July 2026, unknown armed individuals (likely Long section of the Gawaar Nuer, based on location) injured an individual (likely Long section of the Gawaar Nuer, based on location) along the Ayod-Kuachdeng highway in Ayod payam (location coded to Kuachdeng, Ayod county, Jonglei state). The motive is unknown.

On 29 July 2026, suspected armed Agar Dinka from Rumbek Centre stole cattle from Gok Dinka in Ngap payam (location coded to Agngrial, Cueibet county, Lakes state). Gok Dinka retaliated and recovered the cattle. 3 people were killed.

Change to armed group: On 28 July 2026, the Unity State governor dismantled a para-military group known as the Terchuong militia in Bentiu town, Bentiu (Rubkona county, Unity state) to end inter-communal violence in the state. The group was accused of instilling fear among residents. Members of the group were to be integrated into SSPDF.
On 28 July 2026, youth wielding crude weapons killed a 17-year-old male suspected of stabbing and killing a medical worker at Ngauro/Lauru in Nauro (Budi county, Eastern Equatoria state).

On 28 July 2026, for the second day, pastoralists described as Cueibet and Rumbek Central youths (likely Gok Dinka and Agar Dinka, respectively, who are based in the two counties) clashed at Relkou, described as being between the Aliet and Magotic area in Mayom payam (Rumbek Centre county, Lakes state) in a raid incident. At least four people were killed, and 12 others were wounded and received treatment at a hospital. Additionally, 26 heads of cattle were raided. Fatalities split between 2 days (27 and 28 July), fatalities coded as 2.

On 28 July 2026, armed assailants suspected to be from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle) attacked Ninamajak, a riverine fishing village situated between Pigi and Nyirol (location coded to Lankien, Nyirol county, Jonglei state). The attack resulted in the deaths of at least two fishermen, and two individuals, including an executive chief, were wounded. Five children were abducted.

On 28 July 2026, unknown armed youth (likely Toposa, based on location) clashed with a mining company's security guards in Katordori payam (location coded to Nawoit, Kapoeta East county, Eastern Equatoria state) after the youth had assaulted the area chief and a company staff member (coded separately). The youth had accused the company of illegally mining in the area.

On 28 July 2026, unknown armed youth (likely Toposa, based on location) assaulted the area chief (likely also Toposa, based on location) and a staff member of a mining company in Katordori payam (location coded to Nawoit, Kapoeta East county, Eastern Equatoria state). The youth had accused the company of illegally mining in the area. 1 company staff member was injured. The company's private security then clashed with the youth (coded separately).

On 28 July 2026, suspected armed Murle attacked individuals (likely Lou Nuer, based on the location) in Nyinemajak village in Pulturuk payam (location coded to Pulturuk, Nyirol county, Jonglei state). 5 children were abducted, 2 people were killed and 2 people were injured.

On 28 July 2026, armed pastoralists suspected to be from the Tiek/Tiik sub-section of the Ruop section of the Agar Dinka attacked pastoralists from the Pathiang/Pathiong sub-section of the Langdiing section of the Gok Dinka at Atok cattle camp in Abiriu payam (location coded to Abiriu, Cueibet county, Lakes state). 10 people were killed and 7 were injured.

On 28 July 2026, an individual from the Manuer sub-section of the Pakam section of the Agar Dinka killed an individual from the Gak sub-section of the Pakam section of the Agar Dinka in a revenge attack in Malek payam (location coded to Malek, Rumbek Centre county, Lakes state).

Looting: On 28 July 2026, armed individuals (suspected to be from Bentiu and likely Nuer who inhabit the area) raided an unknown number of cattle from the grazing lands in Warra village in Aliiny payam (location coded to Aliiny, Panriang county, Unity state). Youth from Aliiny (likely Padan Dinka, based on location) pursued the raiders and recovered the cattle (no clashes reported). There were no casualties.

On 27 July 2026, government security forces (coded as military) repulsed raiders from the Rup/Ruop section of the Agar Dinka at Cueibet in Malou Pec (Cueibet county, Lakes state) during an attempted raid. Dozens were arrested. There were no casualties.

On 27 July 2026, suspected NAS ambushed and killed an SSPDF soldier near Kajo-Keji town in Lire (Kajo Keji county, Central Equatoria state). The soldier was in a vehicle en route to collect firewood from a commercial Centre. No further information.

On 27 July 2026, local youths beat and wounded the staff of Turkey Gold Mining Company and the Katodori Payam chief at a mining area in Kapoeta East county (location coded to Narus, Eastern Equatoria state) for mining without consulting the local community. The company was ordered to suspend its activities after the incident. An unspecified number of youths were arrested. The youths and community elders accused the politicians and the chief of colluding with the governor and the national government to rob them of their inheritance.

On 27 July 2026, members of the Ayual section of Twic East Dinka and Hol Dinka signed an agreement at the Park Place Hotel at in Bor (Bor South county, Jonglei state) to end hostilities and cooperate with the government to identify and apprehend perpetrators and to form a special court. The two communities had been engaged in revenge killings over fishing rights and the killing of a well-known wrestler.

On 27 July 2026, for the first day, pastoralists described as Cueibet and Rumbek Central youths (likely Gok Dinka and Agar Dinka, respectively, who are based in the two counties) clashed at Relkou, described as being between the Aliet and Magotic area in Mayom payam (Rumbek Centre county, Lakes state) in a raid incident. At least four people were killed, and 12 others were wounded and received treatment at a hospital. Additionally, 26 heads of cattle were raided. Fatalities split between 2 days (27 and 28 July), fatalities coded as 2.

On 27 July 2026, unknown armed individuals (coded as unidentified armed group) ambushed SSPDF soldiers and engaged them in an armed clash in Wudu (Kangepo l, Kajo Keji, Central Equatoria). 1 person was killed and 1 injured.

On 27 July 2026, two members of Wechtut/Chieng yoa-ding sub-section (coded as Nuer) and three individuals from Torbar village (coded as Nuer) clashed around Nyienegeth village in Yomding payam (location coded to Yomding, Ulang county, Upper Nile state). The incident was related to revenge and 2 people were killed.

On 27 July 2026, an unknown individual (coded as unidentified armed group) detonated a hand grenade in Akak village in Pannyok payam (location coded to Pannyok, Twic county, Warrap state). 1 woman was killed and 5 people were wounded (victims likely Twic Dinka, based on location). Local police arrested the perpetrator.
Looting: On 26 July 2026, suspected NAS looted a market in Kajo-Keji town in Lire (Kajo Keji county, Central Equatoria state). No further information is available.

Looting: On 26 July 2026, suspected armed members of the Pathiang/Pathiong sub-section of the Langdiing section of the Gok Dinka stole an unknown number of cattle from the Ruop/Rup section of the Agar Dinka at Rell-kou cattle camp in Matangai payam (location coded to Matangai, Rumbek Centre county, Lakes state). The stolen cattle were recovered through unspecified means.

On 26 July 2026, three armed youth from Wunkur (likely Paweng Dinka, based on origin) clashed with Sudanese traders (coded as unidentified armed group) and robbed them at Pakuem village in Aliiny payam (location coded to Aliiny, Panriang county, Unity state). 1 trader and 1 of the attackers was killed and 2 suspected attackers were injured.

On 25 July 2026, unknown armed individuals (likely members of the Bor Dinka community who are pre-dominant in the area) attempted to ambush an INGO vehicle in the vicinity of the Gumbo Sherikat junction on the Juba-Bor Road in Mangalla South payam (location coded to Mogiri, Juba county, Central Equatoria state). The individuals shot at the vehicle with small arms after the driver refused to stop. There were no injuries.
On 25 July 2026, unknown individuals (coded as unidentified armed group) abducted an individual from their home in Jolimo (Kangepo ll, Kajo Keji, Central Equatoria). The victim was later released.

On 25 July 2026, unknown armed individuals (coded as unidentified armed group) ambushed a commercial vehicle traveling along the Yei-Morobo road near Liggi (Mugwo, Yei, Central Equatoria). One female passenger (businesswoman) was killed and two passengers were injured.

On 25 July 2026, unknown armed individuals (coded as unidentified armed group) abducted a staff of an INGO and the driver of the vehicle they were travelling in after they ambushed a marked INGO vehicle traveling along the Yei-Morobo road in Mugwo payam (location coded to Mugwo, Yei county, Central Equatoria state). An unpsecified ransom was demanded, the staff were released on July 29.

Looting: On 25 July 2026, youth (suspected to be from Uror county and coded as Uror Communal Militia) raided an unknown number of cattle near Goak-canal and Pankhor village near Ayod (Ayod, Jonglei) (victims coded as Gawaar Nuer, based on location).
On 24 July 2026, at night, SSPDF (military) clashed with SPLM IO in Motot payam (Uror county, Jonglei state). One SSPDF soldier was captured. Casualties unknown.

On 24 July 2026, suspected armed NAS members abducted several individuals from their private residences in Lokule boma in Lujulu payam (location coded to Lujulu, Morobo county, Central Equatoria state).

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Sudans Post; VOA
properties.notes: On 23 July 2026, suspected SSPDF Tiger Division (the Presidential Guard) clashed with the police national security service in several locations in Juba county, including Dr. John Garang Mausoleum checkpoint behind Custom Market and Medan Rainbow playground in Juba (Juba county, Central Equatoria state), and Suk Melishia in Munuki (coded separately). At least one person was wounded. Different sources stated that periodic gunshots occurred when security officers shot at motorists who did not stop at checkpoints. The shooting sparked panic among civilians in Juba, though an SSPDF spokesperson stated that it was not politically motivated. No further information.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Sudans Post; VOA
properties.notes: On 23 July 2026, suspected SSPDF Tiger Division (the Presidential Guard) clashed with the police national security service in several locations in Juba county, including Suk Melishia in Munuki (Juba county, Central Equatoria state) and Dr. John Garang Mausoleum checkpoint behind Custom Market and Medan Rainbow playground in Juba (coded separately). At least one person was wounded. Different sources stated that periodic gunshots occurred when security officers shot at motorists who did not stop at checkpoints. The shooting sparked panic among civilians in Juba, though an SSPDF spokesperson stated that it was not politically motivated. No further information.

On 23 July 2026, armed raiders suspected to be from Kapoeta in Eastern Equatoria state (likely Toposa who inhabit Kapoeta) critically wounded a cattle keeper (likely Murle who inhabit the Pibor County) and raided 150 head of cattle from a cattle camp at Verteth (Pibor county, Jonglei state).

On 23 July 2026, teachers protested over salary arrears along the Custom Konyokonyo road in Custom Market (Juba, Central Equatoria). Further information notes that traffic police intervened (through unspecified means) and the protest remained peaceful.

On 23 July 2026, suspected armed Murle youth from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area attacked the Toposa community in Morunyang village at Chumakori Payam (location coded to Kochoto, Kapoeta North county, Eastern Equatoria state). There were no casualties.

On 23 July 2026, suspected armed Toposa community members from Eastern Equatoria attacked a Murle cattle camp and raided an unknown number of cattle in Ngoli village in Agoy (Verteth, Pibor, Jonglei). 1 person was injured.

On 23 July 2026, unidentified assailants (coded as unidentified communal militia) shot and killed a member of the Waat sub-section of the Macar section of the Gok Dinka near Arial-Lai village in Abiriu payam (location coded to Abiriu, Cueibet county, Lakes state). The motive is unknown.

On 22 July 2026, heavily armed members of Cie Tut section of the Lou Nuer from the Meer area shot at an armed man from Cie-Lual section of the Lou Nuer (whom they incorrectly believed to be a member of Cie Majok) and unspecified numbers people at Akobo market in Bilkey (Akobo county, Jonglei state) in what is described as a revenge incident. One person was killed and five people were wounded. The main market was closed following the incident.

On 22 July 2026, SSPDF troops fought against each other at the Mundari barracks in Lire Payam, near Lire (Kajo Keji, Central Equatoria). The incident was related to a dispute over salary payments. 3 people were killed.

On 22 July 2026, Cie-thin clan members clashed with Cie-jang clan members (both likely from the Lou Nuer community, based on location) in Wechdeng (Waat, Nyirol, Jonglei). 1 person was killed. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 22 July 2026, armed individuals (coded as unidentified armed group) ambushed a UN Agency construction company convoy of trucks in Nyuak payam (location coded to Ajong, Twic East county, Jonglei state). 2 construction engineers were injured and evacuated to Juba for treatment.

On 22 July 2026, unknown local gunmen (coded as unknown communal militia) killed a female refugee in her shelter in Ajuong Thok Refugee Camp (Jamjang, Panriang, Unity). The incident created tension between the refugees and the host community.

On 21 July 2026, armed youths (described as being criminals from the host community) attacked a Sudanese refugee youth in Block 12 at Ajuong Thok Refugee Camp in Jamjang (Panriang county, Unity state). The Sudanese youth ran inside the house of a woman. The armed youths then opened fire inside the house, killing the woman and injuring two other people, with one being in critical condition in the hospital. No further information.

On 21 July 2026, suspected NAS militants abducted a driver, a nurse, and a local community chief from an ambulance belonging to Morobo PHCC as it was transporting a patient to Morobo Centre in Isebi village in Lujulu payam (location coded to Lujulu, Morobo county, Central Equatoria state). The perpetrators requested an unspecified amount as ransom. The abductees were released on July 29.

On 21 July 2026, an unknown armed group attacked SSPDF positions and engaged the soldier in an armed clash in Aswa village of Pageri Payam (Magwi, Eastern Equatoria). 3 people were killed. Further information unknown/not reported.

On 21 July 2026, suspected armed Murle youth attacked people (likely members of the Lou Nuer community, based on location) travelling between Gangrial and Khankhan Woreda in Gangrial village in Dengjok payam (location coded to Dengjok, Akobo county, Jonglei state). 5 people were killed and 1 person was injured.

Looting: On 21 July 2026, suspected Murle youth clashed with local youth (likely Gun section of the Lou Nuer, based on location) who repelled their attempt to raid cattle (no clashes reported) at a cattle camp in Wunbil (Waat, Nyirol, Jonglei). There were no casualties.

On 20 July 2026, armed men, described as affiliates and members of NAS, abducted a midwife nurse and a driver from an unspecified village near Morobo (Morobo county, Central Equatoria state). The motive is unknown/not reported. No further information is available.

On 20 July 2026, 90 representatives from the Giir subsection of the Apuk section of the Rek Dinka from Warrap state and the Marial-Wau (likely Jur community who inhabit Marial Wau area in Western Bahr el Ghazal state) signed a peace agreement at Wau, Wau North (Wau county, Western Bahr el Ghazal state). The agreement aims to end hostilities and facilitate the return of internally displaced persons. The two communities had been fighting over Manyang village.

On 20 July 2026, two unidentified sub-clans of the Pakam section of the Agar Dinka clashed at Thou-Bor village in Malek payam (location coded to Malek in Rumbek Centre county, Lakes state) in what was described as a revenge incident. Three people were wounded and received treatment at a hospital.

On 20 July 2026, armed youth from the Ayual section of the Twic East Dinka clashed with armed youths from the Hol Dinka community in the Biothagany highland in Nyuak payam (location coded to Ajong, Twic East county, Jonglei state). 22 people were killed and an unknown number were injured. The clash was related to revenge.

On 20 July 2026, suspected armed NAS militants assaulted an individual in Lujulu Payam (Morobo county, Central Equatoria state). The victim was taken to a local hospital for treatment. Motivation unknown/not reported.

Looting: On 20 July 2026, suspected armed youth from the Akook sub-section of the Aliap section of the Rek Dinka raided an unspecified number of cattle from Ngapanet village in Ananatak payam (location coded to Ananatak, Tonj East county, Warrap state) (victims are likely from the Aliap section of the Rek Dinka, based on location).

Looting: On 20 July 2026, unknown youth (suspected to be from Gogrial East county and likely Apuk section of the Rek Dinka) stole an unspecified number of goats from Wara-Ayak village in Wau Bai payam (location coded to Nyin Akok, Jur River County, Western Bahr el Ghazal State). Local authorities arrested three suspects. Victims are likely from the Luo community based on location.

On 19 July 2026, Hol Dinka from Duk county and Ayual section of the Twic East Dinka clashed at Bioth-Agany Fishing Island in Duk county (location coded to Duk Padiet in Padiet, Jonglei state). Nine members of the Hol were killed, and eight people were wounded, including four from the Hol Dinka. SSPDF forces were deployed to the area to calm the situation.

On 19 July 2026, members of the Ngok Lual Yak section of the Padang Dinka from Baliet County clashed with members of the Paweng section of the Dinka from Pigi County in Asossa near Malakal (Malakal North, Malakal, Upper Nile). 1 person was killed. Following the incident, the market was shut down, and a curfew was set from 1700hrs to 0600hrs. Additionally, joint security forces were stationed by local authorities in the market area of Malakal Town.

On 19 July 2026, armed youth from Twic East county (likely Twic East Dinka, based on origin) clashed with youth from Duk county (coded as unidentified communal militia) at Biothagany fishing site in Nyuak payam (location coded to Ajong, Twic East county, Jonglei state). 4 people were injured. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 19 July 2026, suspected armed Bul Nuer community members from Mayom County attacked Leek Nuer community members and robbed them of personal belongings in Ngol village in Budang payam (location coded to Thangoro, Rubkona county, Unity state). 1 person was killed.

On 18 July 2026, suspected armed Bul Nuer community members clashed with SSPDF soldiers after stealing cattle from the Panaru section of the Ruweng Dinka in Aliiny (Aliiny, Panriang, Unity). 5 people were killed, including a local official.

On 18 July 2026, armed Bul Nuer community members clashed with community members (likely also from the Bul Nuer community based on location) based in Loath village in Mankien Payam (location coded to Mankien, Mayom county, Unity state). The clash was related to revenge, 4 people were killed and 7 people were injured.

On 18 July 2026, armed youth from Rubkona and Mayom counties (likely from the Nuer community, based on origin) clashed with local youth (likely from the Ruweng Dinka community, based on location) and raided an unspecified number of cattle in Pagueer village in Aliiny Payam (location coded to El Nar, Pariang county, Unity state). 3 people were killed.

On 18 July 2026, suspected armed youth from the Pabong sub-section of the Agar section of the Pakam Dinka clashed with suspected armed youth from the Manuer sub-section of the Agar section of the Pakam Dinka in Thou cattle camp in Malek Payam (Rumbek Centre county, Lakes state). The clash was related to revenge based on an incident in 2022 (further information unknown/not reported). 2 people were injured.

Looting: On 18 July 2026, suspected armed youth from the Gok Dinka community from Cueibet county raided 28 cattle from a cattle camp of the Thony section of the Rek Dinka in Manyang-Ngok payam (location coded to Manyang-Ngok, Tonj South county, Warrap state).

On 16 July 2026, unidentified individual/individuals (coded as unidentified armed group) shot and killed an SSPDF while he was fishing in Mangalla (Juba, Central Equatoria). Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 16 July 2026, unknown armed individuals (suspected to be from Panyijiar County and likely from the Nyong Nuer community) raided cattle and abducted two children (likely members of the Agar Dinka community, based on location) in Athom-Piir village in Mayom Payam (location coded to Mayom, Rumbek Centre county, Lakes state). There were no casualties.

On 16 July 2026, unknown armed individuals (coded as unidentified armed group) shot and killed an SSPDF (military) soldier at a fishing site in Mangalla South Payam (location coded to Mogiri, Juba county, Central Equatoria state). Motivation unknown/not reported.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Sudans Post
properties.notes: Around 15 July 2026 (month of), suspected National Salvation Front (NAS) and an unidentified armed group abducted between 90-134 people, including 6 children, in several locations in Central Equatoria state, including Yei (Yei county) and Lainya and Morobo (coded separately). The abductions were possibly for forced recruitment. The Yei commissioner accused the groups of taking the abductees to the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC). An unspecified number of abductees escaped. The government has intensified security patrols in the affected area.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Sudans Post
properties.notes: Around 15 July 2026 (month of), suspected National Salvation Front (NAS) and an unidentified armed group abducted between 90-134 people, including 6 children, in several locations in Central Equatoria state, including Lainya (Lainya county) and Yei and Morobo (coded separately). The abductions were possibly for forced recruitment. The Yei commissioner accused the groups of taking the abductees to the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC). An unspecified number of abductees escaped. The government has intensified security patrols in the affected area.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Sudans Post
properties.notes: Around 15 July 2026 (month of), suspected National Salvation Front (NAS) and an unidentified armed group abducted between 90-134 people, including 6 children, in several locations in Central Equatoria state, including Morobo (Morobo county) and Yei and Lainya (coded separately). The abductions were possibly for forced recruitment. The Yei commissioner accused the groups of taking the abductees to the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC). An unspecified number of abductees escaped. The government has intensified security patrols in the affected area.

Around 15 July 2026 (month of), unknown pastoralists (coded as unidentified communal militia) killed more than 30 cattle keepers/owners and damaged an unspecified number of properties in Cueibet at Malou Pec (Cueibet county, Lakes state) in cattle raid related incidents. No further information available.

Movement of forces: Around 14 July 2026 (as reported), youth from Ruweng Administrative Area (likely Ruweng Dinka, based on the location) mobilized in Bongki payam near Aliiny (Panriang, Unity), using unspecified means, to raid Payangay cattle camp in Rubkona, following their 22-23 June clashes with armed cattle keepers in the county. No further information.

Looting: On 14 July 2026, suspected youth from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle) looted 210 cattle from a grazing site in Ayod (Ayod, Jonglei). Local youths recovered the cattle shortly after the raid. It is unclear whether a clash occurred.

On 13 July 2026, suspected armed Murle youths abducted and attacked 3 students on their way from Ethiopia in an area called Po-Ataaki between Boyi and Adongol (Pochalla South, Jonglei). Motivation unknown/not reported. 1 boy was shot and killed, and another was abducted.

On 13 July 2026, suspected armed Murle community youth ambushed two individuals at Boyi village in Pochalla payam (location coded to Pochalla, Pochalla county, Jonglei state). 1 person was killed and 1 person was abducted. Victims are likely from the Anyuak community who live in the area.

On 13 July 2026, unidentified perpetrator(s) (coded as unidentified armed group) killed a foreign national truck driver contracted to an INGO while traveling between Wau and Juba counties after delivering goods in Abiriu payam (location coded to Abiriu, Cueibet county, Lakes state).
On 11 July 2026, suspected SSPDF opened fire at a boat carrying six Goal International staff between Ulang and Nasser (location coded to Ulang, Ulang, Upper Nile). There were no casualties.

On 11 July 2026, suspected SSPDF gunfire killed an unspecified individual near the former Medecins Sans Frontieres hospital in Hai Pur near Ulang (Ulang, Upper Nile). Motivation unknown/not reported. The SSPDF denied the accusation and claimed the violence was the result of a communal feud in Ulang and Nasser counties.

On 11 July 2026, suspected youth from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle) abducted 6 female travelers (including 4 children) near Pajiek payam (location coded to Fankur, Ayod, Jonglei). Local youths confronted the abductors using unspecified means and returned the travelers.
On 11 July 2026, NAS forces attacked SSPDF in Senema (Wudabi, Morobo, Central Equatoria). Injuries are unknown.

On 11 July 2026, an SSPDF soldier detonated a hand grenade next to the accommodation of individuals (coded as Luo, based on location) with whom he had a personal dispute in Wau (Wau North, Wau, Western Bahr el Ghazal). 3 people were injured.

On 11 July 2026, suspected armed Toposa community youth clashed with armed Buya/Boya community youth at Khor Machi cattle camp in Machi One payam (location coded to Loming, Kapoeta South County, Eastern Equatoria state). 5 people were killed and an unknown number of people were wounded.
Looting: On 11 July 2026, suspected Murle youth raided an unknown number of cattle from members of the Bor Dinka community on the outskirts of Panyagor (Kongor, Twic East, Jonglei).

On 10 July 2026, suspected gunmen from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle) clashed with cattle keepers (coded as unidentified clan militia) during a cattle raid attempt in Baliet forest (location coded to Ayod, Ayod, Jonglei). 3 people were killed and 5 others were injured.

On 10 July 2026, armed youth suspected to be from Jur River county (coded as Jur River communal militia) attacked the Payam administrator's residence in Matiel village in Nyang payam (location coded to Nyang, Gogrial East county, Warrap state). The attack was related to a local intercommunal dispute. There were no injuries.

On 9 July 2026, suspected armed youth from Cueibet county (likely Gok Dinka based on the county), including one SSPDF member, clashed with SSPDF in Akucieng village in Manyang-Ngok (location coded to Manyang-Ngok, Tonj South, Warrap) and looted locals' cattle. 1-2 people were killed (including a civilian and a soldier).
On 9 July 2026, a suspected Murle ethnic militia ambushed SSPDF vehicles in Tenet (Pibor, Jonglei). 1 person was killed and 1 injured.

On 9 July 2026, armed individuals (suspected to be from Cueibet county in Lakes state and coded as Langdiing section of the Gok Dinka) killed two people including a police officer (it is unclear if he was on duty) during a cattle raid in Mayom Kersied village in Tonj payam (location coded to Tonj, Tonj South, Warrap). The victims were coded as Rek Dinka, based on location.

Change to armed group: On 8 July 2026, SPLM IO sector 2 chief of administration claimed that he and hundreds of others defected to SSPDF in Unity state (location coded to Bentiu, Rubkona, Unity), accusing SPLM IO's Machar of lacking clear guidance.

On 8 July 2026, a suspected Didinga ethinc militia attacked artisanal gold miners (likely Didinga, based on location) in Nauro payam (location coded to Lauru, Budi county, Eastern Equatoria state) and killed 1 person.

On 8 July 2026, a suspected Turkana militia from Kenya engaged in an armed clash with goat owners (likely Toposa, based on location and coded as Toposa ethnic militia) during an attempted raid on goats in Kokoro (Narus, Kapoeta East, Eastern Equatoria). 1 person was injured.

On 8 July 2026, an unidentified armed group fired upon an INGO boat travelling along the Sobat River between Ulang and Nasir counties in the Wuw-Wuw area near Nasir (Nasir, Luakpiny/Nasir, Upper Nile). There were no injuries, though the INGO boat was damaged.

On 8 July 2026, unknown armed youth (likely Jikany Nuer, based on location) fired randomly between the market and military barracks in Nasir (Nasir, Luakpiny/Nasir, Upper Nile) and killed (one person coded as Jikany Nuer, based on location), The move was suspected attempt to provoke armed forces in the area.

On 8 July 2026, unknown armed individuals suspected to be from Unity State (coded as unidentified communal militia) killed one civilian and injured two others (coded as Akop section of the Rek Dinka, based on location) when they attacked and attempted to raid cattle in Atuor village in Alabek payam (location coded to Alabek, Tonj North county, Warrap state).

On 7 July 2026, members from the Pagok subsection of the Langdiing section of the Gok Dinka clashed with a clan militia (described as Padol, likely Langdiing section of the Gok Dinka due to location) in Pagoor (Cueibet, Lakes), and fired at members of the Awan clan who attempted to intervene. 2 people were killed and 3 were injured and hospitalized.
On 7 July 2026, suspected armed Murle youth attacked and injured one civilian (coded as Kongor section of the Twic East Dinka, based on location) in Panyagor (Kongor, Twic East, Jonglei).

On 7 July 2026, armed youth suspected to be from the Pangui community (coded as Langdiing section of the Gok Dinka) attacked a cattle camp in Pagoor payam (location coded to Pagoor, Cueibet county, Lakes state). 2 people were killed and 6 were injured (victims coded as Langdiing section of the Gok Dinka, based on location).

Looting: On 7 July 2026, armed youth suspected to be from the Marial Lou section of the Rek Dinka (coded as Marial Lou-Rek Sub-Clan militia) raided an unknown number of cattle from civilians, (likely Luach-Jang Dinka, based on location) at Biglier village in Makuac payam (location coded to Malwal, Tonj East county, Warrap state).

On 6 July 2026, armed youth from Lowoi (described as Monyomiji, coded as Lokoya ethnic militia) clashed with abductors from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle) in Lowoi (Torit, Eastern Equatoria). The clash ensued after the Murle abducted 2 children (one boy and a girl) around the day before (coded separately). The armed youth retrieved the children and killed at least 2 abductors.

On 6 July 2026, unknown armed individuals (coded as unidentified armed group) opened fire with small arms on a commercial vehicle travelling from Kapoeta to Torit on the road in Haforiere (Hiyala, Torit, Eastern Equatoria). There were no casualties.

On 6 July 2026, a Cie-thirien community member (coded as Lou Nuer) clashed with a member of the Puol section of the Lou Nuer with small arms fire in Pading payam (Nyirol county, Jonglei state). 2 people were killed. The clash was revenge related.
On 5 July 2026, for the second day, the SSPDF clashed with NAS led by Lo Buron in the Dem residential area in Yei town (Yei county, Central Equatoria state). Casualties unknown.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: Around 5 July 2026 (between 5 July - 6 July), suspected Murle armed youths abducted 2 children (one boy and a girl) from Panyikwara in Lowoi (Torit, Eastern Equatoria). The abduction occurred after the youths raided 35 cattle, which were recovered the same day by local youths (no violent interactions reported).
On 5 July 2026, suspected NAS militants abducted an unknown number of civilians in Payawa (Mugwo, Yei, Central Equatoria). The same forces abducted civilians in Wundukari (coded separately).

Abduction: On 5 July 2026, suspected NAS militants abducted an unknown number of civilians in Wundukari (Mugwo, Yei, Central Equatoria). The same forces abducted civilians in Payawa (coded separately).

On 5 July 2026, suspected armed Monyomiji (youth guardians) from the Lotuko community clashed with suspected armed Murle youth from Greater Pibor Administrative Area in Lowoi (Kudo, Torit, Eastern Equatoria). The clash was related to the recovery of two abducted children. 2 people were killed.

On 5 July 2026, members of the Bol sub-section of the Mor section of the Lou Nuer clashed with members of the Tiang section of the Lou Nuer in Thol payam (location coded as Thol, Nyirol county, Jonglei state). 1 person from the Tiang section was killed.

On 5 July 2026, unknown armed individuals (suspected to be from Panyijiar county, coded as Nyong Nuer) wounded one person, abducted two children and raided an unspecified number of cattle at Tiit-gong cattle camp in Abang payam (location coded to Abang, Yirol West county, Lakes state). The abductees were later released.

On 5 July 2026, unidentified armed individuals (likely Toposa ethnic militia, based on location) shot and injured an SSPDF soldier who was burning charcoal in Nadapal (Narus, Kapoeta East, Eastern Equatoria).

On 4 July 2026, lecturers at the University of Bahr el-Ghazal marched on the streets in Wau, Wau North (Wau county, Western Bahr el Ghazal state), demanding eight months of unpaid salaries and five years of medical and flight allowances.
