On 4 July 2026, for the first day, the SSPDF clashed with NAS led by Lo Buron in the Dem residential area in Yei town (Yei county, Central Equatoria state). Six men aged 18 to 25 years were abducted by the armed group for forced recruitment. Casualties unknown.
On 4 July 2026, suspected NAS militants abducted eight civilians (likely Kakwa, based on location) in Undokori in Mugwo payam (location coded to Mugwo, Yei county, Central Equatoria state).

On 4 July 2026, SSPDF clashed with unknown youth suspected to be affiliated with NAS militants in Mugwo payam (location coded to Mugwo, Yei county, Central Equatoria state). Fatalities and injuries are unknown.
On 4 July 2026, University of Bahr El Ghazal staff staged a protest over salary arrears in Rumbek (Rumbek Town, Rumbek Centre, Lakes).

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Sudans Post; The City Review (South Sudan); VOA
properties.notes: On 3 July 2026, the SSPDF shielded and clashed with local youths described as a white army (coded as Nuer militia) in several villages including Keatbeek/Ketbek (location coded to Ketbek in Roam, Luakpiny/Nasir county, Upper Nile state), Koat, and Nasir town (coded separately). At least 1 person was killed. Fatality is coded to Nasir. Three people were wounded, one critically. Between 2,900 and 30,000 residents mainly women and children were displaced. Conflicting sources stated that the clash began after the SSPDF received news of the death of an SSPDF member who was accidentally shot by a hunter on 20 June. Another source claimed that an SSPDF member was shot and killed by the White Army while collecting sand from the river on 3 July prompting the clash. 1 fatality split across 3 locations, coded as 0 for this event.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Sudans Post; The City Review (South Sudan); VOA
properties.notes: On 3 July 2026, the SSPDF shielded and clashed with local youths described as a white army (coded as Nuer militia) in several villages including Koat/Kwat (location coded to Kwat in Kiech Kuon, Luakpiny/Nasir county, Upper Nile state) Keatbeek/Ketbek, and Nasir town (coded separately). At least 1 person was killed. Three people were wounded, one critically. Between 2,900 and 30,000 residents mainly women and children were displaced. Conflicting sources stated that the clash began after the SSPDF received news of the death of an SSPDF member who was accidentally shot by a hunter on 20 June. Another source claimed that an SSPDF member was shot and killed by the White Army while collecting sand from the river on 3 July prompting the clash. 1 fatality split across 3 locations, coded as 0 for this event.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Sudans Post; The City Review (South Sudan); VOA
properties.notes: On 3 July 2026, the SSPDF shielded and clashed with local youths described as a white army (coded as Nuer militia) in several villages, including Nasir town (location coded to Nasir in Nasir, Luakpiny/Nasir county, Upper Nile state), Keatbeek/Ketbek, and Koat/Kwat (coded separately). At least 1 person was killed. Three people were wounded, one critically. Between 2,900 and 30,000 residents mainly women and children were displaced. Conflicting sources stated that the clash began after the SSPDF received news of the death of an SSPDF member who was accidentally shot by a hunter on 20 June. Another source claimed that an SSPDF member was shot and killed by the White Army while collecting sand from the river on 3 July prompting the clash. 1 fatality split across 3 locations, coded as 1 for this event.

On 3 July 2026, suspected armed youth from the Yoal sub-section of the Mor section of the Lou Nuer clashed with an unidentified communal militia youth in Nasir (Nasir, Luakpiny/Nasir, Upper Nile). 1 person was injured.

On 3 July 2026, an unknown armed individual (coded as unidentified communal militia) killed a member of the Aguok section of the Rek Dinka in Abil-Nyang in Kirik payam (location coded to Kirik, Tonj North county, Warrap state). The motive is unknown.

On 2 July 2026, several academic staff from Rumbek University of Science and Technology, along with civil servants, peacefully marched on the streets of Rumbek in Rumbek Town (Rumbek Centre county, Lakes state), demanding eight months of unpaid salaries and five years of medical and flight allowances.

On 2 July 2026, suspected NAS militants ambushed two civilians traveling on a motorcycle along the Lasu-Libogo road (location coded to Lasu, Lasu payam, Yei county, Central Equatoria state). 1 person was abducted and 1 person was killed.
On 2 July 2026, a government soldier (coded as SSPDF) killed a civilian in Dior village (location coded to Ayod, Ayod payam, Ayod county, Jonglei state).

On 2 July 2026, youth suspected to be 'White Army' (coded as Nuer ethnic militia) killed a member of the official forces (coded as SSPDF) at a fishing site in Nasir payam (location coded to Nasir, Luakpiny/Nasir county, Upper Nile state).

On 1 July 2026, attackers described as criminals and suspected of being Murle armed youths from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area ambushed a passenger car traveling to Bor in Makerwen village near Panyagoor/Panyagor in Kongor (Twic East county, Jonglei state). At least 1 person was killed.

properties.location: UN House/UN Protection of Civilians Site
properties.notes: On 1 July 2026, multiple individuals fought at the IDP 3 site near UN House/UN Protection of Civilians Site (Rejaf Payam, Juba, Central Equatoria). 5 people were injured. No further details.
On 1 July 2026, unknown armed individuals (coded as unidentified armed group) clashed with SSPDF in Kaikang (Pub, Mayom, Unity). 1 person was killed and 4 people were injured.

Looting: On 1 July 2026, local community leaders (coded as unidentified communal militia) forcefully entered two separate compounds of an INGO at an unspecified location in Jinmagda payam (location coded to Yusuf Batil Refugee Camp, Maban county, Upper Nile state) and stole office furniture intended for a water project in the camps.

Looting: On 1 July 2026, suspected armed youth from the Marial Lou section of the Rek Dinka raided an unspecified number of cattle in the Luang-Abyei cattle camp at the border between Luanyjang and Lou-Paher in Ananatak payam (location coded tp Ananatak, Tonj East county, Warrap state). Youth from the Luach section of the Jang Dinka responded and retrieved some cattle.

Other: On 30 June 2026, the Uganda People's Defense Forces (UPDF) established a military barracks near Poge/Pugee in Pajok (Magwi county, Eastern Equatoria state). There was no violent interaction reported, but the community in the area stated they were harassed and threatened.

On 30 June 2026, unknown armed individuals (coded as unidentified armed group) ambushed two civilians along the Lafon-Mogiri road in Mogiri (Mangalla South, Juba, Central Equatoria). 1 person was killed.

On 30 June 2026, two suspected armed individuals from the Juer sub-section of the Akop section of the Rek Dinka killed two individuals from the Lou Mawien and Juer sub-sections of the Akop section of the Rek Dinka in Atayang village in Alabek payam (location coded to Alabek, Tonj North county, Warrap state).

On 29 June 2026, unknown armed assailants (coded as an unidentified clan militia) attacked 3 fishers (likely Rek Dinka based on the location) on a road to a fishing pond in Gogrial East county (location coded to Mangolapuk in Toch North, Warrap state) in what is described as a revenge incident (further details unknown/not reported). 2 people were killed.

On 29 June 2026, unknown armed assailants (coded as an unidentified clan militia) attacked cattle keepers (likely Rek Dinka based on the location) at a cattle camp in Gogrial East county (location coded to Mangolapuk in Toch North, Warrap state) in what is described as a revenge incident (further details unknown/not reported). 1 person was killed, and 3 people were shot in the chest and treated at a health facility.

Around 29 June 2026 (between 29 June - 30 June), an unidentified armed group ambushed people traveling along the Lafon-Mogiri road at Garile Ikeru, about one hour on foot from Mogiri (location coded Mogiri in Lire, Kajo Keji county, Central Equatoria state). One person was killed and one person escaped unharmed. Insecurity caused by road ambushes persists in the country.

On 28 June 2026, unknown armed youth (suspected to be from Greater Pibor Administrative Area and coded as Murle) raided cattle in the Kachumbari and Lomeyen areas in Lomeyen payam (location coded to Lomeyen, Kapoeta North county, Eastern Equatoria state). 3 people were killed and 1 person was injured (likely Toposa, based on location).

On 28 June 2026, unidentified armed individuals (coded as unidentified armed group) ambushed a commercial vehicle traveling between Akobo and Bor town in the Makerwen area near Panyagor (Kongor, Twic East, Jonglei). 1 person was killed.

On 27 June 2026, suspected armed Murle youth attempted to raid cattle from Giel cattle camp near Lankien (Thol, Nyirol, Jonglei). 1 person was killed (likely Kuoth sub-section of the Gun section of the Lou Nuer, based on location) and 1 person was wounded.

On 27 June 2026, suspected armed Murle from Greater Pibor Administrative Area attacked Thol (Thol, Nyirol, Jonglei), killing 1 person and injuring another (likely Kuoth sub-section of the Gun section of the Lou Nuer, based on location). The attack was likely opportunistic cattle raiding rather than organized raiding.

On 27 June 2026, suspected armed Pathiang sub-section of the Langdiing section of the Gok Dinka from Abiriu killed a civilian from the Ayiel sub-section of the Langdiing of the Gok Dinka over a cattle dispute in Agngrial (Ngap, Cueibet, Lakes). The suspects were arrested.

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 26 June 2026, cattle keepers from Kapoeta North county (likely Toposa based on the location) pursued and clashed with Murle raiders at an unspecified location in Kapoeta North county (location coded to Kochoto in Chumakori, Eastern Equatoria state). At least three people were killed, and one person was wounded. All raided cattle were recovered.

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: Looting: On 26 June 2026, a group of raiders suspected to be Murle raided over 2,000 head of cattle from two kraals, including Kachimakori (location coded to Kochoto in Chumakori, Kapoeta North county, Eastern Equatoria state) and Lomeyeng/Lomeyen (coded separately). The victims of the raid are likely Toposa cattle keepers based on the locations.

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: Looting: On 26 June 2026, a group of raiders suspected to be Murle raided over 2,000 head of cattle from two kraals, including Lomeyeng/Lomeyen in Lomeyen (Kapoeta North county, Eastern Equatoria state) and Kachimakori (coded separately). The victims of the raid are likely Toposa cattle keepers based on the locations.

On 26 June 2026, Uganda People's Defense Forces (UPDF) detained three SSPDF soldiers at Owiny Kibul in Pajok (Magwi county, Eastern Equatoria state). The motive is unknown/not reported. The soldiers are currently being held at Padibe in Uganda. SSPDF demanded the immediate release of their members. The acting commander at Nyacigak Nyaculuk training center in Owiny Kibul, accused Uganda of planning to grab lands in South Sudan.

On 26 June 2026, suspected Criminal Investigation Department (CID) and National Security Service Police detained a photojournalist in Bor (Bor South county, Jonglei state) for organizing and participating in protests regarding the cost of living and nonpayment of civil servant salaries (coded separately). His whereabouts remain unknown.
On 26 June 2026, SSPDF forces intervened as a group of suspected Murle community members attempted to abduct children near Liria (Liria, Juba, Central Equatoria), resulting in 1 injury.

Looting: On 26 June 2026, a group of suspected armed Murle attempted to raid an unspecified number of cattle near Mareng (Anyidi, Bor South, Jonglei) (victims coded as Bor Dinka, based on location). There were no injuries.

On 26 June 2026, unknown armed individuals suspected to be from Panyijiar county, Unity, (coded as Nyong Nuer, based on location) ambushed civilians (coded as Pajiek sub-section of the Lou section of the Ciec Dinka, based on location) along the Kap-Nyang road in Yali (Lou, Yirol East, Lakes). The victims escaped unharmed.

Looting: On 26 June 2026, unknown armed individuals suspected to be from Unity State (likely members of the Bul Nuer community based on location) raided an unspecified number of cattle near Turalei (Turalei, Twic, Warrap). Youth from Turalei pursued the attackers but were unsuccessful in retrieving the cattle. Victims of the raid are likely members of the Twic Dinka community who live in the area.

On 25 June 2026, attackers described as land grabbers (coded as an unidentified armed group) attacked the Molobur area in Lado in Northern Bari payam (Juba county, Central Equatoria state) over land-related disputes. At least 4 people were killed, including 3 women and a child. Two men were wounded.

On 25 June 2026, an unidentified armed group attacked internally displaced persons in the Kworojik area in Mangateen in Northern Bari (Juba county, Central Equatoria state). At least 2 women were killed. One person was wounded and treated at a hospital. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 25 June 2026, community members killed an 80-year-old man accused of witchcraft (likely Jagei Nuer, based on the location) in Gany payam in Koch county (location coded to Maal in Unity state). An unspecified number of perpetrators were arrested.

On 25 June 2026, armed raiders from the Jurwiir subsection of the Apuk section of the Rek attempted a raid and were repelled by cattle keepers from the Thony section of the Rek Dinka at the Thony grazing area in Tonj South county (location coded to Tonj, Warrap state). 2 Apuk raiders were killed. Four people were wounded, including two from Thony and two from Apuk, and received treatment at a health facility.

On 25 June 2026, suspected armed Bari community members attacked and killed four people and injured two others in the Malubor area near Kenyi (Northern Bari, Juba, Central Equatoria). The suspected motive is land related.

On 25 June 2026, suspected armed Boya/Buya community members attacked and raided cattle belonging to members of the Toposa community at the cattle camp in Lokwamor (Mosingo, Kapoeta North, Eastern Equatoria), resulting in 3 injuries and 1 fatality.

Looting: On 25 June 2026, a group of unknown armed individuals suspected to be from Lakes State (likely members of the Agar Dinka community based on location) attempted to raid cattle from cattle keepers (coded as Nyong Nuer, based on location) near Kanhial (Mayom, Panyijiar, Unity).

On 25 June 2026, members of the Manyang-Ngok community (coded as Thony section of the Rek Dinka, based on location) killed two unknown armed individuals (described as being from the Ayech section) near Manyang-Ngok (Manyang-Ngok, Tonj South, Warrap) in a suspected revenge attack.

Looting: On 25 June 2026, two unknown armed individuals (coded as unidentified communal militia) raided cattle near Torit (Torit, Eastern Equatoria). Officials intervened and recovered the cattle. Victims of the raid are likely members of the Lotuko community who live in the area.
On 24 June 2026, suspected Murle armed youths abducted five children (3 boys and 2 girls) from Kechak in Lowoi in Torit county (location coded to Torit, Torit, Eastern Equatoria).

On 24 June 2026, protesters from various professional associations, including civil servants, demonstrated in Bor town (Bor South county, Jonglei state) against delays in civil servants' salaries and the high cost of living. They called on the government to take action to address the economic crisis.
On 24 June 2026, suspected NAS militants abducted 36 civilians along the Yei-Juba Road near Bungu (Bungu, Juba, Central Equatoria).

On 24 June 2026, unknown armed individuals (coded as unidentified armed group) ambushed a commercial vehicle and killed two civilians on the Yei-Juba Road in Bungu (Bungu Payam, Juba, Central Equatoria).

On 24 June 2026, unknown armed individuals suspected to be members of NAS abducted a local Kakwa chief near Ombasi (Otogo, Yei, Central Equatoria). The suspects also attempted to abduct another person.

On 24 June 2026, two suspected Dinka community members clashed with fishermen from the Angakuei and Pathuyith sub-sections of the Athoc section of the Bor Dinka at a fishing site near Baidit (Baidit, Bor South, Jonglei), resulting in 3 fatalities and 2 injuries.

On 24 June 2026, unknown armed individuals (likely Gok Dinka, based on location) suspected to be from Malou-Pec payam in Cueibet County ambushed a commercial vehicle along the Rumbek-Kuajok Road between Bhar-gel and Malou-Pec (Malou-Pech, Cueibet, Lakes), looting personal belongings off the driver and passengers. There were 3 fatalities.

On 24 June 2026, armed youth suspected to be from Unity State (likely from the Nuer community based on the location) clashed with unknown armed youth suspected to be from Ruweng Administrative Area (likely Ruweng Dinka, based on location) in Panyang (Werthen, Pariang, Unity), resulting in an unknown number of injuries and fatalities.

On 23 June 2026, unknown armed youth suspected to be from Rubkona, Mayom, and Guit counties (likely Bul Nuer, based on location) clashed with armed youth from Pariang County in Ruweng Administrative Area (Panaru section of the Ruweng Dinka, based on location) in Agarak (Biu, Panriang, Unity), resulting in an unspecified number of fatalities and injuries. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.

On 23 June 2026, unknown armed youth suspected to be from Rubkona, Mayom, and Guit counties (likely Bul Nuer, based on location) clashed with armed youth from Pariang County in Ruweng Administrative Area (Panaru section of the Ruweng Dinka, based on location) in Kumagon (Nyeel, Panriang, Unity), resulting in an unspecified number of fatalities and injuries. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.

On 23 June 2026, unknown armed youth suspected to be from Rubkona, Mayom, and Guit counties (likely Bul Nuer, based on location) clashed with armed youth from Pariang County in Ruweng Administrative Area (Panaru section of the Ruweng Dinka, based on location) in Pankuach (Rubkona, Unity), resulting in an unspecified number of fatalities and injuries.

On 23 June 2026, a group of unidentified armed individuals (likely members of the Toposa community who live in the area) attacked a man visiting family in Korok village near Narus (Narus, Kapoeta East, Eastern Equatoria), resulting in 1 fatality.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Sudans Post
properties.notes: Around 22 June 2026 (between 22 June - 23 June), armed cattle keepers from Rubkona county in Unity state (likely Leek Nuer, based on the county) clashed with youth from the Ruweng Administrative Area (likely Ruweng Dinka, based on the location) at Panakuach in Aliiny payam (location coded in Aliiny, Panriang county, Unity state) during the handover of 42 cattle recovered from raiders around 15 June (coded separately). 14 people were killed, including a Rubkona youth, Aliny County Executive Director (who was also the Deputy County Commissioner), officers from the national police and national security, and civilians. Six individuals sustained injuries and received hospital treatment. An unspecified number of people were displaced, and the whereabouts of others remain unknown. Valuables were looted from three subcontracted oil companies, and a company compound was set ablaze. An unspecified number of UNMISS peacekeepers were deployed to stabilize the situation. A conflicting source alleged soldiers initiated the clash by ambushing the Rubkona county commissioner's convoy, but the claim was denied and dismissed by the Acting Minister of Information in the Ruweng Administrative Area.

On 22 June 2026, armed attackers described as being associated with the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle) shot and killed a prison guard police officer (likely off-duty as the victim was killed while he was farming) in Pabial-Jokjoh, described as on the outskirts of Bor town (Bor South county, Jonglei state). No further information is available.
On 22 June 2026, two groups of Didinga community members clashed for an unknown reason in Camp 15 (Loriyok, Budi, Eastern Equatoria), resulting in 1 fatality.

On 22 June 2026, suspected Murle ambushed youth from Bor town (Bor Dinka, based on location) while they were performing a routine patrol in Mareng (Anyidi, Bor South, Jonglei), resulting in 1 fatality.

On 22 June 2026, unknown armed individuals suspected to be Ciec Dinka community members ambushed civilians in a boat belonging to the members of Nyuong Nuer community along the river between Jirwach and Chambek areas near Adior (Adior, Yirol East, Lakes), resulting in 5 fatalities and 7 injuries.

On 21 June 2026, attackers from Lakes state (coded as an unidentified armed group) attacked a commercial motorboat along the Nile River in Nyirol county (location coded to Lankien in Thol, Jonglei state). At least 4 passengers (from Ayod and Duk counties, likely members of Gawaar Nuer and Bor Dinka, respectively) were killed, and six people were wounded. The boat was en route to Juba.

On 21 June 2026, unknown armed individuals suspected to be from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (likely Murle based on location) attacked members of the Nuer community (likely Den sub-section of the Gun section of the Lou Nuer, based on location) near Pading (Pading, Nyirol, Jonglei). There was 1 fatality and 1 adult and 2 children were abducted.

On 21 June 2026, unknown armed individuals suspected to be from Greater Pibor Administrative Area (likely Murle based on location) raided an unspecified number of cattle in Diknyala village near Waat (Waat, Nyirol, Jonglei), resulting in 1 fatality. The victim was likely Gun section of the Lou Nuer, based on location.

On 21 June 2026, unidentified armed individuals suspected to be from the Ruop section of the Agar Dinka attacked local farmers (likely Gok Dinka based on location) near Abiriu (Abiriu, Cuiebet, Lakes), resulting in 1 injury.

On 20 June 2026, members of Pan-Ariik and Pan Akuei, both described as belonging to Lou Ariik/Lou Mawien of the Akop section of the Rek Dinka, clashed in the Lou Ariik area of Tonj North county (location coded to Ariik in Akop, Warrap state) in what was described as revenge for events that occurred on 23 December 2023 (further information unknown/not reported). Three people were killed and fourteen were wounded. Four individuals, including one local chief, were arrested.

On 20 June 2026, women and members of religious groups, professional associations, students, youths, and civil society protested in Bor (Bor South, Jonglei) against civil servants' and military forces' delayed salaries. Security forces intervened (means not specified).
On 20 June 2026, cattle herders suspected to be from Uganda clashed with and killed an unknown individual from Magwi county at Oligwi village near Nimule (Nimule, Magwi, Eastern Equatoria).

On 20 June 2026, armed youth suspected to be from Uror county (likely Gun section of the Lou Nuer based on location) clashed with armed youth suspected to be from Duk county (likely Dinka based on location) for an unknown reason near Juet (Uror, Jonglei), resulting in 2 fatalities and 1 injury.

On 20 June 2026, unknown armed individuals suspected to be from Tonj South county (coded as Tonj South communal militia) attacked civilians at Malou-Pec (Malou-Pec, Cueibet, Lakes), resulting in 5 injuries and raided an unspecified number of cattle. The victims were likely Gok Dinka based on location.

On 20 June 2026, armed youths suspected to be from Panyijiar county in Unity state (likely Nyong Nuer based on location) attacked civilians at Amok (Mayen, Rumbek North, Lakes), resulting in 4 fatalities and 1 injury. The attackers raided an unspecified number of cattle, and the victims were likely Pakam section of the Agar Dinka based on location.
On 20 June 2026, a group of youth (coded as unidentified communal militia) clashed with SSPDF for unspecified reasons near Nasir (Nasir, Luakpiny/Nasir, Upper Nile). 1 soldier was injured.

On 20 June 2026, an unknown armed individual (coded as unidentified armed group) suspected to be from Nasir town injured an official in Nasir (Nasir, Luakpiny/Nasir, Upper Nile). The situation was contained by local authorities.

On 19 June 2026, for the fifth day, raiders from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle) clashed with cattle keepers from Nyirol county in Jonglei state (likely Lou Nuer, based on the county) in different payams along Chuil Road in Nyirol county, including in Chuil (location coded to Chuil, Nyirol county, Jonglei state) and Pulturuk payams (coded separately). At least 11 people, including two attackers, were killed. 7 people, including 2 women, were wounded and received treatment at a hospital. 3 children aged 5 to 7 were abducted. 11 fatalities split over 10 events (15 - 19 June in two locations), coded as 1 for this event.

On 19 June 2026, for the fifth day, raiders from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle) clashed with cattle keepers from Nyirol county in Jonglei state (likely Lou Nuer, based on the county) in different payams along Chuil Road in Nyirol county, including in Pulturuk (location coded to Pulturuk, Nyirol county, Jonglei state) and Chuil payams (coded separately). At least 11 people, including two attackers, were killed. Seven people, including two women, were wounded and received treatment at a hospital. 3 children aged 5 to 7 were abducted. 11 fatalities split over 10 events (15 - 19 June in two locations), coded as 2 for this event.

properties.notes: On 19 June 2026, unknown armed individuals (coded as unidentified armed group) shot and killed two fishermen travelling by boat along the River Nile at Akuak village near Baidit (Baidit, Bor South, Jonglei) (based on location, victims coded as Athoc section of the Bor Dinka).

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Risk and Strategic Management, Corporation; Sudans Post
properties.notes: On 19 June 2026, SSPDF (military) and armed local youths from Yirol East county (based on location, villagers coded as Pajiek sub-section of the Lou section of the Ciec Dinka) pursued and clashed with armed raiders suspected of being from Panyijar county (likely Nyong Nuer, based on the county), following a goat raid at Yinhkar village in Billing boma (located coded to Billing in Adior, Yirol East county, Lakes state). 6 people were killed (3 SSPDF soldiers and 3 armed locals). 2 individuals were injured. During the raid, an elderly woman was abducted but later released. All the raided goats were recovered.

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; Sudans Post; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: Around 18 June 2026 (between 18 June - 19 June), armed pastoralists from the Monytiak/Tiek and Bhoor/Boor, both subsections of the Ruop section of the Agar Dinka, clashed at Aluaal-adol/Alual-dol cattle camp in Malek payam (location coded to Malek in Rumbek Centre county, Lakes state). At least 3 people were killed. Two people, one from each side, were wounded in the chest, legs, and arms and received treatment at the hospital.

Seven people, including two women, were wounded and received treatment at a hospital. 3 children aged 5 to 7 were abducted. 11 fatalities split over 10 events (15 - 19 June in two locations), coded as 1 for this event.

At least 11 people, including two attackers, were killed. Seven people, including two women, were wounded and received treatment at a hospital. 3 children aged 5 to 7 were abducted. 11 fatalities split over 10 events (15 - 19 June in two locations), coded as 1 for this event.

On 18 June 2026, an unknown armed group (coded as unidentified communal militia) raided an unspecified number of cattle from a local man (likely Lou Nuer based on the location) in Thol payam (location coded to Thol in Nyirol county, Jonglei state).1 person was killed and 2 others were abducted and their whereabouts are unknown/not reported.

On 18 June 2026, armed Mbororo nomads attacked members of the Shilluk community in Atar Orin area of Atar (Guelguk, Longochuk, Upper Nile), displacing an unknown number of civilians and injuring 1 person.

On 18 June 2026, unknown individuals suspected to be from Mayom County (based on location, coded as Bul Nuer) clashed with Jur Manageer youth after a cattle raid in Mayenjur area near Nyang (Nyang, Gogrial East, Warrap), resulting in 2 fatalities.

On 18 June 2026, unknown armed youths suspected to be from Unity State (coded as unidentified communal militia) raided an unspecified number of cattle near Turalei (Turalei, Twic, Warrap), resulting in 2 injuries (based on location, victims coded as Twic Dinka).

On 17 June 2026, for the third day, raiders from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle) clashed with cattle keepers from Nyirol county in Jonglei state (likely Lou Nuer, based on the county) in different payams along Chuil Road in Nyirol county, including in Chuil (location coded to Chuil, Nyirol county, Jonglei state )and Pulturuk payams (coded separately). At least 11 people, including two attackers, were killed. Seven people, including two women, were wounded and received treatment at a hospital. 3 children aged 5 to 7 were abducted. 11 fatalities split over 10 events (15 - 19 June in two locations), coded as 1 for this event.

At least 11 people, including two attackers, were killed. Seven people, including two women, were wounded and received treatment at a hospital. 3 children aged 5 to 7 were abducted. 11 fatalities split over 10 events (15 - 19 June in two locations), coded as 1 for this event.

They called on the government to take action to address the economic crisis.

On 17 June 2026, members of the Boor sub-section of the Ruop section of the Agar Dinka clashed with members of the Ajeik sub-section of the Ruop section of the Agar Dinka at the Paben cattle camp in Malek payam (location coded to Malek, Rumbek Centre county, Lakes state) in a revenge incident. 3 people were killed.

On 17 June 2026, the Panakuei /Akuei subsection of the Aliab Dinka clashed with the Panarek/Parek sub-subsection of the Awan subsection of the Akop section of the Rek Dinka at an unspecified location in Alabek payam (location coded to Alabek, Tonj North county, Warrap state) in a revenge incident. 6 people were killed. 8 people were wounded.

On 17 June 2026, unknown gunmen (coded as an unidentified armed group) shot and injured a community member (likely a Thony section of the Rek Dinka, based on the location where the incident happened) in Wund-Ngong village in Manyang-Ngok payam (location coded to Manyang-Ngok, Tonj South county, Warrap state).

On 16 June 2026, for the second day, raiders from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle) clashed with cattle keepers from Nyirol county in Jonglei state (likely Lou Nuer based on the county) in different payams along Chuil Road in Nyirol county, including in Chuil (location coded to Chuil, Nyirol county, Jonglei state) and Pulturuk payams (coded separately). At least 11 people, including two attackers, were killed. Seven people, including two women, were wounded and received treatment at a hospital. 3 children aged 5 to 7 were abducted. 11 fatalities split over 10 events (15 - 19 June in two locations), coded as 1 for this event.

At least 11 people, including two attackers, were killed. Seven people, including two women, were wounded and received treatment at a hospital. 3 children aged 5 to 7 were abducted. 11 fatalities split over 10 events (15 - 19 June in two locations), coded as 1 for this event.

On 16 June 2026, unknown armed individuals (coded as unidentified armed group) attacked a UN agency national staff member and a staff member of a UN contractor traveling in a private vehicle from Ikotos to Tseretenya village at the South Sudan-Uganda border in Losite payam (location coded to Tseretenya, Ikotos county, Eastern Equatoria state). The perpetrators injured the UN agency national staff member and looted 1.6 million South Sudanese pounds meant for staff salaries.

On 16 June 2026, unidentified armed individuals (coded as unidentified communal militia) attacked two Kurenen age-set of the Murle community traveling from Pibor town to Manyeran village in Pibor payam (location coded to Manyeran, Pibor county, Jonglei state), killing 1 person and injuring another.

On 16 June 2026, suspected Murle cattle raiders clashed with pastoralists suspected to be from Twic East (likely the Ajuong section of the Twic East Dinka) at Gadiang in Nyuak (Twic East county, Jonglei state). 3 people were injured.

Around 15 June 2026 (between 15 June - 16 June), at night, hundreds of heavily armed youths, suspected to be from the Parieng area of Ruweng Administrative Area (likely Ruweng Dinka, based on the location) attacked nine cattle camps belonging to Leek Nuer cattle keepers in the Payangai area at Rotriak in Budang (Rubkona county, Unity State). Five cattle keepers, including three children, a woman and a man, were wounded and received treatment at a hospital. Between 2,400 to 5,000 head of cattle were raided. The chairman of the Leek Nuer community accused SSPDF and senior government officials of letting the attackers use 7 SSPDF trucks and firearms.

On 15 June 2026, for five days, raiders from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle) clashed with cattle keepers from Nyirol county in Jonglei state (likely Lou Nuer based on the county) in different payams along Chuil Road in Nyirol county, including in Chuil (location coded to Chuil, Nyirol county, Jonglei state) and Pulturuk payams (coded separately). At least 11 people, including two attackers, were killed. 7 people, including 2 women, were wounded and received treatment at a hospital. 3 children aged 5 to 7 were abducted. 11 fatalities split over 10 events (15 - 19 June in two locations), coded as 1 for this event.

On 15 June 2026, for five days, raiders from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle) clashed with cattle keepers from Nyirol county in Jonglei state (likely Lou Nuer based on the county) in different payams along Chuil Road in Nyirol county, including in Pulturuk (location coded to Pulturuk, Nyirol county, Jonglei state) and Chuil payams (coded separately). At least 11 people, including two attackers, were killed. Seven people, including two women, were wounded and received treatment at a hospital. 3 children aged 5 to 7 were abducted. 11 fatalities split over 10 events (15 - 19 June in two locations), coded as 1 for this event.
On 15 June 2026, suspected armed Murle community members stopped and assaulted travelers along the Chuil-Lankien road near Thol (Thol, Nyirol, Jonglei), resulting in 3 injuries.

On 15 June 2026, armed raiders suspected to be from the Ruweng Administrative Area (likely Ruweng Dinka, based on location) clashed with Nuer community members and raided an unspecified number of cattle at Payangay near Thangoro in Budang payam (Rubkona county, Unity state). 5 people were wounded.

Looting: On 14 June 2026, unknown armed assailants (described as bandits, coded as an unidentified armed group) ambushed and looted food items for school feeding programs and other valuables from a convoy of four trucks at Kelangnya/Karanyang in Likuangole (Pibor county, Jonglei state).

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; Risk and Strategic Management, Corporation
properties.notes: On 14 June 2026, for the second day, armed raiders from Mayom county (coded as Bul Nuer) clashed with Twic Dinka cattle keepers at a cattle camp in Majok Noon in Aweng (Twic county, Warrap state) (based on location, coded as Akuar section of the Twic Dinka). 4 Bul Nuer were killed, and three Twic youth were wounded. Fatalities split over 2 days, coded as 2. Over 101 head of cattle were raided but later recovered. Ten cattle were shot and killed.

On 14 June 2026, suspected armed Gok Dinka youth from Cueibet county shot and killed a member of the Rek Dinka community and injured another in Bull-Aweer village in Wunlit payam (location coded to Wunlit,Tonj East county, Warrap state). The motive is unknown.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Sudans Post
properties.notes: On 13 June 2026, for the second day, over 400 prisoners provoked unrest, breaking doors, gates, and windows, and violently interacting with wardens in Manyang-Kuel Central Prison at Kuajok in Kuac North(Gogrial West county, Warrap state), demanding better conditions in the institution. There were no casualties. Forces were deployed to calm the situation. The riot was triggered after the prison administration issued a one-day lockdown for all inmates following the escape of eight prisoners on 11 June.

On 13 June 2026, pastoralists from the Panyar section of the Agar Dinka clashed with Pan-gop cattle keepers, described as of the Duor section of the Agar Dinka, at the Alau Jarweng cattle camp (location coded to Akot, Rumbek East county, Lakes state). The clash erupted after a disagreement between two men from each group, and then other people from the sections intervened. 1 person was killed and three people were wounded by gunfire.

On 13 June 2026, for two days, armed raiders from Mayom county (coded as Bul Nuer) clashed with Twic Dinka cattle keepers at a cattle camp at Majok Noon in Aweng (Twic county, Warrap state). 4 Bul Nuer were killed, and three Twic youths were wounded. Fatalities split between 2 days, coded as 2. Over 101 head of cattle were raided but later recovered. Ten cattle were shot and killed.

On 13 June 2026, a member of the Cie-Bool (alias of the Bol sub-section of the Mor section of the Lou Nuer) shot and killed a member of the Cie-Mankoat (based on location, coded as Mandak sub-section of the Mor section of the Lou Nuer) and injured a child in the crossfire in a revenge attack in Markus village near Akobo (Bilkey, Akobo, Jonglei). The killing was likely connected to 2018 inter-communal violence that claimed over 27 people between the two sub-clans (coded separately).

On 13 June 2026, members of the Panyar section of the Agar Dinka clashed with members of the Duor section of the Agar Dinka at the Alaw cattle camp near Paloc (Paloc, Rumbek East, Lakes), resulting in 2 deaths and 4 injuries.

On 13 June 2026, a group of armed individuals suspected to be from Unity State (coded as unidentified communal militia) raided cattle from the Majok Noon cattle camp near Aweng (Aweng, Twic, Warrap). Local youths (likely Twic Dinka based on location) exchanged small arms fire with the raiders and recovered all the cattle. There were no casualties.

On 13 June 2026, armed raiders, suspected to be from Panyijiar county (likely Nyong Nuer who reside in the county) clashed with the SSPDF and local youth from Kareer village (coded as Yirol communal militia) at Kareer, Adior (Yirol East county, Lakes state). One person was killed, and one SSPDF member was wounded. The Nuer youth were en route to Adior to raid cattle when they were intercepted.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Sudans Post
properties.notes: On 12 June 2026, for two days, over 400 prisoners provoked unrest, breaking doors, gates, and windows, and violently interacted with wardens in Manyang-Kuel Central Prison at Kuajok in Kuac North (Gogrial West county, Warrap state), demanding better conditions in the institution. There were no casualties. Forces were deployed to calm the situation. The riot was triggered after the prison administration issued a one-day lockdown for all inmates following the escape of eight prisoners on 11 June.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Miraya; Radio Tamazuj; Sudans Post; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 12 June 2026, female students demonstrated against the university's proposed increase in hostel fees and demanded improvements in living conditions at the University of Juba (Juba county, Central Equatoria state). The students pelted stones at the police and the Dean of Student Affairs. At least 24 students were beaten with gun butts and sustained injuries such as broken teeth, arm and leg fractures, and other physical injuries. 3 students were receiving treatment at a hospital. An unspecified number of police were also wounded. The police fired gunshots into the air. 73 students were detained and released on the same day. Personal belongings and parts of the facilities were damaged.

Other: On 12 June 2026, the Governor of Upper Nile State issued a decree in Malakal North (Malakal county, Upper Nile state), resulting in the dismissal and subsequent appointment of the technical advisor to the Ministry of Parliamentary and Legal Affairs, the technical advisor to the State Ministry of Health, advisor to the Ministry of Education advisor to the state Ministry of Roads and Bridges. 3 days before, the Malakal city Mayor for Finance and Administration was also dismissed. The decree comes amidst the intra-ethnic violence in the state.

On 12 June 2026, a group of students from the University of Juba rallied against an increase of hostel fees in Hai-Thora village near Hai Jebel (Juba, Central Equatoria). Demonstrators clashed with police, an unspecified number of students were arrested, and 5 injuries were reported.

On 12 June 2026, a group of unknown armed individuals (coded as unidentified armed group) ambushed a commercial vehicle along Torit-Kapoeta road near Camp 15 (Loriyok, Budi, Eastern Equatoria). An INGO national staff member suffered a gunshot wound to the leg. South Sudanese government forces (military or police) intervened and secured the commercial vehicle (it is unknown/not reported if there was a clash). No arrests were made.

On 12 June 2026, a group of unknown armed individuals suspected to be from Unity State (coded as unidentified communal militia) raided an unknown number of cattle in Ayeet village near Aweng (Aweng, Twic, Warrap). The victims were likely Twic Dinka based on location. There was 1 death.

On 12 June 2026, a group of students from the University of Juba demonstrated against an increase of hostel fees in Hai-Thora village in Juba (Juba, Central Equatoria). Demonstrators clashed with police, an unspecified number of students were arrested, and 5 injuries were reported.

Around 11 June 2026 (as reported), armed members of National Salvation Front ambushed a commercial fuel truck in the Mangaro area at Loka West in Kenyi (Lainya county, Central Equatoria state). A Kenyan driver was killed, and an SSPDF member escorting the truck was wounded. The truck was traveling from Yei to Juba.

On 11 June 2026, armed youth suspected to be from the disputed Abyei area (likely Ngok Dinka based in the area) attacked and wounded three fishers (likely Twic Dinka based on the location where the incident happened) at Ajak Kuach/Ajakkuac (Twic county, Warrap state).

On 11 June 2026, suspected NAS forces attacked a commercial fuel tanker in Mankaro village near Kenyi (Kenyi, Lainya, Central Equatoria), killing a driver. South Sudanese government forces (military or police) intervened, secured the tanker and passengers, and pursued the attackers (it is unknown/not reported if there was a clash).
On 11 June 2026, suspected NAS forces ambushed an SSPDF vehicle along the road from Morobo to Yei town in Yari (Mugwo, Yei, Central Equatoria). There was 1 death and 3 injuries.

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; Risk and Strategic Management, Corporation
properties.notes: On 10 June 2026, suspected Dinka youths from Baliet county attacked Jikany Nuer community members in Dieni village (Chuil, Nyirol, Jonglei) in what was described as revenge for an incident that happened a few days earlier in Baliet (coded separately). 1 person was killed, 2 people were injured, and houses were burnt.

Looting: On 10 June 2026, a group of suspected Bul Nuer raided 40 cattle belonging to the Leek Nuer (likely Gany section of the Leek Nuer based on the location) at Kaljak village (Kaljak, Rubkona, Unity). There were no casualties.

On 10 June 2026, a group of suspected Murle ambushed Lou Nuer community members (likely Kuoth sub-section of the Gun section of the Lou Nuer based on location) between Walgak and Lankien areas in Tut village (Thol, Nyirol, Jonglei). There were two injuries.

On 10 June 2026, suspected members of the Nielniel sub-section of the Pakam section of the Agar Dinka ambushed and killed a member of the Gak sub-section of the Pakam section of the Agar Dinka between Jalla and Puolbaar cattle camps near Abarkou (Jiir, Rumbek Centre, Lakes) in a suspected revenge attack.

Abduction: On 10 June 2026, suspected Balanda community members abducted a suspected Azande community member in Nabiama (Andari, Ezo, Western Equatoria). The perpetrators also abducted another suspected Azande individual in Nabanga (coded separately).

Abduction: On 10 June 2026, suspected Balanda community members abducted a suspected Azande community member in Nabanga (Nabanga, Ibba, Western Equatoria). The perpetrators also abducted another suspected Azande individual in Nabiama (coded separately).

properties.location: UNMISS Rubkona Protection of Civilians site
properties.notes: Around 9 June 2026 (between 9 June - 10 June), police arrested 70 internally displaced persons described as gangs and youths at the Bentiu IDP/UNMISS Rubkona Protection of Civilians site (Rubkona county, Unity state). The arrests occurred over two days. The youths have been accused of creating chaos, including fighting among themselves and forcefully taking guns from members of the police.

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; Risk and Strategic Management, Corporation
properties.notes: On 8 June 2026, a group of four suspected Lou Nuer from Nyirol county in Jonglei attacked an unknown number of farmers of the Yaak sub-section of the Lual section of the Ngok Dinka in Bil Aiwal village (Gel Achiel, Baliet, Upper Nile). 1 person was killed, and one person was wounded with a gunshot to both arms.

Looting: On 8 June 2026, two unidentified individuals (coded as unidentified armed group) gained access to a UN agency warehouse and stole an unknown number of bags of sorghum at the port in Malakal (Malakal North, Malakal, Upper Nile). Security guards on duty recovered two bags of sorghum.

Looting: On 7 June 2026, a group of unidentified individuals (coded as unidentified communal militia) stole cattle in Lowoi village (Kudo, Torit, Eastern Equatoria). The group attacked and injured an individual and stole the individual's gun.

On 7 June 2026, a group of suspected Murle attacked a cattle keeper (likely Yoal sub-section of the Mor section of the Lou Nuer based on location) and attempted to raid cattle in Meer village along the road near Kony (Nyandit, Akobo, Jonglei). There was one injury.

On 6 June 2026, at night, suspected armed assailants from Ayual subsection of the Lith section of the Twic East Dinka attacked Duk community (likely Bor Dinka, based on the location) at Lang Island in Duk county (location coded to Duk Padiet in Padiet, Jonglei state). At least 7 people were killed, and 10 others were wounded and treated at a hospital.

Looting: On 6 June 2026, a group of suspected Murle stopped a boat contracted by a UN agency carrying food aid and looted 22 cartoons of Ready to Use Therapeutic Food (RUTF) at gunpoint near Doma (Doma, Ulang, Upper Nile).

On 6 June 2026, suspected Murle armed individuals attacked Lou Nuer (likely Gun section of the Lou Nuer clan) homes to abduct children in Wunbil (Waat, Nyirol, Jonglei). Lou Nuer youth responded and pursued the attackers. There were no casualties.

Looting: On 6 June 2026, unidentified armed individuals (described as coming from Tor in Mayom County and coded as Bul Nuer) raided an unknown number of cattle from the Jikany Nuer community in Duar village (Jaak, Koch, Unity). Official forces recovered the cattle in the Tor area of Mayom County.

On 5 June 2026, unknown individuals (coded as an unidentified armed group) ambushed and wounded a UN contracted worker at an unspecified location between Mabiour and Wernyol/Warrnyel villages (Kangi, Jur River county, Western Bahr el Ghazal state). The reason is unknown/not reported. No further information is available.

On 5 June 2026, unknown armed individuals (coded as unidentified armed group) ambushed a commercial company contracted by a UN agency traveling between Mabior junction and Wernyol village along Canal Road near Beykers (Dongchak, Duk, Jonglei), injuring one person.

On 5 June 2026, armed Ayual Dinka community members attacked Hol Dinka community members at Lang Island near Jual (Ageer, Duk, Jonglei). Ten fatalities and ten injuries were reported between both sides.

On 4 June 2026, 2,000 men wearing military uniforms (coded as military) ambushed cattle traders (cattle keepers raising cattle for sale and coded as farmers) at the Jabor/Jubor roundabout near the Juba-Bor Highway in Mukaya (Lainya county, Central Equatoria state). 2 traders were killed, and six others were wounded. The whereabouts of 43 traders are unknown. Over 300 cattle were looted. An unspecified number of traders managed to escape unharmed.

On 4 June 2026, assailants suspected to be from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle) attacked a man and his three children (likely Lou Nuer based on the location) in a forest in Akobo (location coded to Akobo in Bilkey payam, Akobo county, Jonglei state). At least 1 person was killed. Three children were abducted. The victims were traveling to Nyikol village in Akobo.

Looting: On 4 June 2026, unknown armed individuals (coded as unidentified communal militia) stole ten cattle from the Dinka Pakam community at a cattle camp in Rumkor (Wun-rieng, Rumbek North, Lakes).

On 4 June 2026, suspected Bor Dinka youth attacked Murle cattle traders transporting cattle to Juba at the Wildlife checkpoint in Mangalla (Mangalla North, Juba, Central Equatoria). There were no casualties.
On 4 June 2026, a group of armed youth (suspected from Unity States) killed a fisherman at Atap-chok fishing camp near Aweng (Aweng, Twic, Warrap).

On 4 June 2026, unidentified armed individuals ambushed cattle traders in the Tharwangyiela area (as reported) near Thangoro (Budang, Rubkona, Unity). One trader was killed and an unspecified number of cattle were stolen.

On 4 June 2026, unidentified armed individuals in military uniforms ambushed Murle cattle traders along the Juba-Bor Road in Jobur area in Mangalla (Mangalla North, Juba, Central Equatoria). Five people were killed, ten were injured, and an unknown number of people were missing and unknown number of cattle were stolen.
On 4 June 2026, suspected Murle attacked Dinka Bor members on hunting ground in Gadiang village (Nyuak, Twic East, Jonglei). Three people were injured.

Around 3 June 2026 (as reported), communities, including Logir, Dongotono, Didinga, Toposa signed a peace agreement with Buya, Otuho/Lotuko, Pari, and Lopit in Eastern Equatoria state (location coded to Ikotos). More than 77 community members, including chiefs, youth, women, lawmakers, and law enforcement agencies from these communities residing along the Kideopo Valley area of South Sudan's Eastern Equatoria state, recommitted to implementing previous dialogues aimed at resolving ongoing conflicts, combating criminal activities, promoting peaceful coexistence, and sharing pastures and water resources along Kideopo Valley.
On 3 June 2026, unidentified armed individuals shot at Twic Dinka community members near the police station in Wunrok (Wunrok, Twic, Warrap). Two people were injured.

On 3 June 2026, suspected Murle attacked four civilians walking along the Duk Padiet-Duk Pagak road in Duk Padiet (Padiet, Duk, Jonglei). Two civilians were killed and a woman and child were abducted.
Looting: On 3 June 2026, suspected Murle raided an unspecified number of cattle at a cattle camp in Duk Padiet (Padiet, Duk, Jonglei). The stolen cattle have not been recovered.
On 3 June 2026, suspected Shilluk attacked and killed three Fellata/Mbororo individuals in Kubur Lul near Akoka (Akoka, Baliet, Upper Nile). The SSPDF arrested one suspect in Kodok area, Fashoda.

On 2 June 2026, attackers suspected of being Toposa clashed with security forces (likely military) along the Ngauro-Kapoeta Road (location coded to Namorunyang, Longeleya, Kapoeta South county, Eastern Equatoria state) following an ambush. 2 people were killed, including an SSPDF soldier and a Somali trader, who was also described as a driver. A Uganda and a Kenya nationals were injured and treated at a hospital. The ambushed vehicle belonged to Warsham Mining Company and was en route to Kapoeta Town.

On 2 June 2026, unidentified armed individuals attacked a truck loaded with fuel belonging to a petrol company at Ngauro village in Lauru (Nauro, Budi, Eastern Equatoria). Two people were shot and killed, one SSPDF member (likely armed and part of security escort) and a Somalia national, while two foreigners were wounded. No further information.
On 2 June 2026, local resident(s) killed a suspected thief while he attempted to escape in Wechjiokni village near Akobo (Bilkey, Akobo, Jonglei).

On 2 June 2026, suspected Luacjang Dinka from Makuac Payam in Tonj East County in Warrap) raided Tur cattle camp near Malueth (Malueth, Rumbek North, Lakes). The cattle owners pursued and killed two raiders and recovered their cattle.

On 2 June 2026, suspected NAS forces abducted an unspecified number of civilians along the border of South Sudan and the Democratic Republic of Congo in Lujulu (Lujulu, Morobo, Central Equatoria). Four abductees escaped to Lujulo village.
On 1 June 2026, SSPDF mobile infantry from the 7th Infantry Division clashed with the People Freedom Movement (PFM) at a hideout in Mugali (Magwi county, Eastern Equatoria state). 2 PFM were killed.

Change to armed group: Around 1 June 2026 (as reported), 53 SPLM IO MPs defected to the SPLM party at Kuajok in Kuac North (Gogrial West county, Warrap state), citing that the opposition party had been inciting community violence and lacked commitment to the democratic process. The Acting Press Secretary in the office of the First Vice President acknowledged the defections in Kuacjok but claimed the number of individuals was exaggerated and that it was less than half of the stated number.

On 1 June 2026, unidentified armed individuals ambushed community police in Dongkei-ajieth village near Matangai (Matangai, Rumbek Centre, Lakes) as the police escorted three suspected criminals from a cattle camp to Rumbek town. No injuries were reported. The suspected motive is a revenge attack. The three suspected criminals escaped during the incident.

Looting: On 1 June 2026, suspected Murle attacked two Lou Nuer and stole their cattle as they grazed their herd in Yuai (Weikol, Uror, Jonglei). The two cattle owners were injured during the incident. Local youths pursued the attackers but the cattle were not recovered.

On 1 June 2026, a member of the Chieng Cham clan of Nuer shot and killed a member of Chieng Diu of Jamuok clan of Gawar Nuer community in a revenge attack in Bieh village near Nyanepol (Kuacdeng, Ayod, Jonglei).

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 31 May 2026, raiders suspected to be Turkana from Kenya clashed with Toposa pastoralists at a New Site in Natinga (Kapoeta East county, Eastern Equatoria state) during an attempted raid. 3 Turkana were killed and two Toposa were injured. 4 cattle were stolen. Security forces were deployed to the area to contain the insecurity.

Looting: On 31 May 2026, 9 guards of the former governor of Jonglei state looted weapons including artillery, equipment and firearms after breaking into an armory in Bor (Bor South county, Jonglei state). They fired warning shots into the air while fleeing, but there were no casualties. The governor had been released from his position two days before the incident, which caused panic among the residents.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Sudan Tribune; Sudans Post; The City Review (South Sudan); VOA
properties.notes: On 31 May 2026, members of the Ngok Lual Yak Dinka attacked the Shilluk community and targeted them door-to-door in Malakal town in Malakal North (Malakal county, Upper Nile state) in a revenge incident after internally displaced persons from the Shilluk killed a Ngok Lual Yak Dinka driver. Unspecified number of people were beaten and wounded, including senior government officials and police officers, as well as the state police commissioner. The extent of injuries is unknown/not reported. 8-11 people were killed between 30 and 31 May in Malakal, Khor Nyengar and Malakal UNMISS Protection of Civilians site. 4 fatalities coded to Khor Nyengar, 1 to Malakal UNMISS Protection of Civilians site, and 3 unspecified fatalities coded to Malakal. Hundreds of civilians fled their homes and sought refuge on the banks of the Nile. Security forces were deployed to the area to calm the situation. The communities agreed to cease hostilities. Due to insecurity, the main market and shops were closed.

On 31 May 2026, armed assailants suspected of being from the Turkana community from Kenya clashed with Toposa community cattle herders during a cattle raid in Nadapal area of Narus Payam (Kapoeta East, Eastern Equatoria), resulting in 3 fatalities on the Turkana side and 2 injuries on the Toposa side. Additionally, the Turkana raided 1000 cattle from the herders.

On 31 May 2026, unidentified armed assailants (coded as unidentified communal militia) ambushed a passenger vehicle traveling along the Torit-Kapoeta Road in Watit area of Kimotong Payam (Budi, Eastern Equatoria), resulting in injuries to 2 people, including an off-duty NGO personnel. The attackers fled the scene and the vehicle progressed toward Kapoeta Town. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 31 May 2026, a group (described as members of the Ngok section of the Dongjol Dinka community and coded as Dinka ethnic group) threw stones at a government vehicle in Malakal Town, Central Malakal (Malakal, Upper Nile). The vehicle was carrying government officials to attend the funeral of a Shilluk community member who was killed in a revenge attack at the Malakal Protection of Civilians site the day before (coded separately). The incident resulted in injuries to 2 Shilluk members. Security personnel in the area fired warning shots to de-escalate tension.

properties.location: Malakal UNMISS Protection of Civilians site
properties.notes: On 31 May 2026, approximately 300 IDPs protested at the Malakal UNMISS Protection of Civilians site (Malakal, Upper Nile) against a restriction movement, imposed by the UN Mission in South Sudan, from the site. The UN head of mission held a meeting with the community leaders.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Sudan Tribune; Sudans Post; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: Other: On 30 May 2026, the UN Security Council extended the arms embargo mandate, travel bans, and asset freezes on South Sudan for one year (location coded to Juba, Central Equatoria state). The embargo, initially imposed in 2018 (coded separately), required all UN member states to prevent the entry of arms and related equipment, including weapons and ammunition, military vehicles and equipment, paramilitary equipment, and any spare parts, into South Sudan.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Sudan Tribune; Sudans Post; The City Review (South Sudan); VOA
properties.notes: On 30 May 2026, suspected Dungjol clan of the Apadang Dinka, described as assailants, attacked Shilluk at Khor Nyengar in Both payam (location coded to Kodok, Fashoda county, Upper Nile state). This incident led to three days of attacks. At least 8-11 people were killed in three days, including at least 4 people in Fashoda, with conflicting sources describing them as fishermen and/or farmers (likely activities that they do for a living based on the context, but not added). 8-11 people were killed between 30 and 31 May in Malakal, Khor Nyengar and Malakal UNMISS Protection of Civilians site. 4 fatalities coded to Khor Nyengar, 1 to Malakal UNMISS Protection of Civilians site, and 3 unspecified fatalities coded to Malakal. An unspecified number of people were wounded. Hundreds of civilians fled their homes and sought refuge on the banks of the Nile. Security forces were deployed to the area to calm the situation. The communities agreed to cease hostilities on 2 June. Due to insecurity, the main market and shops were closed. At least one source indicated that the Nuer were involved, however, the Nuer community issued a statement clarifying that they were not involved in the violence.

On 30 May 2026, the Luach-Jang Dinka and Akook subsection of the Aliap section of the Rek Dinka pastoralists clashed with the Thiik subsection of the Aliap section of the Rek Dinka and the Kongor section of the Akop section of the Rek Dinka at Manyang/Manyang-Ngok (Tonj South county, Warrap state). At least 8 people were killed, including two Thiik women, a seven-year-old girl, two Akook, and two Kongor. Seven people were wounded. The Luach-Jang initiated the clash targeting the Thiik to avenge the killing of the chief's son on 2 May (coded separately). The Akook got involved after raiding cattle from the Thiik, leading the Kongor to intervene to recover the raided cattle. Several chiefs overseeing the three param areas of Tonj East county were arrested to assist in identifying the perpetrators and forces were deployed to the area to calm the situation.

properties.location: Malakal UNMISS Protection of Civilians site
properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Sudan Tribune; Sudans Post; The City Review (South Sudan); VOA
properties.notes: On 30 May 2026, internally displaced persons from the Shilluk killed a Ngok Lual Yak Dinka driver near the Malakal UNMISS Protection of Civilians site (Malakal county, Upper Nile state). A driver was killed. 8-11 people were killed between 30 and 31 May in Malakal, Khor Nyengar and Malakal UNMISS Protection of Civilians site. 4 fatalities coded to Khor Nyengar, 1 to Malakal UNMISS Protection of Civilians site, and 3 unspecified fatalities coded to Malakal. An unspecified number of people were wounded. Hundreds of civilians fled their homes and sought refuge on the banks of the Nile. Security forces were deployed to the area to calm the situation. The communities agreed to cease hostilities on 2 June. Due to insecurity, the main market and shops were closed. At least one source indicates that the Nuer were involved, however, the Nuer community issued a statement clarifying that they were not involved in the violence.

On 30 May 2026, communities from Malual Cum payam and Ngabagok village (likely Luac-Jang Dinka, based on the county) clashed at an unspecified location in Tonj East county (location coded to Romich in Paliang, Warrap state). 4 people were killed, two from each community.

On 30 May 2026, armed individuals suspected of being members of the Apuk section of the Rek Dinka from Warrap State's Gogrial East County attacked Mabior Abiem village in Marial Bai Payam (Jur River, Western Bahr el Ghazal), where they raided an unspecified number of cows and left 2 people injured. The incident created tension between the 2 groups.

On 30 May 2026, members of the Thiik and Akook sub-sections of the Aliap section and the Kongor sub-section of the Jalwau section, all from the Rek Dinka community, clashed at Midheer cattle camp in Pagor Payam (location coded to Pagor in Tonj East County, Warrap State), resulting in 6 fatalities and 3 injuries. The clash is revenge following a past incident (further information unknown/not reported).

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: Around 29 May 2026 (as reported), attackers suspected of being Toposa killed a 34-year-old person along the Ngauro-Kapoeta Road (location coded to Namorunyang, Longeleya, Kapoeta South county, Eastern Equatoria state). No further information is available.

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan); VOA
properties.notes: On 29 May 2026, individuals suspected to be Logir community members attacked a convoy of SPLM delegates on the Camp 15 - Chukudum road in Ngarera, Lohibor boma (location coded to Chukudum in Komiri, Budi county, Eastern Equatoria state). 2 people were killed, including a female SPLM delegation member and a driver, while a young girl sustained injuries. A three-month-old child went missing but was later found alive. The victims were part of the thousands of SPLM supporters from the eight counties of South Sudan's Eastern Equatoria State who had traveled to Juba for a regional endorsement event. An unspecified number of people managed to escape unharmed, and an unspecified number of people remain missing.

properties.source: Risk and Strategic Management, Corporation; Sudans Post
properties.notes: On 29 May 2026, pastoralists from two separate cattle camps clashed (both are likely Agar Dinka, based on the location) at the Lual-adol Cattle Camp in Amongpiny Payam (location coded to Amongpiny in Rumbek Centre County, Lakes State) during a traditional ceremony. 2 men were beaten to death and 3 sustained gunshot wounds, including a girl who was mistakenly shot. The clash stemmed from an accidental discharge of a firearm, where one girl accidentally shot another in the neck. Mistakenly believing the victim had died, relatives of the injured girl retaliated against the other group. Law enforcement arrested the initial shooter.

On 28 May 2026, for the second day, communities from the Vevino and Yod areas in Gumuruk payam (likely Murle, based on the locations) clashed at an unspecified location in Gumurk (Pibor county, Jonglei state) over land disputes. At least 8 people were killed, including seven Yod members and seven others were injured. Fatalities split over the two days (27 and 28 May) and coded as 4.

On 28 May 2026, pastoralists from the Apuk section of the Rek Dinka, described as Titbai, raided 30 cows at Kolol in Marial Bai (Jur River county, Western Bahr el Ghazal state). The military and police pursued the group and a clash ensued. 10 cows were recovered. A soldier involved in the raid was also arrested during the confrontation. Casualties unknown.

Looting: On 28 May 2026, SSPDF troops harassed and looted civilians' items during a disarmament exercise in Source Yubu Payam (location coded to Source Yubo/Yubu in Tambura County, Western Equatoria State). The disarmament exercise was meant to curtail ethnic violence in the area.

On 28 May 2026, unidentified armed individuals (coded as unidentified communal militia) shot and killed a local and raided 51 of his cattle in Padoc village of Akop Payam (Tonj North, Warrap). The deceased is likely a member of the Akop section of the Rek Dinka who reside in the area.

Other: On 27 May 2026, the President of South Sudan issued a decree in Juba (Juba county, Central Equatoria), leading to a reshuffle of officials in Upper Nile state. The changes included the dismissal and appointment of the Minister of Peace Building, Minister of Youth and Sports, Minister of Information and Communication, Minister of Agriculture, Environment and Forestry, Minister of Labour, Public Service and Human Resource Development, the Deputy Chairperson of the Conflict Resolution and Reconciliation Commission, and the Chairperson of the Human Rights Commission. Five county commissioners were also dismissed and replaced: the Fashoda County Commissioner, Renk County Commissioner, Melut County Commissioner, Akoka County Commissioner, and Baliet County Commissioner. The reshuffle further resulted in the removal of several figures in the state parliament, including the Speaker of the Upper Nile State Parliament, with three state MPs having their appointments revoked. The reasons for these changes are yet to be disclosed.

On 27 May 2026, for two days, communities from the Vevino and Yod areas in Gumuruk payam (likely Murle, based on the locations) clashed at an unspecified location in Gumurk (Pibor county, Jonglei state) over land disputes. At least 8 people were killed, including seven Yod members and seven others were injured. Fatalities split over the two days (27 and 28 May) and coded as 4.

On 27 May 2026, youth suspected to be Murle community members raided an unspecified number of cattle in Meer village of Nyandit Payam (location coded to Burmath in Akobo County, Jonglei State). The cattle keepers (likely from the Lou Nuer community who live in the area) pursued the attackers and recovered all the stolen animals. There were no casualties.

On 27 May 2026, an SSPDF soldier sexually assaulted a female Dinka community member in Hai Malakia East residential area in Nimule Town of Nimule Payam (Magwi, Eastern Equatoria). Police later arrested the suspect. The victim was hospitalized.

On 27 May 2026, unidentified armed assailants (coded as unidentified communal militia) shot at 2 vehicles carrying school children from Kapoeta Town to Narus along the Kapoeta-Narus Road in Kakuti area of Katordori Payam (Kapoeta East, Eastern Equatoria). The drivers drove through the ambush and the bullets damaged the vehicle, there were no casualties. Police later responded to the incident after the assailants had fled. Motivation unknown/not reported.

Property destruction: On 26 May 2026, armed members of the Apuk section of the Rek Dinka, described as Titbai, set fire to five thatch houses in Wun Ngot in Marial Bai (Jur River county, Western Bahr el Ghazal state).

On 26 May 2026, unidentified armed assailants (coded as unidentified communal militia) attacked 3 teenagers traveling from Lafon/Lopa to Juba along the Mogiri-Lafon/Lopa Road in Gamichi area of Mangalla South Payam (Juba, Central Equatoria). 2 of the victims were injured and 1 was missing. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 25 May 2026, pastoralists from the Apuk section of the Rek Dinka, described as Titbai, raided 16 cows and 30 goats, and abducted a young girl, in Akuem Agook areas in Marial Bai (Jur River county, Western Bahr el Ghazal state). Police and military units pursued the group (no interaction reported) and recovered some cows. No details on the whereabouts of the girl.

On 25 May 2026, armed assailants suspected to be Murle community members attacked a group of civilians traveling on a tricycle along the Juba-Bor Road in Nyabor village of Mangalla South Payam (location coded to Mogiri in Juba County, Central Equatoria State), killing 1 and injuring 3 others. Following the incident, SSPDF troops were deployed to the area. Motivation unknown/not reported.

Looting: On 25 May 2026, suspected Toposa community members raided 47 cattle when they ambushed a group of Jie cattle traders from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area who were traveling with their cattle from Jebel Boma to Kapoeta, in Morupus village of Karukomuge Payam (location coded to Karukomuge in Kapoeta North County, Eastern Equatoria State).

Looting: On 25 May 2026, unidentified armed assailants (coded as unidentified communal militia) ambushed a commercial truck transporting goods from Juba to Wau along the Rumbek-Cueibet Road between Cum-nyiel and Panthilik villages of Abiriu Payam (location coded to Panthilik in Cueibet County, Lakes State). The assailants looted 3 bags of clothes and cash amounting to 740,000 SSP from the occupants.

On 23 May 2026, armed Dinka youth from Lakes State's Yirol East County (likely from the Ciec clan based on location) exchanged gunfire with Nyong Nuer community members in Parun village of Pachaar Payam (Panyijiar, Unity), resulting in the death of 1 Dinka and the injury of a Nyong Nuer member. The former attempted a cattle raid in the area, leading to the clash.

On 23 May 2026, armed youth suspected to be Toposa/Taposa community members from Eastern Equatoria State's Kapoeta South County killed 2 Kachipo community members; a child, and a female, in Mewun village of Boma Payam (Pibor, Jonglei). Motivation unknown/not reported.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Risk and Strategic Management, Corporation; Sudans Post
properties.notes: On 23 May 2026, unspecified armed youth (coded as unidentified communal militia) ambushed a convoy of six trucks of a mobile service engineering company along the Pibor-Gumuruk Road in Manyloden village of Gumuruk Payam (Pibor, Jonglei). One security personnel (an SSPDF soldier) escorting the convoy was killed. The drivers and construction engineers were physically assaulted but no injuries were incurred. An unspecified number of telecommunication equipment were looted.

On 22 May 2026, following directives from the Inspector General, national security service police arrested and detained over 100 young men in Aweil Town (Aweil West county, Northern Bahr el Ghazal state) for wearing clothing and hairstyles deemed inappropriate by the authorities. The detainees were punched, but it is unknown whether there were any injuries from the punches.

On 22 May 2026, suspected ex-Seleka militia from the Central African Republic clashed with SPLM-In Opposition/SPLA-IO members along the CAR-South Sudan border in Source Yubu/Yubo Payam (location coded to Source Yubo in Tambura County, Western Equatoria State), resulting in the displacement of an unspecified number of civilians to Ezo and parts of Source Yubu/Yubo. Motivation unknown/not reported. The SSPDF stated that the ex-Seleka militia and the SPLA-IO were the groups involved denying that the clash was between the military's Division 6 troops and Azande Anikpibe youth militia based in Bambuti of CAR. Casualties unknown.

On 22 May 2026, an SSPDF soldier shot a civilian from the local community (likely a member of the Rek Dinka community based on location) in Marial-Lou Payam (location coded to Marial-Lou in Tonj North County, Warrap State), injuring him. Motivation unknown/not reported. The suspect was later arrested in Tonj East County.

On 21 May 2026, a landmine planted by an unidentified group exploded near a military base in Warguet (Aweil East county, Northern Bahr el Ghazal state). A 40-year-old SSPDF soldier (likely off duty based on his activities at the time) was killed while clearing farmland.

properties.location: UN House/UN Protection of Civilians Site
properties.notes: On 21 May 2026, members of the Leek Nuer and Dok Nuer communities armed with bladed weapons clashed at the IDP Camp 3, UN House/UN Protection of Civilians Site in Rejaf Payam (Juba, Central Equatoria), resulting in 2 fatalities. The clash was caused by social disputes and is linked to similar incidents on 19 and 20 May 2026 (coded separately). Police were deployed to calm the situation.

On 21 May 2026, unidentified assailants (coded as unidentified armed group) shot at a commercial truck, transporting goods from Juba to Wau, at Roor-Chol Akol in Malou-Pec Payam (location coded to Malou-Pec in Cueibet County, Lakes State). The driver who is a foreign national, was injured. Nothing was stolen and the motivation is unknown/not reported.

Looting: On 20 May 2026, raiders, suspected to be armed youths from the Jalwau section of the Rek Dinka in Tonj county, Warrap State, raided at least 342 including 280 cattle plus 62 calves from cattle keepers (likely GoK Dinka, who are predominantly based in the county) from two locations, Apirhnom and Wong-Kuot in Cueibet county (location coded to Abiriu, Lakes state).

On 20 May 2026, suspected NAS militants abducted 26 male members of the Kakwa and Pojulu communities in Jonsuk/Jansuk zone of Yei Town Payam (Yei, Central Equatoria). An unspecified number of abductees escaped and SSPDF (military) pursued the abductors to rescue the rest of the victims. The attackers targeted strong young men, ex-military and ex-NAS members, and searched house to house.

On 20 May 2026, members of the Cie Majok and Cie Tut sections of the Lou Nuer community clashed near Akobo in Bilkey Payam (Akobo, Jonglei), resulting in 1 fatality. Following the incident, relatives of the deceased pursued the offenders toward the Meer area. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 20 May 2026, armed assailants suspected to be Nyong Nuer community members from Unity State's Panyijiar County clashed with members of the Aliab subsection of the Rup/Ruop section of the Agar Dinka during a cattle raid in Amongpiny Payam (location coded to Amongpiny, Rumbek Centre, Lakes). The incident resulted in 3 fatalities, 2 from the Aliab subsection and 1 from the Nuer. 3 other people were injured and the Nuer raided an unspecified number of cattle.

On 20 May 2026, joint security forces (coded as military and police) clashed with armed members of the Pakam section of the Agar Dinka community in Apet village of Mayom Payam (Rumbek Centre, Lakes), resulting in 4 fatalities, all on the Dinka side. The clash erupted after the civilians refused to be disarmed.

properties.location: UN House/UN Protection of Civilians Site
properties.notes: On 19 May 2026, for the second day, clashes erupted between internally displaced persons (IDPs) from the Leek Nuer and Dok Nuer communities, both originating from Unity state, at the UN House/UN Protection of Civilians Site in Rejaf (Juba county, Central Equatoria state). The violence was triggered by a dispute involving a pregnant girl. The clashes resulted in the deaths of at least six individuals, with several others injured. Some of the injured received medical attention at a hospital. 6 fatalities were split across two days (18 - 19 May) and coded as 3 for this event.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 19 May 2026, the South Sudan People's Defence Force (SSPDF) from Division 7 Brigade 2, who were conducting a foot patrol, clashed with a suspected group of National Salvation Front members along Kimoru Bridge Magwi county (location coded to Owiny Kibul in Pajok, Eastern Equatoria state), as the NAS tried to cross from Iwire to Owiny. The clash resulted in the death of at least four individuals, comprising one SSPDF member and three NAS members. Subsequently, government forces were deployed to manage the situation.

properties.source: Sudans Post; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 19 May 2026, suspected youth from Rumbek North county (likely Pakam section of the Agar Dinka, who predominantly reside there) attacked a military base in Malek (Rumbek Centre county, Lakes state). 3 people, including one security personnel, lost their lives, and two individuals sustained injuries. Additionally, 50 heads of cattle belonging to the Luanch Jang Community were seized from the base, the cattle were in the custody of the state government and were in the process of returning the cattle to their rightful.

On 19 May 2026, suspected NAS militants abducted 22 Kakwa community members, including 2 females, 6 males, and 12 male youths, in Lujulo/Lujulu Payam (location coded to Lujulu, Morobo, Central Equatoria). 2 of the abductees escaped. Additionally, SSPDF (military) responded and pursued the abductors (further information unknown/not reported).
