On 19 May 2026, suspected PFM members shot at a passenger vehicle at an unspecified location along the Magwi-Torit Road in Magwi Payam (location coded to Magwi in Magwi County, Eastern Equatoria). There were no casualties as the driver drove through the ambush and arrived in Torit safely.

On 19 May 2026, armed members of the Ajeik and Tiek subsections of the Rup/Ruop section of the Agar Dinka clashed at the swamp lands in Toch area of Malek Payam (location coded to Malek in Rumbek Centre County, Lakes State). There were no casualties. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 19 May 2026, for the second day, armed individuals from the Ajeik and Tiek subsections of the Rup/Ruop section of the Agar Dinka clashed in Mamer Tiit village of Matangai Payam (Rumbek Centre, Lakes). There were no casualties. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 19 May 2026, armed individuals from the Gak subsection of the Pakam section of the Agar Dinka clashed with members of an unspecified subsection of the Pakam section of the Agar Dinka in Maper Payam (location coded to Maper, Rumbek North, Lakes), resulting in the injury of a Gak local leader. The Gak members were attempting to recover their cattle raided in a previous incident (further details unknown/not reported). SSPDF troops in the area, reinforced by troops from Rumbek Town, repelled the attackers.

properties.location: UN House/UN Protection of Civilians Site
properties.notes: On 18 May 2026, for the first day, clashes erupted between internally displaced persons (IDPs) from the Leek Nuer and Dok Nuer communities, both originating from Unity state, at the UN House/UN Protection of Civilians Site in Rejaf (Juba county, Central Equatoria state). The violence was triggered by a dispute involving a pregnant girl. The clashes resulted in the deaths of at least six individuals, with several others injured. Some of the injured received medical attention at a hospital. 6 fatalities were split across two days (18 - 19 May) and coded as 3 for this event.

On 18 May 2026, suspected Turkana community members from Kenya attacked a Toposa community cattle camp in Narus Payam (location coded to Narus, Kapoeta East, Eastern Equatoria). There were no casualties. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 18 May 2026, armed individuals from the Ajeik and Tiek subsections of the Rup/Ruop section of the Agar Dinka clashed at the swamp lands in Toch area of Malek Payam (location coded to Malek in Rumbek Centre County, Lakes State), resulting in the death of 1 Tiek member. Motivation unknown/not reported. The fighting continued on 19 May 2026 (coded separately).

On 17 May 2026, military personnel tortured to death a detainee in a military garrison in Ezo (Western Equatoria state). The victim was accused of shooting a Lieutenant Sergeant and killing his daughter on 19 April.

Other: On 17 May 2026, the President of South Sudan issued a decree in Juba (Juba county, Central Equatoria), resulting in a reshuffle of officials in Warrap State. The changes included the dismissal and appointment of a state advisor on peace and security, the ministers of Parliamentary and Legal Affairs, Youth Culture and Sports, Trade and Industry, Roads and Bridges, and General Education. Additionally, the Deputy Chairperson of the Anti-Corruption Commission, the Chairperson of the Relief and Rehabilitation Commission, and a member of the Relief and Rehabilitation Commission were replaced. Two county commissioners, the commissioners of Gogrial East and Tonj North counties, as well as the Governor of Unity state and chief of Ruweng Administrative Area, were also dismissed and replaced.

Looting: On 17 May 2026, heavily armed assailants believed to originate from Akobo town (likely of the Lou Nuer ethnicity, considering the county) raided the belongings of the Anyuak community in Alali, Alali payam (Akobo county, Jonglei state). Before the incidents, members of the Anyuak community were advised to relocate from the headquarters of Alali Payam to neighboring villages.

On 17 May 2026, the Government of Sudan and the Sudan People's Liberation Movement-North (SPLM-N) reached an agreement in Juba (Juba county, Central Equatoria state). The agreement aims to facilitate the delivery of humanitarian aid to war-affected areas in Sudan.

On 16 May 2026, raiders from the Pakam section of the Agar Dinka and Nuer from Panyijiar county initiated an assault, leading to a confrontation with Luach Jang cattle herders at three cattle camps in Angui/Angohek in Wunlit (Tonj East county, Warrap state). Conflicting reports stated the total number of fatalities ranged from 5 to 9, including five Luach Jang and four Pakam Agar, with 13 others injured, including 10 from the Luach Jang community. Fatalities coded as 5.

Looting: On 16 May 2026, suspected Turkana community members from Kenya raided 300 goats from Toposa community members near the airstrip in Natinga Payam (location coded to New Site in Kapoeta East County, Eastern Equatoria State).

On 16 May 2026, youth from the Murle community ambushed at least 30 Lou Nuer youth resulting in a clash in Bell area of Dengjok Payam (location coded to Dengjok, Akobo, Jonglei). 1 person was injured during the incident and the attackers were repelled. The Lou Nuer youth were on their way to reinforce their counterparts returning from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area after clashing with Murle youth in Yakkuach Boma (coded separately).

On 16 May 2026, Luach-Jang Dinka community members from Warrap State's Tonj East County attacked members of the Gak subsection of the Pakam section of the Agar Dinka in the vicinity of Majieth cattle camp in Aloor Payam, near Aloor (Rumbek North, Lakes), resulting in 11 fatalities and 10 injuries. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 16 May 2026, unidentified assailants (coded as unidentified communal militia) shot at a group of fish traders from the Nuer community from Fangak County, operating between Pakang and Kaldak areas, in Pakang Payam (location coded to Pakang, Panyikang, Upper Nile). The victims escaped by swimming across the river. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 16 May 2026, armed youth from the Chiemanbathni section clashed with their counterparts from the Chierom section (both likely to be under the Nuer community based on location) in Doma Payam (location coded to Doma, Ulang, Upper Nile), resulting in 3 injuries. 1 of the injured individuals later succumbed to the injuries. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 16 May 2026, youth from the Kuich and Kerchoat sections (likely to be from the Nuer community who reside in the area) clashed in Yomding Payam (location coded to Yomding, Ulang, Upper Nile), resulting in 2 injuries, both succumbing to injuries on 17 May 2026. Motivation unknown/not reported.

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; Risk and Strategic Management, Corporation; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 16 May 2026, armed youth suspected of being from the Murle community clashed with Lou Nuer cattle keepers during an attempted raid at a cattle camp in Yakkuach Boma, Chuil (Nyirol county, Jonglei state). The clash resulted in the deaths of two individuals, including the executive chief of Yakkuach, and left two youths wounded. After the raid, local youth regrouped to recover the cattle and repelled the raiders, killing five. All the raided cattle were recovered. This incident is viewed as a violation of the commitment to peaceful coexistence between the Greater Pibor and Jonglei states. Fatalities coded as 7.

Change to armed group: On 15 May 2026, SPLM-IO Kitgwang leader and operations commander declared his defection to the Patriots Resistance Movement (PRM) in Juba (Central Equatoria), citing a lack of vision and commitment to peace principles within the group.

On 15 May 2026, raiders suspected of being Nuer youths from Mayom county and described as associates of spiritual leader Gai Machiek (coded as SSPM/A) killed 2 Twic Dinka men during a cattle raid in Ajakkuac payam (location coded to Ajakuac in Twic county, Warrap state). No further information available.

On 15 May 2026, Shilluk youths from the Lul area clashed with Dinka youths in the Akoka area at Akoka (Baliet county, Upper Nile state) to avenge incidents that happened around 8 May in Pathow/Pathau and Padit areas (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

Around 15 May 2026 (month of), armed Cie Majok section of the Lou Nuer killed a member of the Cie Tut section of the Lou Nuer at an unspecified location in Akobo (location coded to Akobo in Bilkey, Akobo County, Jonglei State). No further information available.

On 15 May 2026, assailants suspected to be from the Greater Pibor Administrative area (coded as Murle), attacked and killed at least four individuals (a family) at Tiergol village (location coded Akobo, Bilkey area, Akobo county, Jonglei state). They abducted five children, comprising two girls aged 10-11 years old and three boys aged 2 years old.

Looting: On 15 May 2026, armed youth from the Lou Nuer community looted 7 cartons, 7 plastic chairs, and 6 sitting mats from a hall in Nyium Feeding Center before vandalizing farmlands and removing food items from granaries in Likuangole/Lekuangole Payam (location coded to Likuangole, Pibor, Jonglei). Victims of the looting are likely members of the Murle community who reside in the area.

On 15 May 2026, armed individuals suspected to be from the Thony, Muok, and Jalwau sections of the Rek Dinka in collaboration with others from the Akook subsection of the Aliap section of the Rek Dinka from Warrap State's Tonj South County attacked Barjerk cattle camp in Citcok Payam, near Citcok (Cueibet, Lakes), where they injured 3 cattle keepers and raided 10 cattle. Victims are likely from the Gok Dinka community who reside in the area.

On 14 May 2026, youth from the Dinka community clashed with youth from the Shilluk community in Akoka Payam (location coded to Akoka, Baliet, Upper Nile), over a disputed piece of land and the income generated from taxing the Arab Falata herders. There were no casualties.

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; Sudans Post; The City Review (South Sudan); VOA
properties.notes: On 13 May 2026, a group of heavily armed suspected Murle youths from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area attacked the Burmath cattle camp in Nyandit payam (Akobo County, Jonglei State) and were pursued by local youths (likely Lou Nuer, who are based in the place where the incident happens). Between 5 and 11 people were killed, and 5 to 12 people were wounded. One child and an unspecified number of women were abducted. This incident occurred despite an agreement signed on 7 April between the Murle and Lou Nuer communities to foster peaceful coexistence (coded separately).

On 13 May 2026, SPLM IO attacked and wounded a boat driver of an international nongovernmental organization along the Tonga-Atar corridor (location coded to Atar in Canal/Pigi county, Jonglei state). The reason is unknown/not reported. No further information is available.

On 13 May 2026, for the second day, a group of 40 to 50 heavily armed youth from the Nyabor/Pading area held a demonstration by firing gunshots into the air and overtaking the airstrip in Lankien, Thol (Nyirol county, Jonglei state) against the return of the county commissioner from Juba. They accused the commissioner of inadequate leadership, harassment of critics, and physical assault of a 24-year-old male. Authorities responded by apprehending four politicians and elders, alleging their involvement in mobilizing local youth.

Around 13 May 2026 (as reported), thousands of members of the Catholic Church marched from the Tambura County headquarters to the UNMISS Camp in Tambura (Western Equatoria), protesting the abduction of a Catholic priest and his Boda Boda taxi driver on 27 April (coded separately) and called on the abductors to release them.

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 12 May 2026, youths from Hiyala and Haforiere payams (likely Lotuko who are based in these payams) clashed in the bush in Hiyala payam (Torit county, Eastern Equatoria state). The incident, described as accidental, occurred when hunters mistook the youths grazing their cattle for criminals and opened fire, prompting an exchange of gunfire. An 18-year-old man was killed, and two suspects are in police custody.

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 12 May 2026, raiders from the Kenyan Turkana community and Toposa pastoralists clashed in Nadapal near the Kenya border in Narus (Kapoeta East county, Eastern Equatoria state) after the Turkana raided about 15,000 heads of cattle from the community. The conflict resulted in the deaths of at least two Turkana individuals and injuries to two Toposa individuals, who received medical treatment. The looted cattle were recovered.

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: Looting: On 12 May 2026, raiders from the Kenyan Turkana community seized about 15,000 heads of cattle belonging to the Toposa from two separate kraals, including one at New Site in Natinga (Kapoeta East county, Eastern Equatoria state) and Nadapal (coded separately)..

On 12 May 2026, heavily armed suspected Lou Nuer from Uror county attacked Likuangole Payam, targeting several bomas, they were resisted by the youngest Murle age set, the Kurenen (Pibor county, Jonglei state). An unspecified number of people were killed and fatalities were coded as 3. Nine Murle individuals, including eight children and a pregnant woman, were abducted. Additionally, 300 cows were raided from 70 houses in Jwom village, causing residents to flee the area.

On 12 May 2026, a group of 40 to 50 heavily armed youth from the Nyabor/Pading area held a demonstration by firing gunshots into the air in Lankien, Thol (Nyirol county, Jonglei state) against the return of the county commissioner from Juba. They accused the commissioner of inadequate leadership, harassment of critics, and physical assault of a 24-year-old male. Authorities responded by apprehending four politicians and elders, alleging their involvement in mobilizing local youth.

On 12 May 2026, unidentified individuals (coded as unidentified armed group) hit and injured an INGO aid worker along the Dar es Salam road in Juba (Juba, Central Equatoria). The incident is linked to revenge.

On 9 May 2026, armed assailants from the Murle community ambushed a commercial vehicle transporting passengers and medicines along an undisclosed route between Padiet payam and Uror county (location coded to Duk Padiet in Duk county, Jonglei state). Three people were killed, while three children, an elderly man, and a soldier (likely off-duty as he was traveling with civilians and his duty status was not reported) sustained injuries. The wounded were treated at a hospital. A different source stated two children were among the people killed.

On 9 May 2026, armed assailants from the Murle community attacked cattle keepers who were tending to their herds at a grazing site in Padiet payam (location coded to Duk Padiet, Duk county, Jonglei state). One individual was killed, and another was wounded. The cattle keepers are likely Dinka Bor, based on the location where the incident happened.

On 9 May 2026, armed attackers from the Murle community clashed with soldiers after ambushing a group of cattle traders traveling from Ayod county to Padiet payam at Paloi (location coded to Duk Padiet in Duk county, Jonglei state). One soldier was killed, and another was wounded (soldiers were likely scorting the traders).

On 9 May 2026, a group of armed youth from Panyijiar county (likely Nyuong Nuer, based on the county) attacked Mathiang village inhabited by the Ciec Dinka, in Pagarau (Yirol East county, Lakes state). Two elderly men were killed (beheaded) and four children who were abducted were released unharmed afterward. An unspecified number of cattle were raided.

On 9 May 2026, an armed man (coded as an unidentified armed group) exchanged gunfire and killed a Brigadier from the Sudan People's Liberation Army in Opposition (SPLA-IO) at Roc Roc Dong (Jur River county, Western Bahr el Ghazal state). The incident was over land disputes and the installation of a signpost for Goro Village Boma. Two suspects have been arrested.
On 9 May 2026, unidentified gunmen (coded as an unidentified armed group) ambushed a truck carrying food supplies from Ayod to Duk Padiet and killed two people at Ayod (Jonglei state).

On 9 May 2026, armed assailants suspected to be from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle) ambushed a car carrying passengers and goods traveling from Bor to Ayod at the Rubuar Forest in Ayod county (location coded to Ayod, Jonglei state). At least two passengers were killed and three people were wounded. The wounded were taken to the hospital.

Looting: On 9 May 2026, armed raiders from the Murle community raided 12 head of cattle at Poktap in Payuel (Duk county, Jonglei state). The victims of the raid were likely Dinka Bor, based on the location where the incident happened.

On 9 May 2026, cattle raiders suspected of coming from Unity State's Mayom County (likely from the Bul Nuer community based on location) clashed with cattle owners at Mayom Kou cattle camp in Alabek Payam, near Alabek (Tonj North, Warrap), as the former attempted a cattle raid in the area. The incident resulted in 11 fatalities and 3 injuries.

On 9 May 2026, armed youth suspected of being Murle community members from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area attacked cattle traders along the Ayod-Duk Road in Duk Padiet village of Padiet Payam (Duk, Jonglei), resulting in 2 fatalities and 1 injury. The Murle youth also stole an unspecified number of cattle from the traders. Local youth unsuccessfully pursued the attackers.

On 9 May 2026, armed youth suspected of coming from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (likely from the Murle community who live in the area) ambushed an NGO vehicle, traveling from Pajut to Duk Padiet, in Panyang village of Panyang Payam (Duk, Jonglei), leaving 1 person dead and 3 others injured.

Around 8 May 2026 (week of), an unidentified armed group abducted six individuals from two locations, including Pathow/Pathau (location coded to Pathau in Dethok payam, Fashoda county, Upper Nile state) and Padit areas (coded separately). No further information is available.

Around 8 May 2026 (week of), an unidentified armed group abducted six individuals from two locations, including the Padit (location coded to Padit in Ogot payam, Malakal county, Upper Nile state) and Pathow/Pathau areas (coded separately). No further information is available.

On 7 May 2026, armed attackers suspected of being from Panyijar county in Unity state (likely Nyuong Nuer, based on the county) abducted two women and two girls (likely Ciec Dinka based on the location where the incident happened) who were collecting grass from the forest at Adior (Yirol East county, Lakes state). The abductees were later released unharmed.

On 7 May 2026, unidentified armed assailants suspected of being Nyong/Nyuong Nuer community members from Unity State's Panyijiar County ambushed a joint government security patrol (coded as military) at Wunchiir cattle camp in Adior Payam, near Adior (Yirol East, Lakes), wounding a wildlife officer. The attackers then escaped toward Panyijiar County.

On 7 May 2026, an armed individual suspected of being a member of the Apuk section of the Rek Dinka community killed an individual (described as being a member of the Marialbai Dinka and coded as Dinka ethnic group) at his residence in War Ayat area of Nyinayok Boma, Marial Bai Payam (Jur River, Western Bahr el Ghazal). The incident is linked to existing inter-communal conflict between the 2 communities.

properties.source: Radio Miraya; Radio Tamazuj; Sudans Post; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 6 May 2026, thousands of students from Western Bahr el Ghazal took to the streets around the university campus in Wau North (Wau county, Western Bahr el Ghazal state), demanding that the government fulfill its obligation to a contracted food supplier for the institution. The protesters threatened to access food by entering the main markets of the town if their demand was not met. As a result, three markets were temporarily shut down due to safety concerns, prompting the deployment of police forces near the university campus to ensure security. There was no interaction.

On 6 May 2026, seven prisoners died of suffocation after being arrested a day earlier by the military in Kuajok, Kuac North (Gogrial West County, Warrap State). The soldiers had confined them in a container, which led to their deaths. Following this incident, several SSPDF personnel were taken into custody.

On 6 May 2026, armed attackers suspected of being from Panyijar county in Unity State (described as armed criminals and likely Nyuong Nuer, based on the county) abducted a couple (a man and a woman) and 4 women at Alel in Tinagau (Yirol East county, Lakes state). The man was released later. The abductees are likely Ciec Dinka based on the location where the incident happened.

On 6 May 2026, armed raiders suspected of being from Panyijar county in Unity State (described as armed criminals likely Nyuong Nuer, based on the county) shot and wounded a cattle keeper (likely Ciec Dinka based on the location where the incident happened) and looted 17 head of cattle at Alel in Tinagau (Yirol East county, Lakes state).

On 6 May 2026, security forces (coded as police) pursued armed raiders suspected of being from Panyijar county in Unity State (described as armed criminals and likely Nyuong Nuer, based on the county) at Alel in Tinagau (Yirol East county, Lakes state). During the operation, 5 cattle were recovered. Casualties unknown.

On 6 May 2026, youth from the Lou Nuer community from Akobo County exchanged small arms fire with fishermen from the Murle community along the Akobo River bordering Pibor County, near Mer-yak Village in Nyandit Payam (location coded to Burmath in Akobo County, Jonglei State). 3 Murle members were killed while 1 Lou Nuer was injured. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 6 May 2026, individuals suspected of being from the Nuer community from Unity State's Panyijiar County (likely from the Nyong section based on location of origin) abducted 5 Ciec Dinka females in Manhany area of Nyang Boma, Lekakedu Payam (Yirol East, Lakes). The assailants also stole 19 cattle from the area. However, the abductees were released 2 days later.

On 6 May 2026, armed youth suspected of being Bul Nuer community members from Unity State's Mayom County clashed with locals (likely members of the Ruweng Dinka community who live area) in Barel Arabs River area of Manjoga Payam (location coded to Abiemnhom in Abiemnhom County, Unity State), with the attackers raiding about 230 cattle. 1 of the attackers was killed while the rest escaped toward the border between Warrap and Unity States.

On 6 May 2026, around 30 armed youth from the Dinka community attacked Shilluk areas in Padiet and Pathow on the Eastern Bank of the Nile River after a tax collection dispute with Falata nomads in the vicinity of Akoka town of Akoka Payam (Baliet, Upper Nile). There were no casualties.

On 6 May 2026, an armed youth suspected of being from the Luach-Jang/Luanyjang Dinka community killed 2 members of the Akook/Akok sub-section of the Aliap section of the Rek Dinka community in Makuac Payam (location coded to Makwoich in Tonj East County, Warrap State), during a cattle dispute between the 2 communities.

Looting: On 6 May 2026, unidentified armed assailants suspected of coming from Unity State's Panyijiar County (likely from the Nyong Nuer community who live in the area) raided 18 cows from members of the Ciec Dinka community in Machar-Achiek village of Adior Payam, near Adior (Yirol East, Lakes). The cattle owners unsuccessfully pursued the raiders.

On 5 May 2026, assailants suspected of being from the Thuyic section of the Agar Dinka from Maleng-agok payam (described as armed criminals) killed two people who are from the Gony sub-section of the Athoi section of the Agar Dinka and Dhiei sub-section of the Aliamtoc section of the Agar Dinka at Alelcok in Aduel (Rumbek East county, Lakes state) in a suspected revenge attack. Further information on the incident that prompted the attack is unknown/not reported. 41 relatives of the assailants were apprehended.

On 5 May 2026, an armed assailant (coded as unidentified armed group) shot at the Deputy Governor of Lakes State in an attempted assassination during a community meeting in Cueibet Town, Ngap Payam, near Mayenthon (Cueibet, Lakes). However, the Deputy Governor's bodyguards (likely military) shot at the assailant, killing him.

On 5 May 2026, an armed individual (coded as unidentified clan militia) shot and killed an individual from the same clan in Pagor Payam (Tonj East, Warrap), as revenge over a past incident. Further information unknown/not reported.

Around 4 May 2026 (between 4 May - 5 May), cattle keepers and raiders (likely Haak Nuer, based on the county where the event occurred) clashed in Mirnyal (Bor, Mayendit county, Unity state). The clash ensued when the raiders declined to return the 20 cattle they had stolen (no further information on the raid). At least 2 people were killed, and 4 others were injured.

On 4 May 2026, unidentified armed assailants (coded as unidentified communal militia) shot and killed 2 local farmers working on their farm in Alel area, (Mathiang-Kok), of Pacong Payam, near Mathiang (Rumbek East, Lakes). Victims are likely members of the Agar Dinka community who live in the area. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 4 May 2026, armed assailants (described as Dinka Pakic youths and coded as Dinka ethnic militia) attacked members of the Paabai section of the Luach-Jang/Luanyjang Dinka community in Paweng Payam (Tonj East, Warrap), resulting in 1 fatality. The incident is linked to revenge (further information unknown/not reported).

On 3 May 2026, Misseriya men backed by Abyei youth (likely Ngok Dinka, residents of Abyei) attacked Twic Dinka youth who were fishing along the river at Marol Ayuong village in Twic county (location coded to Turalei, Warrap state). Nine individuals were killed, and eight people were wounded. Fishing nets were burnt, and dried fish were seized.

Other: On 3 May 2026, the President of South Sudan declared the establishment of a Peace and Reconciliation Committee comprising nine members in Juba (Central Equatoria state). This committee was tasked with addressing the rising communal violence in the Greater Bahr el Ghazal region.

On 3 May 2026, 2 groups (described as Chieng Kuok and Chiengmannyadien communities and coded as unidentified communal militia) clashed in Nasir Payam (location coded to Nasir in Luakpiny/Nasir County in Upper Nile State), resulting in 1 fatality and 5 injuries. The incident was related to revenge (further details unknown/not reported).

On 2 May 2026, SPLM-IO and SSPDF clashed at the SPLA-IO's Mirnyal military barracks in Bor (Mayendit county, Unity state). The clash stemmed from an allegation that SPLM-IO had conducted a raid in Leer. SPLM-IO commander denied SPLM-IO's involvement but claimed they had seized cattle from different raiders. At least two soldiers were killed and two officers were wounded during the clash.

On 2 May 2026, members of the Thiik subsection of the Aliap section of the Rek Dinka killed a man described as the son of the Luach-Jang Dinka chief in the Sweampy area of Tonj South county (location coded to Manyang-Ngok, Warrap state) to avenge a killing that occurred 5-6 years ago. The victim was searching for lost cattle.

properties.source: Aid Worker Security Database; Risk and Strategic Management, Corporation
properties.notes: On 2 May 2026, the Kurenen and Lango age-sets of the Murle in Pibor town (Pibor county, Jonglei state) engaged in an armed clash that was intercommunal. 3 people including a staff member of an international nongovernmental organization were killed and humanitarian programs were suspended. The incident is suspected to be politically motivated and no further information is available.

On 2 May 2026, armed youth (likely from the Haak Nuer community based on the location they came from) suspected to be supported by police left Rubkuay and attacked Kaot and Buot villages in Rubkuay Payam (location coded to Rubkuay in Mayendit County, Unity State), an area controlled by the opposition, SPLM/A-IO. The incident resulted in 1 fatality and 3 injuries and followed an attack on 1 May 2026 in Rubkuay Payam, where police officers guarding cattle in their custody were targeted (coded separately).

On 1 May 2026, bandits suspected from Tonj South county in Warrap state (likely Rek Dinka based on the county) attacked and killed an individual described as a hunter at Abiriu (Cueibet county, Lakes state). The motive behind the attack was unknown/unreported.

On 1 May 2026, armed individuals from Unity State's Panyijiar County (likely Nyong Nuer based on location) conducted a cattle raid at a grazing area in Macuru cattle camp, Malek Payam, near Malek (Rumbek Centre, Lakes). The cattle owners (likely from the Agar Dinka community based on location) recovered all the stolen animals and then pursued the attackers toward the Unity State border. One person was injured, further information is unknown/not reported.

Looting: On 1 May 2026, unidentified armed individuals suspected of coming from Unity State's Panyijiar County (likely from the Nyong Nuer community based on location) raided 80 goats belonging to members of the Ciec Dinka community in Bunangui area of Lekakedu Payam (Yirol East, Lakes). The owners unsuccessfully pursued the raiders toward Panyijiar County.

On 1 May 2026, youth from the Haak Nuer community engaged a police officer (SSNPS) in an exchange of fire in Rubkuay Payam (Mayendit, Unity). At the moment of the incident, the police had custody of the cattle as investigations into a legal matter were ongoing. The incident led to high tension between the police and armed youth after one Haak Nuer member was injured during the exchange of fire.

Looting: On 1 May 2026, unidentified armed individuals (described as coming from Upper Nile and Unity states and coded as unidentified communal militia) raided 1600 cattle from members of the Panaru section of the Ruweng Dinka in Lake No area of Biu Payam (Pariang, Unity).

On 1 May 2026, armed individuals (described as being from the Marialbai community and coded as unidentified communal militia) killed 2 military (SSPDF) officers, both from the Apuk community from Warrap State, deployed in Manyang village of Marialbai Payam, near Marial Bai (Jur River, Western Bahr el Ghazal). The incident is connected to inter-communal disputes between the Apuk and Marialbai communities.

On 30 April 2026, gunmen suspected of coming from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle), opened fire on travelers in Tel/Tel-Bielli (Nyirol county, Jonglei state). One person was killed, while another sustained an injury. 5-6 children, including 4-5 girls, were abducted. These victims were part of a group traveling from Chuil Payam to Lankien.

On 30 April 2026, unidentified armed assailants (described as suspected to be members of the Waat section of the Rek Dinka and coded as Rek Dinka clan militia) attacked members of the Panyar subsection of the Macar section of the Gok Dinka community in Tiap Tiap village of Citcok Payam (Cueibet, Lakes), injuring 4 civilians and raiding 60 cattle.

On 30 April 2026, armed individuals suspected of being Rek Dinka community members from Tonj South County in Warrap State engaged in an armed clash with local cattle keepers (likely members of the Gok Dinka community who live in the area) during an attempted cattle raid in Tiap Tiap, Citcok Payam (Cueibet, Lakes). No animals were stolen and there were no casualties.

On 30 April 2026, unknown armed assailants (coded as unidentified armed group) attacked a residence in Mabia, Ezo Payam, near Ezo (Ezo, Western Equatoria), leaving 3 people dead and 2 others injured. The wounded individuals were transported to the UNMISS Temporary Protection Base clinic for medical care. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 29 April 2026, Toposa cattle keepers and Lopit communities, predominantly composed of youths, signed a peace agreement in Lohutok payam (Torit county, Eastern Equatoria state). This agreement aimed to cease hostilities, including violent clashes and raids, and foster a coexistence between the two communities.

Other: On 29 April 2026, the UN Security Council extended the mandate of the United Nations Mission in South Sudan (UNMISS) for one year (location coded to Juba, Central Equatoria), aiming to prevent a resurgence of civil war and the escalation of violence in South Sudan. The mission's mandate maintained its current force levels, with a troop ceiling of 17,000 personnel and a police ceiling of 2,101 personnel, which includes 88 justice and corrections advisors.

Around 29 April 2026 (as reported), armed pastoralists from the Panyar and Waat subsections of the Macar section of the Gok Dinka community clashed in Cueibet, Malou Pec (Cueibet county, Lakes state). The dispute stemmed from cattle-related issues. Eight individuals were killed in the clash, including five members from the Waat section and three from the Panyar section, and thirteen people sustained injuries.

On 29 April 2026, Guzule age-set members of the Murle clashed with Kurenen age-set members of the Murle in Kong Kong village of Likuangole Payam, near Likuangole (Pibor, Jonglei), 5 Kurenen members were killed, while 2 Guzule members were injured. Motivation unknown/not reported.

Looting: On 29 April 2026, armed youth suspected of coming from Cueibet County in Lakes State (likely from the Gok Dinka community who live in the area) raided an unspecified number of cattle in Ayom Village of Manyang-ngok Payam, near Manyang-Ngok (Tonj South, Warrap). Following the incident, local youth (likely from the Thony section of the Rek Dinka based on location) pursued the raiders and recovered 12 of the stolen animals (no clashes reported). There were no casualties.

On 28 April 2026, suspected armed youths from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (described as criminals, coded as Murle) attacked Kuergany cattle camp situated in Panyang payam (Duk county, Jonglei state). One raider was killed and a cattle keeper (likely Dinka Bor community, prevalent in the county) sustained injury. The raiders managed to steal over 200 heads of cattle, but later, all 200 cattle were recovered. There is no further information.

On 28 April 2026, unidentified assailants (coded as an unidentified armed group) abducted seven individuals, aged between 27 and 40 years old, at Source Yube/Source Yubo in Source Yubu (Tambura county, Western Equatoria state). A former SPLA-IO Sector commandant of Western Equatoria has denied any involvement in the alleged incidents.

properties.source: Sudans Post; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 28 April 2026, armed youths suspected of coming from Panyijiar county in southern Unity state (likely Nyuong Nuer, residing in the county), attacked Pakou/Pakujiak near Adior payam in Yirol East county (Lakes state). At least two individuals (likely Ciec Dinka community, given the location of the incident) were killed, while another sustained injury.

On 28 April 2026, armed youth suspected of being Murle community members abducted 2 children from the Lou Nuer community at a water collection point in Padoi village of Diror Payam (Akobo, Jonglei). Local youth pursued the kidnappers but further information is unknown/not reported.

On 28 April 2026, armed individuals suspected of being Murle community members attacked Lou Nuer community members in Thol Payam (Nyirol, Jonglei), killing 1 person and abducting 6 children. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 28 April 2026, SPLM-In Opposition/SPLA-IO soldiers clashed with Arab-Falata cattle herders from Sudan in Tonga Payam (Panyikang, Upper Nile), resulting in 2 fatalities and 2 injuries. Additionally, SPLA-IO personnel confiscated an unspecified number of cattle belonging to the cattle herders. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 28 April 2026, unidentified armed assailants (coded as unidentified armed group) shot at a police (SSNPS) officer (assumed off duty) in Ezo Town, Ezo Centre Payam (Ezo, Western Equatoria), killing his daughter and injuring him. Motivation unknown/not reported.

properties.source: Sudans Post; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: Change to armed group: On 27 April 2026, between 156 - 200 members of the SPLM-IO defected to the SPLM party in Bentiu (Rubkona county, Unity state). Their decision to defect was due to allegations of mistreatment and restrictions on freedom of speech within the SPLM-IO. The SPLM-IO Chairperson of the Information and Communication Committee in Unity state denied the defection.

On 27 April 2026, an armed youth suspected of being a Murle community member shot and killed 2 individuals traveling on a motorcycle in Cuei Nyok area, Makol Cuei Boma of Baidit Payam, near Makol Cuei (Bor South, Jonglei). Motivation unknown/not reported. Victims are likely members of the Athoc section of the Bor Dinka who reside in the area.

On 27 April 2026, 2 unidentified armed individuals (coded as unidentified armed group) shot and killed a civilian while in a garden in Odikolong village of Torit Payam, near Torit (Torit, Eastern Equatoria). Motivation unknown/not reported.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Sudans Post; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 27 April 2026, unidentified attackers (coded as unidentified armed groups), abducted four individuals along the Nagero- Tambura road (Western Equatoria state). Among the victims was a catholic priest who served as a member of the Tambura peace committee and his boda-boda driver. The insecurity in Tambura has led to the displacement of more than 41,000 people. UN peacekeepers and the SSPDF were deployed. A conflicting source mentions that the bodies of the Catholic priest and his driver were found dead, whereas another source indicates there is no precise information regarding their whereabouts. The number of fatalities is coded as 0.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 26 April 2026, armed Murle ambushed a convoy of five commercial vehicles at Kaikuiny (Akobo county, Jonglei state). At least four individuals, including three Sudanese nationals described as drivers and a trader, were killed. Some commodities were stolen.

On 26 April 2026, youth from the Greater Pibor area (coded as Murle), attacked and injured two individuals in the Dangjuoth area (location coded to Dangjop within Barmach, Akobo county, Jonglei state). The Information Minister of the Greater Pibor Administrative Area denied any involvement of the area's youth in the attack.

On 26 April 2026, armed Gok Dinka youth from Lakes State attacked 3 members of the Jalwau section of the Rek Dinka community who were fishing near the shared border in Wunlit Payam (Tonj East, Warrap), killing them. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 26 April 2026, armed Nuer individuals from Unity State attempted a cattle raid in Alabek Payam (Tonj North, Warrap), resulting in an armed clash with local armed Dinka youth (likely from the Rek section who live in the area) that left 4 of the attackers dead.

Property destruction:On 26 April 2026, armed youth suspected of being members of the Apuk-Giir section of the Rek Dinka community burnt one house when they attacked Warayat and Nyinakok bomas of Marial Bai Payam (location coded to Marial Bai in Jur River County, Western Bahr el Ghazal State). Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 26 April 2026, unidentified armed assailants (coded as unidentified armed group) shot at a local NGO truck, that was transporting sand to a UNMISS QUIPs Project Site, in Ngolimbo area of Besselia Payam (location coded to Ngoribo A in Wau County, Western Bahr el Ghazal State). The driver of the truck was injured. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 26 April 2026, suspected Murle from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area attacked Toposa community members in Kauto Payam (Kapoeta East, Eastern Equatoria). The attackers targeted several cattle Kraals in the Payam between 23 and 26 April 2026 (coded separately), resulting in 30 fatalities and 24 injuries while approximately 16,000 cattle and 6,800 goats were raided. 30 fatalities split across 4 events and coded as 9 for this event. The attackers abducted an unspecified number of women and children.

On 26 April 2026, 4 unidentified armed assailants suspected of being Balanda community members shot and killed 4 Zande/Azande community members at their residences in Source Yubu Payam (location coded to Source Yubo in Tambura County, Western Equatoria State). Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 26 April 2026, a group, described as armed bandits, shot and injured a civilian and set ablaze seven houses in Tambura town (Western Equatoria state) in a revenge incident. This incident prompted fear among the community, resulting to many seeking refuge at UN protection sites and churches. Security forces have since been dispatched to the area, and a nighttime curfew has been enforced.

On 25 April 2026, suspected armed youth from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle), clashed with local youths from the area (likely Lou Nuer, given the location of the incident), at Wickol/Wei-kol (Uror county, Jonglei state). The clash resulted in the deaths of at least three individuals, with two others sustaining injuries. The raiders seized 600 heads of cattle. The Information Minister of the Greater Pibor Administrative Area denied the involvement of Murle youth in the incident.

On 25 April 2026, suspected Murle from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area attacked Toposa community members in Kauto Payam (Kapoeta East, Eastern Equatoria). The attackers targeted several cattle Kraals in the Payam between 23 and 26 April 2026 (coded separately), resulting in 30 fatalities and 24 injuries while approximately 16,000 cattle and 6,800 goats were raided. 30 fatalities split across 4 events and coded as 7 for this event. The attackers abducted an unspecified number of women and children.

On 25 April 2026, unidentified armed assailants on motorcycles (members of the PFM later claimed responsibility) shot at a police station near the Nimule Checkpoint in Nimule Town, Nimule Payam (Magwi, Eastern Equatoria), causing police officers to shoot back thus repelling the attackers. There were no casualties. Motivation unknown/not reported.

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; Risk and Strategic Management, Corporation; VOA
properties.notes: On 25 April 2026, armed individuals suspected to be from the Balanda community attacked Dingimo village (Tambura, Western Equatoria), setting several houses on fire, including the residence of the Paramount Chief of the Azande, in a revenge attack. The attackers also attempted to abduct the chief but were unsuccessful. This incident prompted fear among the community, resulting in many seeking refuge at UN protection sites and churches. Security forces have since been dispatched to the area, and a nighttime curfew has been enforced.

On 24 April 2026, armed youth, suspected to be from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (GPAA) (coded as Murle) killed at least three individuals from the Lou Nuer community and stole 650 head of cattle during an attack on a cattle camp in Pamai (Uror county, Jonglei state). The GPAA Information Minister refuted allegations of involvement of Murle youth.

Around 24 April 2026 (week of), Toposa cattle keepers and Lopit militia clashed at an unspecified location within Lohutok payam (Torit county, Eastern Equatoria state). Nine people were killed and one individual sustained an injury.

On 24 April 2026, suspected NAS militants shot and killed an SSPDF (military) soldier at an unspecified location 3 miles away from Yei Town along the Yei-Maridi Road in Lasu Payam (Yei, Central Equatoria). The militants also carted away the victim's AK47 rifle.

On 24 April 2026, armed individuals suspected of being members of the Toposa community from Kapoeta South County attacked Kimotong Payam (Budi, Eastern Equatoria), where they killed a member of the Buya/Boya community and raided an unspecified number of cattle. Armed Buya/Boya youths pursued the attackers but further information is unknown/not reported.

On 24 April 2026, armed Murle youth from Maruwa, Gumuruk, and Pibor attacked a grazing area in the vicinity of Mewun village of Boma Payam (Pibor, Jonglei), leaving 1 person injured. The victim is also likely a Murle community member who live in the area. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 24 April 2026, armed Dinka youth (likely from the Gok Dinka based on the incident location) exchanged small arms fire due to a cattle-related dispute in Citcok Payam (Cueibet, Lakes), resulting in 8 fatalities and 15 injuries. Following the incident, SSPDF (military) and other government forces were deployed to restore normalcy in the area.

On 24 April 2026, unidentified armed assailants (coded as unidentified communal militia) attempted a cattle raid on members of the local community (likely the Leek Nuer who live in the area) in Tor village of Budang Payam (Rubkona, Unity), resulting in the injury of 1 person.

On 24 April 2026, armed cattle keepers (coded as unidentified communal militia) attacked Beselia Payam (Wau, Western Bahr el Ghazal), killing 1 person (likely a Luo community member based on the location). Additional information suggests that there were earlier violent confrontations between cattle herders and residents, during which 6 individuals were killed but further information is unknown/not reported. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 24 April 2026, 2 youth groups (described as the Waat and Panyar sections of the Lou Nuer community and coded as Lou Nuer) clashed in Waat Payam (Nyirol, Jonglei). Casualties unknown. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 24 April 2026, members of the Pari community from Lohutok Payam of Lopa County attacked Toposa community members in Riwoto village of Lomeyen Payam (location coded to Lomeyen in Kapoeta North County, Eastern Equatoria State), killing 4 people and injuring another. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 24 April 2026, suspected Murle from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area attacked Toposa community members in Kauto Payam (Kapoeta East, Eastern Equatoria). The attackers targeted several cattle Kraals in the Payam between 23 and 26 April 2026 (coded separately), resulting in 30 fatalities and 24 injuries while approximately 16,000 cattle and 6,800 goats were raided. 30 fatalities split across 4 events and coded as 7 for this event. The attackers abducted an unspecified number of women and children.

On 23 April 2026, youth from the Didinga community in Ngauro, Budi county, raided three kraals belonging to the Toposa community, prompting a clash at Namorunyang in Longeleya (Kapoeta South county, Eastern Equatoria state). One person was shot and killed, and another sustained injuries.

On 23 April 2026, during a police operation to recover sheep raided in January (coded separately), armed youths (from Mayom county and coded as Bul Nuer) exchanged gunfire with police forces near Mayom (Kuerbuone, Unity state). One police officer was killed, while another sustained injury and was subsequently treated at a hospital. 40 heads of sheep were recovered.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 23 April 2026, thousands of armed Murle youths from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle) attacked 3-8 cattle camps belonging to the Toposa community in Kauto payam (location coded to Kuron, Kapoeta East county, Eastern Equatoria state). The attackers targeted 213 kraals and 34 stockades. 90 women and children were abducted, while 32 people were killed, and 22 others were injured. An unspecified number of homes were burned. 16,000 head of cattle, along with over 6,000 goats and sheep were raided. Around 17,000 people were displaced. UNMISS was sent to the Tambura temporary base to protect the displaced. 14 of the abducted children returned home.

On 23 April 2026, unidentified armed assailants (coded as unidentified communal militia) attacked Wichbuol village of Pajiek Payam, near Pajiek (Ayod, Jonglei), where they injured 2 civilians and abducted 2 children belonging to the victims. Local Gawaar Nuer youth unsuccesfully attempted to rescue the abductees.

On 23 April 2026, unidentified armed individuals (coded as unidentified communal militia) shot and killed a local civilian who was collecting firewood in Ngolimbo village of Bagari Payam (Wau, Western Bahr el Ghazal). The victim is likely a Luo community member who resides in the area. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 23 April 2026, Murle community members from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area attacked Toposa community members in Kauto Payam (Kapoeta East, Eastern Equatoria). The attackers targeted several cattle Kraals in the Payam between 23 and 26 April 2026 (coded separately), resulting in 30 fatalities and 24 injuries while approximately 16,000 cattle and 6,800 goats were raided. 30 fatalities split across 4 events and coded as 9 for this event. The attackers abducted an unspecified number of women and children.

On 22 April 2026, suspected armed group from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle) attacked and killed a cattlekeeper (likely from the Lou Nuer community, based on the location of the incident) in a forest area in Akobo (Bilkey, Jonglei state). More 356 heads of cattle were stolen.

On 22 April 2026, unidentified armed assailants (suspected of being cattle raiders from Unity State and coded as Nuer ethnic militia based on the location they came from) shot and killed a local fisherman (likely a member of the Rek Dinka community who live in the area) at Baw-nhom fishing camp in Alabek Payam, near Alabek (Tonj North, Warrap). The attackers also carted away an AK-47 rifle belonging to the victim. Motivation unknown/not reported.

Looting: On 21 April 2026, youth from Oruhol village conducted a cattle raid, seizing an unspecified number of cattle from Ofong in Himodonge payam (location coded to Imodongi, Torit county, Eastern Equatoria state). Two raiders were apprehended, and 30 stolen cattle were retrieved. The raiders and the victims of the raid are likely to be Lotuko, as they are primarily based in Himodonge payam.

Looting: On 21 April 2026, a group of armed raiders, suspected to be from the Murle community, raided 43 goats in Kolnyang (Bor county, Jonglei state). The victims of this raid are likely to be the Bor Dinka, based on the county where the incident took place.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 21 April 2026, youth from the Pakam section of the Agar Dinka, from Rumbek North, attacked and raided Wur Liet in Wunlit (Tonj East county, Warrap state). During the raid, 3 people from Luach Jang Dinka community were killed and 6 others were injured. Over 900 head of cattle were raided.

On 21 April 2026, at night, suspected armed youth from Luacjang Dinka, from Tonj East county in Warrap state, in retaliatory attacks, killed at least two people and injured two police officers at an unspecified location in Rumbek North (location coded to Maper, Maper Town, Lakes state). No further information.

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 21 April 2026, Luach Jang Dinka cattle keepers from Warrap State's Tonj East County clashed with SSPDF officers at a military station in Maper (Rumbek North County, Lakes State) in an attempt to acquire arms and ammunition from the security forces. 2 SSPDF officers were killed and 2 others injured. The attackers also set fire to an unspecified number of houses in Makuac, Muor-leng and Kabek villages of Maper Payam (coded separately).

On 21 April 2026, armed Toposa youth were repelled by Didinga community members whom they attempted an attack on in Lauru/Nauro Payam (Budi, Eastern Equatoria). Motivation unknown/not reported. Casualties unknown.

On 21 April 2026, a clash ensued between 3 local armed youth (likely from the Agar Dinka community based on location) and SSPDF (military) soldiers in Malek Payam (Rumbek Centre, Lakes), resulting in the killing of 1 of the youths while the other 2 were arrested. The incident began when the armed youth refused to comply with the SSPDF's order to surrender their weapons.

Property destruction: On 21 April 2026, members of the Luach-Jang Dinka community set fire to an unspecified number of houses in Makuac, Muor-leng, and Kabek villages of Maper Payam (location coded to Maper in Rumbek North County, Lakes State). Victims of the destruction are likely members of the Agar Dinka community who live in the area. The attackers also clashed with SSPDF in Maper Town on the same day (coded separately).

On 21 April 2026, armed members of the Anikpigbe criminal gang associated with the Azande/Zande community abducted a police officer (assumed off duty) from the Balanda community as he was traveling from Source Yubu to Tambura Town, in Ngboko Boma of Source Yubu Payam (location coded to Source Yubo in Tambura County, Western Bahr el Ghazal State). SSPDF troops were deployed to search for the abductee but further information is unknown/not reported.
On 20 April 2026, Didinga cattle keepers from Ngauro payam shot and wounded two Toposa boys and killed between 10 to 30 cattle at a grazing area in Nauro/Lauru (Budi county, Eastern Equatoria state).

On 20 April 2026, NAS militants attacked SSPDF (military) soldiers in Yimbe village of Yei Town Payam, near Yei (Yei, Central Equatoria), resulting in 2 injuries on the SSPDF side. The SSPDF soldiers had been deployed to Yimbe to remove Fulani herders (alias Ambororo/Mbororo) from the area.

On 20 April 2026, armed Turkana youth from Kenya shot and killed a Toposa community member and raided an unspecified number of cattle in Nachipo Boma of Narus Payam (Kapoeta East, Eastern Equatoria). Following the incident, armed Toposa youth pursued the assailants, shot and killed one of them, and then recovered 300 of the stolen animals.

On 20 April 2026, armed youth suspected of being Toposa community members shot and killed 2 SSNPS (police) officers on duty in Machi village of Machi One Payam, near Loming (Kapoeta South, Eastern Equatoria). Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 19 April 2026, for the second day, Bunno and Nyangiya generations of the Toposa clashed at Kochokio Kraal (location coded to Narus, Kapoeta East county, Eastern Equatoria state). During the clash, three individuals sustained gunshot wounds and received medical treatment at a hospital. One person succumbed to their injuries (fatality coded for 18 April). Three children went missing, their whereabouts are unknown.

On 19 April 2026, Didinga youth from Ngauro payam raided cattle belonging to the Toposa community at a grazing site in Nauro/Lauru (Budi county, Eastern Equatoria state), resulting in gunfire exchange. There were no fatalities. The raided cattle were recovered.

On 19 April 2026, SSPDF members, during a goat recovery operation, encountered armed raiders suspected to be from Mayom county (coded as Bul Nuer) at Bombel in Ajakkuac (Twic county, Warrap state). Two raiders were killed by the SSPDF who recovered 40 heads of goats. Two youths were apprehended during the operation.

On 19 April 2026, 2 unspecified sub-clans of the Lou Nuer community clashed at the Nyanuai cattle camp in Pathai Payam, near Pathai (Uror, Jonglei), due to conflicts over a communal watering spot for animals. The incident resulted in 2 fatalities and 1 injury. Following this, security forces were deployed to restore calm in the area.

On 19 April 2026, armed youth suspected of being Murle community members were repelled by Lou Nuer community members in Pulbuoka area of Uror Payam, near Panyok (Uror, Jonglei) when they attempted to raid cattle from the community. There were no casualties.

On 19 April 2026, 2 armed individuals from Unity State (likely from the Nuer community based on the location) were shot and killed while another was injured in an armed clash with locals (coded as Tonj North communal militia) when they attempted to raid cattle in Lou-Ariik-Mawien area of Alabek Payam, near Alabek (Tonj North, Warrap).

On 18 April 2026, for two days, Bunno and Nyangiya of the Toposa clashed in Kochokio Kraal (location coded to Narus, Kapoeta East county, Eastern Equatoria state). During the clash, three individuals sustained gunshot wounds and received medical treatment at a hospital. One person succumbed to their injuries. Three children went missing, their whereabouts are unknown.

Looting: On 18 April 2026, individuals suspected of being Bor Dinka community members raided 52 cattle from members of the Kuku community in Liwolo Payam, near Livolo (Kajo Keji, Central Equatoria). Following the incident, government security forces forced chiefs to identify the perpetrators and they managed to arrest them. Additionally, 51 of the stolen animals were recovered but 1 had already been slaughtered by the attackers.

On 18 April 2026, 4 unidentified armed individuals shot at 2 Agar Dinka community members on a motorbike (coded as Taxi Drivers) in the vicinity of Ameth cattle camp in Paloch/Paloc Payam, near Paloc (Rumbek East, Lakes). Following the incident, local Agar Dinka youth pursued the attackers and killed 1 of them while the 3 others escaped towards Unity State's Panyijiar County. Motivation unknown/not reported. Attackers are likely Nyong Nuer community members based on the location they escaped towards.

On 18 April 2026, armed youth suspected of being Gok Dinka community members attacked Thou-Chok cattle camp in Tonj Payam, near Tonj (Tonj South, Warrap), resulting in 4 fatalities and 3 injuries (likely members of the Muok section of the Rek Dinka who live in the area). The attackers also raided 300 cows.

Looting: Around 17 April 2026 (week of), unidentified raiders (coded as unidentified clan militia) carried out raids in five villages including Ariath village (Aweil North county, Northern Bahr el Ghazal state), Malek village, Gok Machar, Jag/Jagai villa and Mayar village (coded separately). A total of 180 livestock were taken; some were later recovered and returned to their owners. Authorities arrested five individuals in connection with the raids. The victims are likely to be primarily from the Malual Dinka community, who predominantly reside in Northern Bahr el Ghazal state.

Looting: Around 17 April 2026 (week of), unidentified raiders, (coded as unidentified clan militia) carried out raids in five villages including in Gok Machar village in Malual Centre (Aweil North county, Northern Bahr el Ghazal state), Ariath village, Malek village, Jag/Jagai villa and Mayar village (coded separately). A total of 180 livestock were taken; some were later recovered and returned to their owners. Authorities arrested five individuals in connection with the raids. The victims are likely to be primarily from the Malual Dinka community, who predominantly reside in Northern Bahr el Ghazal state.

Looting: Around 17 April 2026 (week of), unidentified raiders, (coded as unidentified clan militia) carried out raids in five villages including in Jag/Jagai village in Mangargier (Aweil South county, Northern Bahr el Ghazal state), Ariath village, Malek village, Gok Machar, and Mayar village (coded separately). A total of 180 livestock were taken; some were later recovered and returned to their owners. Authorities arrested five individuals in connection with the raids. The victims are likely to be primarily from the Malual Dinka community, who predominantly reside in Northern Bahr el Ghazal state.

Looting: Around 17 April 2026 (week of), unidentified raiders, (coded as unidentified clan militia) carried out raids in five villages including in Mayar village (location coded to Aweil in Aweil Town, Aweil West, Northern Bahr el Ghazal state), Ariath village, Malek village, Gok Machar, and Jag/Jagai villa (coded separately). A total of 180 livestock were taken; some were later recovered and returned to their owners. Authorities arrested five individuals in connection with the raids. The victims are likely to be primarily from the Malual Dinka community, who predominantly reside in Northern Bahr el Ghazal state.

Looting: Around 17 April 2026 (week of), unidentified raiders (coded as unidentified clan militia) carried out raids in five villages including in Malek village in Gomjuer West (Aweil West county, Northern Bahr el Ghazal state), Ariath village, Gok Machar, Jag/Jagai villa and Mayar village (coded separately). A total of 180 livestock were taken; some were later recovered and returned to their owners. Authorities arrested five individuals in connection with the raids. The victims are likely to be primarily from the Malual Dinka community, who predominantly reside in Northern Bahr el Ghazal state.

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 17 April 2026, a 15-year-old attacker from the Puol section of the Lou Nuer from Thol payam killed the chief of Dendor village from the Tiang section of the Lou Nuer, who hails from Tut payam in Dendor, on the outskirts of Lankien in Thol (Nyirol county, Jonglei state). The motive behind the attack was revenge as the assailant sought retribution for his father's killing in 2004, allegedly carried out by a relative of the chief.

properties.location: UN House/UN Protection of Civilians Site
properties.notes: On 17 April 2026, an unidentified armed individual (coded as unidentified armed group) shot at a group of IDPs who were watching football at the community centre inside the IDP Camp 3/UN House/UN Protection of Civilians Site in Rejaf Payam (Juba, Central Equatoria), leaving 11 people injured. The next day, SSNPS (police) arrested 1 person in connection to the incident. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 17 April 2026, unidentified armed individuals (coded as unidentified armed group) attacked private contractors of a UN agency, who were working on a road construction project for the Kolmerek Canal, at an unspecified location along the Bor-Ayod Road in Baidit Payam, near Baidit (Bor South, Jonglei). The attackers shot and injured 1 of the contractors. Motivation unknown/not reported.

Property destruction: On 17 April 2026, armed youth suspected of being Murle community members attacked Makol Cuei village in Baidit Payam (Bor South, Jonglei), where they set fire to an unspecified number of houses before fleeing the area. Local sources blamed the incident on the ongoing intercommunal violence in Jonglei State. Victims of the attack are likely Bor Dinka community members who live in the area.

On 17 April 2026, unidentified armed individuals (coded as unidentified communal militia) attacked 3 members of the Jikany Nuer community in Pandanyang area of Nasir Payam (Luakpiny/Nasir, Upper Nile), killing 1 and injuring another. The incident is suspected to be retaliation following a past event when a relative of the attackers was killed (further details unknown/not reported).

On 17 April 2026, a group of returnees, who were on the list for a delayed cash distribution, protested by gathering stones and threatening to harm a group of UN agency staff members who were supposed to carry out the postponed cash distribution in Eastern Malakal Payam (location coded to Hai Sah in Malakal County, Upper Nile State). The returnees blocked (means unspecified) the entrance to the site, preventing the staff members from leaving. UN security personnel intervened (means unspecified) and the staff members were able to leave the site safely.

On 16 April 2026, cattle raiders, suspected to be from Panyijar county in Unity state (likely of Nyuong Nuer, based on the county), attacked and killed a cattle keeper and wounded eight individuals, one of whom is critically injured, at Aliet cattle camp in Mayen (Rumbek North county, Lakes state). An unspecified number of cattle were raided.

On 16 April 2026, armed youth cattle keepers from Rumbek North, Rumbek Centre, and Yirol East counties (likely Agar Dinka, Ciec Dinka, and Atout respectively, based on the counties), pursued cattle raiders suspected to be from Panyijar county in Unity state (likely of Nyuong Nuer, based on the county) at an unspecified location in Rumbek North county (location coded to Aliet in Mayen, Lakes state). This pursuit occurred subsequent to a cattle raid. Casualties unknown.

On 16 April 2026, suspected NAS militants dressed in civilian clothes and armed with AK-47 rifles ambushed a commercial vehicle carrying approximately 10 civilians in Mitika Boma of Lasu Payam (Yei, Central Equatoria). The attackers stopped the car and robbed the occupants of their personal belongings before they were engaged in an armed confrontation with SSPDF (military) soldiers from Abegi Barracks who were on patrol in the area. There were no casualties but 2 civilians were missing after they hid in nearby bushes during the armed engagement.

On 16 April 2026, armed youth suspected of being from the Bul Nuer community from Unity State's Mayom County attacked Ciec Dinka community members in Liet cattle camp in Yali Payam (Yirol East, Lakes), where they also raided an unspecified number of cattle. The incident resulted in 1 fatality and 5 injuries. Ciec Dinka youth pursued the attackers and recovered all the stolen animals.

On 16 April 2026, armed youth from the Nyong/Nyuong Nuer community from Unity State's Panyijiar County attacked Wunliet cattle camp of the Ciec Dinka community in Pagarau Payam, near Pagarau (Yirol East, Lakes), resulting in 1 fatality while 2 other individuals sustained gunshot injuries. The attackers also raided an unspecified number of cows. The incident also resulted in an armed engagement between the 2 groups.

On 16 April 2026, armed members of the Apuk section of the Rek Dinka community attacked a civilian at his residence in Nyin Akok Boma of Wau Bai Payam (Jur River, Western Bahr el Ghazal), killing him. The incident is suspected to be a revenge attack following a past incident (further details unknown/not reported).

On 16 April 2026, an armed individual (described as being from the Marial-Bai Dinka community and coded as Dinka ethnic militia) shot at members of the Apuk section of the Rek Dinka community at a restaurant in Tharkueng village of Kuac South Payam (location coded to Awanyen in Gogrial West County, Warrap State), killing 1 and injuring 3 others. Police officers shot back at the attacker, injuring him. The attacker was arrested, however, he was illegally freed by Western Bahr El Ghazal forces in collaboration with armed youth.

On 15 April 2026, more than 10 people, including parents and relatives of an 11-year-old student (girl), from the Toposa community confronted teachers at St. Bakhita Girl's School in Narus (Kapoeta East county, Eastern Equatoria state). The rioters hurled stones and wielded sticks in their efforts to forcibly remove the girl from the school premises to be married. They were unsuccessful in taking the girl. Police were deployed to restore calm (no interaction reported). Extent of injuries not reported/unknown.

On 15 April 2026, members of the Manuer sub-section of the Pakam section of the Agar Dinka clashed with members of the Gak sub-section of the Pakam section of the Agar Dinka in Mabor-Ngop area of Jiir Payam (Rumbek Centre, Lakes), leaving 8 people injured. Local police also arrested 14 people in connection to the incident. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 15 April 2026, armed assailants suspected of being members of the Gak sub-section of the Pakam section of the Agar Dinka shot and killed a male member of the Manuer sub-section of the Pakam section of the Agar Dinka from Rumbek North County at Pathian cattle camp in Malek Payam, near Malek (Rumbek Centre, Lakes). Motivation unknown/not reported but the incident is linked to recent conflict between the 2 sub-sections.

On 15 April 2026, armed individuals from the Rek Dinka community from Warrap State's Tonj North County clashed with armed youth from Unity State (likely members of the Nuer community who live in the area) at Monylat swampy area in Akop Payam, near Akop (Tonj North, Warrap). The incident occurred when the Rek Dinka youth were patrolling the area and encountered the youth from Unity State who were on a mission to raid cows in Tonj North County. There were no casualties.

On 14 April 2026, 2 sub-groups of the Kurenen age-set of the Murle from Tangajon village clashed in Hai Matar area of Pibor Payam (Pibor, Jonglei). Following the incident, the Pibor Town Mayor requested SSPDF's (military) support to disperse the groups but further details are unknown/not reported. There were no casualties.

Looting: On 14 April 2026, unidentified assailants (coded as unidentified communal militia) raided 6 cows from locals (likely members of the Pakam section of the Agar Dinka who live in the area) in Rumkoor village of Aloor Payam, near Aloor (Rumbek North, Lakes). The cattle owners recovered 2 of the stolen animals through unspecified means.

On 13 April 2026, a Guzule age set member of the Murle clashed with their counterpart from the Kurenen age set of the Murle in Pibor Town of Pibor Payam (Pibor, Jonglei), after the Guzule shot and injured a Kurenen member. Following the incident, Kurenen members pursued the attacker and shot and killed him. Local authorities intervened and began mediation between the 2 age set groups. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 12 April 2026, for the third day, youths from the Waai and Hol clans of the Dinka clashed, using sticks, at Konbek in Makuach payam (Bor South county, Jonglei state) over a dispute between two young individuals, which escalated into a clash. 40 people were injured. 5 people were arrested.

properties.source: Risk and Strategic Management, Corporation; Sudans Post
properties.notes: Around 12 April 2026 (as reported), an armed individual from the Agar Dinka community shot and killed a member of a peace delegation from Panyijiar County in the vicinity of Amongpiny market in Amongpiny Payam (Rumbek Centre County, Lakes State) in a suspected revenge attack. A 12-year-old was also killed in the crossfire but the attacker was targeting Nyuong Nuer government officials. Following the incident, SSPDF officers escorted other officials, part of the delegation, toward the border.

On 12 April 2026, armed youth from the Didinga community from Eastern Equatoria State's Budi County attacked Toposa community members in Pwata Payam (Budi, Eastern Equatoria), leaving 1 person with gunshot wounds. The incident is a retaliation following a 4 February 2026 incident (coded separately) when Toposa youth killed 2 female Didinga members and injured another.

On 12 April 2026, armed assailants suspected of being Murle community members from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area raided an unknown number of cattle in Panyagor area of Kongor Payam (Twic East, Jonglei). Local youth (likely members of the Kongor section of the Twic East Dinka who live in the area) pursued the attackers and recovered all the stolen animals. There were no casualties.

properties.location: Malakal UNMISS Protection of Civilians site
properties.notes: On 12 April 2026, a group of returnees from Sudan held a peaceful protest at the entrance to the Malakal UNMISS Protection of Civilians site in Eastern Malakal Payam (Malakal, Upper Nile), requesting the Camp Coordinator to allocate land for their settlement and provide food. The protest was called off after the Camp Coordinator intervened.

On 12 April 2026, patrol police assaulted a clinical officer while on duty at Torit State Hospital in Torit (Eastern Equatoria state) after the officer did not attend to a patient brought in by the police. Extent of injuries unknown/not reported.

On 11 April 2026, armed youths from Amongpiny (likely of Agar Dinka, based on the location) attacked 10 unarmed bodyguards (who handed in their weapons at a military barracks) of the Panyijiar County commissioner while they were shopping at a market in Amongpiny (Rumbek Centre county, Lakes state). The motive behind the attack remains unknown. One bodyguard and a bystander were killed. Before the attack, the bodyguards escorted a UNICEF vehicle from Panyijiar County to Amongpiny.

On 11 April 2026, for the second day, youths from the Waai and Hol clans of the Dinka clashed, using sticks, at Konbek in Makuach payam (Bor South county, Jonglei state) over a dispute between two young individuals, which escalated into a clash. 40 people were injured. 5 people were arrested.

On 11 April 2026, armed youth suspected of being Bul Nuer community members from Unity State's Mayom County raided an unspecified number of cows from members of the Twic Dinka community in Ajakkuac Payam (Twic, Warrap). A clash ensued as the latter attempted to recover the stolen animals resulting in 1 fatality on the attacker's side.

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; Risk and Strategic Management, Corporation
properties.notes: On 11 April 2026, clashes erupted between SPLM-IO and cattle keepers (coded as unidentified communal militia) in Bagari Payam (location is coded to Bagari in Wau County, Western Bahr el Ghazal State) during an attempted cattle raid. 2 SPLM-IO officers were killed, and 2 others sustained injuries. As a result of the violence, residents of the area fled. The SPLA-IO spokesperson denied involvement, stating that their group did not have a presence in the area where the incident occurred.

On 10 April 2026, youths from the Waai and Hol clans of the Dinka clashed, using sticks, at Konbek in Makuach payam (Bor South county, Jonglei state). The clash initially stemmed from a dispute between two young individuals, which escalated into a clash. 40 people were injured. 5 people were arrested.

On 10 April 2026, Murle from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area attacked a grazing site in Thol (Nyriol county, Jonglei state). Cattle keepers (likely from the Lou Nuer, given the location) pursued them in response. Three people were killed, including two from the Murle community, and two other individuals were wounded. The raiders took 100 cattle while the cattle keepers recovered 58 of the cattle. The Murle and Lou Nuer communities had recently convened a peace conference promoting peaceful coexistence.

On 9 April 2026, armed Lou Nuer attacked Likuangole (Pibor county, Jonglei state) and abducted nine children (likely Murle based on the location. The attackers then crossed to Ethiopia. Five children, including two girls aged seven and nine, were rescued on 14 June were rescued by Pochalla authorities. Four children were taken to local authorities in Pibor, and another remained in Ethiopia, receiving treatment for a gunshot wound.

On 9 April 2026, security personnel (coded as police) acting on the state governor's order, beat and briefly detained an SPLM member (also an MP) at the Akangrong residential area in Abang (Yirol West county, Lakes state) for failing to vacate disputed land. The assault resulted in bodily harm.

On 9 April 2026, unidentified armed assailants attacked 2 locals, among them a teenager, traveling between Payuel and Poktap, in the Poktap area of Ageer Payam (Duk, Jonglei), injuring 1 and abducting the teenager. Local youth pursued the attackers intending to rescue the abductee but were unsuccessful.
On 9 April 2026, suspected SSPDF (military) soldiers abducted 2 SPLM-In Opposition/SPLA-IO members in Diabio village of Naandi Payam (Ezo, Western Equatoria). Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 8 April 2026, two groups of the Gazule/Guzule age set of the Murle clashed in Nargeng village in Likuangole/Lekuangole Payam, near Likuangole (Pibor, Jonglei), resulting in 3 fatalities and 11 injuries. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 7 April 2026, youths from Pan Dor and Pan Yuol, both described as subsections of the Gony section of the Agar Dinka, clashed with sticks on the road in Biling-Daldiar village in Cuei-Gak Payam (location coded to Billing in Aduel, Rumbek East County, Lakes state). This clash ensued when one group accused another of engaging in an inappropriate relationship with a 12-year-old girl. A bystander who attempted to intervene was wounded and later succumbed to their injuries in the hospital. Ten people sustained serious injuries, including three women. Four individuals were subsequently arrested.

On 7 April 2026, suspected attackers from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle) shot and killed a woman (likely Lou Nuer based on the county) and abducted her 14-year-old and 11-year-old sons at Dengjok (Akobo county, Jonglei state). The 14-year-old who was abducted managed to escape.

On 7 April 2026, suspected attackers from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle) shot at a group of people (likely Lou Nuer based on the county) traveling from Ethiopia to Akobo on the outskirts of Akobo town in Bilkey (Jonglei state), resulting in the death of at least one person. The Murle and Lou Nuer communities had recently concluded a conference on peaceful coexistence.

On 7 April 2026, representatives from the Pibor Administrative area (coded as Murle) and Jonglei state (likely Lou-Nuer since a number of attacks involving suspected Murle on likely Lou-Nuer was reported in April) signed a peace agreement in Akobo, Bilkey (Jonglei state). 44 representatives, including county commissioners, chiefs, youth, and women representatives from the Pibor Administrative area and Jonglei state collectively signed an agreement aimed at resolving the ongoing conflict which encompasses issues such as cattle raiding, child abductions, and attacks on commercial or humanitarian trucks.

On 7 April 2026, armed youth suspected of being Toposa community members attacked a civilian from the Lopit community in Imehejek Payam (Lafon/Lopa, Eastern Equatoria), killing him. The incident is a revenge attack following a 17 March 2026 incident when Lopit youth killed 3 Toposa cattle herders (further details unknown/not reported).

On 7 April 2026, armed youth suspected of being Murle community members attacked and killed a civilian in Gakdong village of Dengjok Payam (Akobo, Jonglei). The victim is likely a member of the Lou Nuer community who live in the area. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 5 April 2026, suspected SSPDF abducted a pastor affiliated with the Seventh-day Adventist Church while traveling between Kuajok and Luony-Aker (location coded to Kuajok, Kuac North, Gogrial West county, Warrap state). The abduction was allegedly aimed at preventing church activities in Gogrial East county. The abductors demanded a ransom of 20 million South Sudanese pounds. Authorities in Warrap state and the SSPDF have denied involvement in the abduction. The pastor was released unharmed on April 12, although some of his belongings were stolen.

On 5 April 2026, cattle keepers (coded as unidentified communal militia), clashed with SPLM-IO while recovering their raided cattle near Wau county (location is coded to Wau in Wau North, Western Bahr el Ghazal state).
