During the exchange, six SPLM-IO were killed, and one person was wounded. 420 head of cattle were recovered. The SPLA-IO spokesperson denied involvement, stating that their group did not have a presence in the area where the incident occurred.

Looting: On 5 April 2026, a group (suspected to be affiliated with the SPLM IO) raided 500 heads of cattle from the Ngo-Lingo boma at Abu Shakka in Beselia (Wau county, Western Bahr el Ghazal). The SPLA-IO spokesperson denied the group's involvement in the raid, stating that they did not have a presence in the area where the incident occurred.

On 4 April 2026, unidentified gunmen (described as bandits, coded as unidentified armed group) shot and killed a doctor in his compound in Fangak county (location coded to New Fangak in Phom, Jonglei state). The motive behind the attack is unclear, with possibilities including an act of revenge or a criminal incident.

On 2 April 2026, land grabbers (described as armed men in uniforms and coded as SSPDF) clashed with locals (likely Bari, based on the location) after an assailant shot a community member at Jabel Lado/Lado in Northern Bari (Juba county, Central Equatoria state). One person was killed and another wounded. A different report stated that the incident happened in Molubar.

On 2 April 2026, raiders suspected of being Toposa from Kapoeta South (described as Machi youth) killed at least three children and raided 30 cattle at Lochole described as located between Budi and Camp 15 in Loriyok (Budi county, Eastern Equatoria state).

On 1 April 2026, armed raiders suspected of coming from Rumula boma clashed with local youths (both actors are likely Lango, based on the county) at Iteuso/ Niteusa village in Ikotos (Ikotos county, Eastern Equatoria state). At least 1-2 youths were killed, and an unspecified number of cattle were raided. Fatalities coded as 1.

On 1 April 2026, 11 raiders suspected of coming from Tonj South county (likely Rek Dinka pastoralists, based on the location) clashed with local youths from Mayom county (likely Bul Nuer pastoralists, based on the location) at Nyekuauna area in Riah (location coded to Mayom in Kuerbuone, unity state). Ten raiders were killed.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Sudans Post
properties.notes: On 1 April 2026, raiders suspected of coming from Mayom county in Unity state (likely Bul Nuer pastoralists, based on the location) killed one cattle keeper and wounded another person from the Kongor subsubsection of the Akop section of the Rek Dinka and raided 34 cattle at a grazing land in Aliek payam (Tonj North county, Warrap state). 30 cattle were recovered. Unity state spokesperson denied the involvement of youth from Mayom and accused Gai Machiek forces of being the perpetrators.

Around 1 April 2026 (week of), National Salvation Front (NAS) and the South Sudan People's Defense Forces (SSPDF) clashed in Minga (Mundri East, Central Equatoria state). Casualties unknown. About 6036 individuals were displaced as a result of the clash.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Reuters; The City Review (South Sudan); VOA
properties.notes: On 31 March 2026, suspected members of Murle attacked civilians in Ajwara village in Adongo (Pochalla county, Jonglei state). Local youth (likely Anyuak since Pochalla County is mostly inhabited by the Anyuak) pursued the attackers, and a clash ensued. The motive is unclear, with some reports mentioning revenge, intimidation, and gold as motives. Between 10-12 people were killed, including four women and two children, and 10 people were wounded. The whereabouts of between 15-16 children is unknown. Over 30 homes were burnt, and an unspecified number of cattle were raided. The Greater Pibor Administrative (GPA) government was accused of orchestrating the attack while the area minister of information denied the alleged involvement of the GPA government.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Sudans Post
properties.notes: On 31 March 2026, raiders suspected of coming from Mayom county in Unity state (likely Bul Nuer pastoralists, based on the location) killed 3 cattle keepers from the Kongor subsubsection of the Akop section of the Rek Dinka at a grazing land in Aliek payam (Tonj North county, Warrap state) in an attempted raid. Unity state spokesperson denied the involvement of youth from Mayom and accused Gai Machiek forces of being the perpetrators.

On 31 March 2026, a group of locals beat to death two MTN staff, a Kenyan driver and a Ugandan telecoms engineer, along the Ngauro-Kapoeta South county road in Eastern Equatoria (location coded to Kapoeta in Kapoeta Town). The two staff were involved in a road accident that led to the death of 4 people. The executive director of Kapoeta South county stated that the two MTN staff died in the car accident and were not killed by the mob.

On 31 March 2026, an unidentified armed group shot and killed a staff member of an international nongovernmental organization in Phom (location coded to New Fangak in Fangak county, Jonglei state). The reason is unknown/not reported. No further information is available.

On 31 March 2026, SSPDF (military) soldiers escorting commercial trucks from Pibor to Bor encountered a broken-down vehicle and exchanged gunfire with armed youth suspected of being members of the Murle community in Gumuruk area of Gumuruk Payam (Pibor, Jonglei). The armed youth fled the scene and are allegedly linked to a road ambush that occurred on 30 March (more details unknown/not reported). Motivation unknown/not reported. There were no casualties.
Looting: On 31 March 2026, raiders stole an unspecified number of cattle at Yakuach (Nyirol county, Jonglei state). The raiders and the victims of the raid are likely Lou Nuer, based on the location.

On 30 March 2026, suspected Murle abducted three staff of a national nongovernmental organization at an unspecified location between Bor and Gumuruk (Pibor county, Jonglei state). The reason unknown/not reported. Their whereabouts remain unknown.

properties.source: Catholic Radio Network; Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Miraya; Radio Tamazuj; South Sudan Voice of Voiceless; VOA
properties.notes: On 30 March 2026, at night, security agents, some of whom were wearing military uniforms (coded as military forces), brutally beat and abducted a former mayor of Juba City Council Kalisto Ladu from his home in Munuki (Juba county, Central Equatoria state). Before his dismissal, the mayor was vocal on land-grabbing issues. Extent of injuries not reported/unknown. The former mayor of the Juba City Council was released on September 6.

On 30 March 2026, unidentified group clashed with cattle keepers (all actors involved are likely Lou Nuer, based on the county) at Porbor boma in Nyirol county (location coded to Nyirol in Thol, Jonglei state). At least 3 people were killed, including 2 from the attacking side, and an unspecified number of cattle were raided.

On 30 March 2026, armed youth suspected of being Murle community members from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area attacked Donykan village in Walgak Payam (Akobo, Jonglei), injuring 5 cattle keepers and raiding an unspecified number of cattle. Victims are likely members of the Mor section of the Lou Nuer who live in the area.

On 29 March 2026, armed youth suspected of being Murle community members from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area attacked Tuok village in Pajiek Payam, near Pajiek (Ayod, Jonglei), killing 2 people and raiding at least 1000 cattle. Victims are likely members of the Gawaar Nuer community who live in the area. Local armed youth unsuccessfully pursued the attackers intending to recover the stolen animals.

On 28 March 2026, armed youth suspected of being Murle community members attacked Puokbor village in Thol Payam (Nyirol, Jonglei), killing 2 people and Victims are likely members of the Lou Nuer community who live in the area. The attackers also raided an unspecified number of cattle during the incident. The incident created tension in the area with the Lou Nuer community on high alert.

On 27 March 2026, armed raiders suspected of being from Cueibet county (likely Gok Dinka, based on the location) killed a police officer who pursued them after a cattle raid at Ameth-Cok/Ameth Chok in Manyang-Ngok (Tonj South county, Warrap state).

On 27 March 2026, armed attackers suspected of being from Mayom county in Unity state (likely Bul Nuer, based on the location) killed 8 people, wounded 11 people and raided an unspecified number of cattle at Warcuei (location coded to Liet-nhom in Toch West, Gogrial East county, Warrap state). The victims of the attack are likely the Apuk-Giir section of the Rek Dinka, based on the location.

On 27 March 2026, unidentified armed assailants suspected to be Murle community members ambushed an NGO vehicle along the Juba-Bor Road, in Magri Village of Mangala North Payam (location coded to Logori in Terekeka County, Central Equatoria State). The occupants fled to nearby military barracks and there were no casualties. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 27 March 2026, two groups (described as Chieyaak and Chietutchaar sections and coded as unidentified communal militia) clashed in Koor-Machar area of Pagak Payam (location coded to Pagak in Maiwut County, Upper Nile State), over a personal dispute. The incident resulted in 6 injuries.

On 26 March 2026, suspected armed youth from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle) clashed with local youths from Ayod county (likely Gawaar Nuer, based on location) at an unspecified location in Ayod payam (Jonglei state) after the suspected armed youth abducted children and the local youth pursued them. A boy was killed, and a girl was shot and wounded. The victims were among the 8 abductees, three girls and five boys.

On 26 March 2026, armed assailants suspected to be youth from the Luach-Jang Dinka community from Warrap State's Tonj East County exchanged gunfire with members of the Nielniel sub-section of the Pakam section of the Agar Dinka in Wun-rieng Payam (Rumbek North, Lakes), in an attempted an attack on residents but were successfully repelled. Motivation unknown/not reported. There were no casualties.

On 26 March 2026, armed youth from Warrap State's Tonj East County (likely from the Dinka community which is predominant in the area) attacked a convoy of SSPDF vehicles transporting soldiers in Kol-Macharthon area of Maper Payam (location coded to Maper in Rumbek North County, Lakes State). The incident resulted in 38 fatalities and 11 injuries. The soldiers were returning to Maper Town after escorting traders to the border of Lakes and Unity States when they were ambushed. Motivation unknown/not reported.

Looting: On 26 March 2026, armed youth suspected of coming from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (likely Murle community members who live in the area) raided around 400 cattle in Yakkuach village of Chuil Payam (Nyirol, Jonglei). Victims are likely from the Lou Nuer community. Lou Nuer youths unsuccessfully attempted to recover the stolen animals (means unspecified).

On 25 March 2026, armed youth suspected of being Murle community members attacked Gok village in Pagil Payam, near Pagil (Ayod, Jonglei), killing 1 person, injuring another, and abducting 8 children. Victims are likely Gawaar Nuer community members who live in the area. Local youth pursued the attackers but further details are unknown/not reported. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 25 March 2026, youth (described as Manthakat youths and coded as unidentified communal militia) attempted a cattle raid from Maniyrang villages in Likuangole/Lekuangole Payam (Pibor, Jonglei), resulting in 2 fatalities. Victims are likely from the Murle community who live in the area.

On 24 March 2026, gunmen, described as bandits, suspected to be from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle) attacked police along the Duk-Ayod road in Duk (location coded to Duk Padiet, Jonglei state), while the police were escorting construction engineers and machinery. Two police officers sustained injuries during the attack.

On 24 March 2026, overnight, armed youths suspected of coming from Rumbek North county in Lakes state (likely Agar Dinka, based on the location) shot and killed at least 9 family members including five women, two children and two elderly people at Adau Wal village in Makuac payam (Tonj East county, Warrap state) for an unknown reason. The victims of the attack are likely Rek Dinka based on the location.

On 24 March 2026, local youths (likely Gawaar Nuer based on the county), pursued and clashed with armed youth suspected to be from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle) near Ayod town (Jonglei state) after an abduction (coded separately). Two local youths sustained critical injuries during the confrontation.

On 24 March 2026, armed youth suspected to be from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle) abducted at least 7 children aged between 8 and 15 years, including 3 girls, (likely Gawaar Nuer based on the county) at a stream in Goak payam, an area three days' walk from Ayod town (Ayod, Jonglei state). The abducted children were fishing and fetching water among many village children, who managed to flee unharmed.

On 24 March 2026, armed youth suspected of being from the Murle community attacked a group of local contractors conducting road clearance work for a UN organization along the road between Ayod and Duk Counties in Nyariali village of Pajiek Payam, near Fankur (Ayod, Jonglei), leaving 2 of the workers injured. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 24 March 2026, SSPDF (military) soldiers clashed with NAS militants at an unnamed location between the Yembe River and the Yei- Maridi Road in Otogo Payam, near Ombasi (Yei, Central Equatoria). Following the incident, SSPDF patrolled the area to avoid any movement disruptions. Motivation unknown/not reported. There were no casualties.

On 24 March 2026, armed assailants from the Toposa community from Kapoeta South County clashed with youth from the Didinga community at a grazing land in Kalibah area of Kimotong Payam, near Kimotong (Budi, Eastern Equatoria), resulting in 1 injury. Local authorities engaged (means unspecified) to de-escalate the situation. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 24 March 2026, armed youth (described as being from Lakes State and likely from the Pakam section of the Agar Dinka who live in neighboring Rumbek North County, Lakes State) attacked AdanWal village in Makuac Payam, near Malwal (Tonj East, Warrap), killing 11 people, including an unspecified number of women. Victims are likely members of the Luach Jang Dinka who live in the area. The attack is in retaliation to an incident on 23 March 2026 (coded separately) when the latter attacked Maper Payam in Rumbek North, Lakes State, killing 2 people.

On 23 March 2026, members of the Lou Nuer community who were hunting attacked a youth from the Murle community in Geni area of Dengjok Payam, near Dengjok (Akobo, Jonglei), killing him. Motivation unknown/not reported.

Looting: On 23 March 2026, armed youth from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area and suspected to be Murle community members raided 300 cattle from Man-nyuot Village in Riim Boma of Waat Payam, near Keu (Nyirol, Jonglei). Local youth from the Lou Nuer community pursued the raiders (no information reported). There were no casualties.

On 23 March 2026, individuals suspected to be SPLM-In Opposition members killed an SSPDF soldier in Jikou/Jekow of Jikou/Jekow Payam (Maiwut, Upper Nile). Subsequently, the SSPDF blamed the SPLM-In Opposition for the attack. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 23 March 2026, individuals from Yomding area of Ulang County (likely from the Gaajok section of the Eastern Jikany Nuer who live in the area) shot and killed a man at the riverbank in Ulang area, Nasir Payam, near Nasir (Luakpiny/Nasir, Upper Nile), as retaliation following a past event (further details unknown/not reported). The victim is likely a member of the Gaagwang section of the Eastern Jikany Nuer who live in the area.

On 23 March 2026, armed youth (described as suspected to be coming from Warrap State and coded as unidentified communal militia) killed 4 women in Pulbar/Puolbar Village of Marial-Lou Payam (Tonj North, Warrap), as retaliation following a past event (further details unknown/not reported). Victims are likely members of the Lou Paher section of the Rek Dinka who live in the area.

On 22 March 2026, an armed group (likely Rek Dinka, based on the location) shot and killed 4 people including a local administrator (described as the executive director of the Akop region) while sitting under a tree in Akop (Tonj North county, Warrap state). Local authorities arrested two local chiefs and two youth leaders in connection to the incident.

On 22 March 2026, armed youths from Rumbek Centre and Rumbek East (likely Agar Dinka, based on counties) killed 3 people, wounded one person, and raided 5,019 cattle at Guelgok cattle camp located south of Panyijiar county (Unity state) in a cattle raid incident. The victims of the attack are likely Nyuong Nuer based on the location.

On 22 March 2026, an unknown armed group, described as armed assailants, ambushed and killed a national security service officer (police) who also served as a bodyguard to the Governor of Western Equatoria State at Moso in Bagidi (Ezo county, Western Equatoria state). Four people were wounded, including three other bodyguards and a woman. The attackers stole two motorbikes and valuables from the victims. Following the attack, dozens of people were displaced.

properties.source: Sudans Post; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 22 March 2026, armed assailants suspected of being members of the Luach Jang Dinka from Tonj East county in Warrap state shot and killed a woman and a man and abducted four women from the Pakam section of Agar Dinka at Maper in Maper Town (Rumbek North county, Lakes state). The abductees were released afterwards.

On 22 March 2026, armed youth suspected of being from the Murle community attacked a cattle camp belonging to members of the Lou Nuer community in Riam village, 10 kilometers from Waat village, near Waat (Nyirol, Jonglei), where they raided an unspecified number of cattle. The incident also resulted in 1 fatality and 1 injury, both from the Lou Nuer community.

On 22 March 2026, youth from the Agar section of the Dinka from Lakes State's Rumbek Centre County clashed with armed Nuer youth from Unity State's Panyijiar County (likely from the Nyong Nuer based on the location) at the Heifir-Nhom fishing camp in Amongpiny Payam, near Amongpiny (Rumbek Centre, Lakes), leaving 2 Nuer youth dead and 2 Agar Dinka youth injured. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 22 March 2026, armed youth suspected of being members of the Luach Jang Dinka community from Warrap State's Tonj East county attacked individuals from Muorleng village in Aloor Payam (Rumbek North, Lakes), resulting in 2 fatalities. Victims are likely members of the Pakam section of the Agar Dinka who live in the area. Motivation unknown/not reported.

Looting: On 22 March 2026, armed youth from the Manuer sub-section of the Pakam section of the Agar Dinka from Malueth Payam raided 70 cattle belonging to members of the Jalwau section of the Rek Dinka from Tonj East County at a grazing land in Amok Boma of Mayen Payam (Rumbek North, Lakes), and drove them towards Malueth Payam, Rumbek North County. The cattle (as reported), which were previously stolen during a raid, had been retrieved and were under the care of government security forces.

On 21 March 2026, poachers (also described as armed assailants) suspected of coming from the Panyijiar county in Unity state (likely Nyong Nuer, based on the location) killed at least two wildlife officers who were on duty at Along-bek area in Amongpiny (Rumbek Centre county, Lakes state).

On 21 March 2026, over 100 women who operate small businesses held a peaceful protest at the business center located at Customs Roundabout in Juba Town Payam, near Custom Market (Juba, Central Equatoria), over the land grabbing from the women to sell their products by an unknown investor. The protest resulted in the temporary blocking of roads in the vicinity but ended peacefully after the Juba Mayor responded and addressed their grievances.

On 20 March 2026, raiders suspected of coming from Tonj county in Warrap state (likely Rek Dinka, based on location) clashed with cattle keepers (likely Gok Dinka, based on the county) in Adong cattle camp at Tiap Tiap in Citcok (Cueibet county, Lakes state). Three people were killed.

On 20 March 2026, armed assailants suspected of being from the Murle community attacked 3 women in Pajiek Payam (Ayod, Jonglei), killing 1 of them and abducting the other 2. The abductees were later recovered by local youth who were pursuing the abductors. Victims are likely from the Gawaar section of the Nuer who live in the area. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 20 March 2026, members of the Kurenen age-set group of the Murle clashed with members from the Guzule age-set of the Murle in Wungony village, near Likuangole (Pibor, Jonglei), resulting in 3 fatalities. Motivation unknown/not reported. Further information indicates a separate clash occurred on the same day between the 2 groups in Akillo area but there were no casualties (further details unknown/not reported).

On 20 March 2026, NAS militants clashed with SSPDF troops in Minga Payam (Mundri East, Western Equatoria), resulting in the death of 1 SSPDF soldier. Motivation unknown/not reported. The incident created tension in the area and led to the displacement of civilians from 3 villages.

Looting: On 19 March 2026, suspected youth from Oronyo (coded as unidentified communal militia) raided at least 49 heads of cattle from three villages Ihirang, Idali and Lodo (each coded separately), 8 cattle were stolen at Ihirang in Imehejek (Lafon county, Eastern Equatoria state). The victims of the raid are likely either Pari or Lopit, who are based in Lafon.

Looting: On 19 March 2026, suspected youth from Oronyo (coded as unidentified communal militia) raided at least 49 heads of cattle from three villages Ihirang, Idali and Lodo (each coded separately), 7 cattle were raided from Idali in Longiro (Lafon county, Eastern Equatoria state). The victims of the raid are likely either Pari or Lopit, who are based in Lafon.

Looting: On 19 March 2026, suspected youth from Oronyo (coded as unidentified communal militia) raided at least 49 heads of cattle from three villages Ihirang, Idali, and Lodo (each coded separately), 17 heads of cattle were raided at Lodo (Lafon county, Eastern Equatoria state). The victims of the raid are likely either Pari or Lopit, who are based in Lafon.

On 19 March 2026, raiders killed two people and stole 300 cattle at Luur/ Luor in Tore (Uror county, Jonglei state) and Yai/Yuai (coded separately). The raiders and victims of the attack are likely Lou Nuer, based on the county. 2 fatalities split over two locations and coded as 1.

On 19 March 2026, raiders killed two people and stole 300 cattle at Luur/Luor (coded separately and Yai/Yuai in Weikol (Uror county, Jonglei state). The raiders and victims of the attack are likely Lou Nuer, based on the county. 2 fatalities split over two locations and coded as 1.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Miraya; Radio Tamazuj; VOA
properties.notes: On 19 March 2026, heavily armed youths, suspected to be Anyuak, ambushed and killed 15 individuals, including the Jebel Boma commissioner, government officials, local politicians, an SSPDF commander, and their bodyguards, while also injuring four others at Takarau, described as a one-hour walk to Nyat in Boma (Pibor county, Jonglei state). During the attack, one of the assailants was killed.

On 19 March 2026, an armed individual suspected of being from the Fulani (a.k.a Mbororo/Ambororo) community shot and injured an Azande/Zande community member in Kua-Tumba Boma, near Sakure (Nzara, Western Equatoria), over cattle-related disputes.

On 19 March 2026, an unidentified armed group abducted 2 people in Mabia, which is about 15 kilometers southeast of Tambura, (Tambura, Western Equatoria). Later, one of the victims was released but had sustained injuries as a result of being assaulted. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 18 March 2026, suspected Toposa youth abducted a man and raided 700 goats at Arihilo (likely an alternating spelling of Arilo/Lohitojo) in Lafon county, Eastern Equatoria state. The victim is likely either Pari or Lopit, who are based in Lafon.

Movement of forces: On 18 March 2026, three battalions of heavily armed UDPF were deployed at Luri Presidential and Security Complex in Northern Bari (Juba county, Central Equatoria state). Both SSPDF and UDPF spokespersons have denied the alleged deployment.

Looting: On 18 March 2026, suspected Loronyo youth (likely Lotuko, based on the location) raided at least 17 heads of cattle at Imehejek (Lafon county, Eastern Equatoria state). The victims of the raid are likely either Pari or Lopit, who are based in Lafon.

On 18 March 2026, armed youth suspected of being from Rubkona County (likely from the Chiengthiech section of the Nuer who are based in the area) attacked a Sudanese nomad who was herding his cattle at a water source in Pan-Akuach area (Rubkona, Unity), killing him. Government security forces responded to the scene (means unspecified) and the assailants fled. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 16 March 2026, armed youth suspected of being from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (also described as armed assailants and coded as Murle) attacked a commercial truck, killed at least four passengers, and wounded seven people, including a Darfuri businessman on the outskirts of Poktap in Payuel (Duk county, Jonglei state).

On 16 March 2026, members of the Gwalla section of the Bor Dinka clashed with members of Malual Dinka at an unspecified location along the Juba-Bor Road in Kolnyang Payam, near Kolnyang (Bor South, Jonglei), leaving 16 people injured, with 2 of those in critical condition. The incident happened after a wrestling match and the motivation is unknown/not reported. Local police responded and arrested 4 individuals.

On 16 March 2026, armed assailants suspected to be Bul Nuer members ambushed cattle owners at a swampy grazing area in Wagej village in Toch East Payam, near Toch (Gogrial East, Warrap), resulting in 17 fatalities and 12 injuries. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 16 March 2026, armed youth suspected of being members of the Nuer community from Unity State raided 74 cattle from Lou Mawien members of the Akop section of the Rek Dinka in Maluieldit village of Alabek Payam, near Alabek (Tonj North, Warrap), leading to an exchange of fire that resulted in 3 fatalities, 2 Nuer youths, and 1 Lou Mawien member. 2 of the stolen animals were also recovered.

On 15 March 2026, armed youth suspected of being from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (also described as armed assailants and coded as Murle) killed a man and abducted a woman and her child at Ayueldit near Duk Padiet (Duk county, Jonglei state) while collecting fish. A different report states that a pastor, who was traveling with his wife and 4 children, was killed, one of the children was wounded, and the wife and two children were abducted at Pajeiing in Duk county, and the wife then escaped unharmed.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Sudans Post; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 15 March 2026, suspected Bul Nuer raiders, some clad in army attire, from Mayom county in Unity state clashed with armed youth from Gogrial East county (likely from the Apuk-Giir section of the Rek Dinka, based on the county), along with SSPDF forces in a swampy area at Wakic/Wagej/Awoyic (located in Liet-nhom, Toch West, Gogrial East county, Warrap state). The confrontation resulted in 17 fatalities, including 11 youths from Gogrial East and 6 Bul Nuer individuals, with 12 others sustaining injuries. Additionally, 532 head of cattle were raided, and the whereabouts of five cattle keepers remain unknown. Gogrial East County and SSPDF managed to recover some of the raided cattle. The Mayom County commissioner accused armed Nuer youth based in Ajak Kuac as the perpetrators.

Around 15 March 2026 (between 1 - 31 March), suspected armed youths from Panyijiar county in Unity state (likely Nyong Nuer who reside in the county) attacked a cattle camp at an unspecified location in Yirol East (location coded to Nyang, Lekakedu payam, Lakes state).There were unspecified casualties and an unspecified number of cattle were raided.

Change to armed group: Around 15 March 2026 (as reported), the former deputy governor of Lakes state and 17 politicians including members of the party's national liberation council, state ministers and legislators announced their defection from SPLM-IO into the SPLM party at Rumbek in Rumbek Town (Rumbek county, Lakes state), citing a lack of reform within the SPLM-IO.

On 15 March 2026, suspected members of the Toposa community raided 15 cattle from members of the Buya/Boya community in Kimotong village (Budi, Eastern Equatoria) and shot and killed 1 person during the incident. Further reports indicate that Toposa leaders unsuccessfully called on the raiders to return the stolen animals.

On 15 March 2026, unidentified armed cattle raiders (coded as unidentified communal militia) clashed with cattle keepers from the Jalwau section of the Rek Dinka from Warrap State's Tonj North County in Madhool Boma of Malueth Payam (Rumbek North, Lakes), resulting in 2 injuries. The raiders also made away with an unspecified number of cattle. Security personnel and the Rumbek North County Commissioner went to the scene (means unspecified) to calm the situation.

Looting: On 14 March 2026, unidentified armed assailants (coded as unidentified communal militia) raided 30 cows from members of the Aniin sub-section of the Pakam section of the Agar Dinka in Panyang village of Mayen Payam (Rumbek North, Lakes). Local youths pursued (means unspecified) the assailants and recovered all the stolen animals. There were no casualties.

On 14 March 2026, an unidentified armed assailant (coded as unidentified armed group) shot and killed 4 people, including a lactating mother, in Barakol village (Jur River, Western Bahr el Ghazal). Motivation unknown/not reported. Additional information notes that the victims were from Jur-Lou of Barakol.

Around 13 March 2026 (as reported), raiders (described as being from Warrap state and likely Dinka, based on the state) attacked and wounded (cut off two ears) a cattle keeper and raided 8 cattle at an unspecified location between Gok Machar and Ror-Colahol area in Lakes state (location coded to Cueibet in Malou Pec). The wounded cattle keeper was treated at a hospital and is ikely part of Dinka, based on the location.

Looting: On 13 March 2026, armed individuals suspected to be from the Nuer community of Panyijiar County (likely the Nyong Nuer who live in the area) raided 4 cows from a Ciec Dinka family in Adior Town (Yirol East, Lakes). The cattle owners unsuccessfully pursued the raiders towards Unity State's Panyijiar County (no interactions reported).

Around 12 March 2026 (as reported), armed youths suspected of being members of Luanyjan/ Luach Jang Dinka from Tonj East county attacked four people (described as Boda Boda riders and fish traders) and killed at least two people at an unspecified location near a river in Madol payam (location coded to Wunliet in Rumbek North county, Lakes state). The whereabouts of two people is unknown.

On 12 March 2026, an unspecified number of youth from Aweil Centre held a peaceful protest at a private company's compound in Aroyo Payam (Aweil Centre, Northern Bahr el Ghazal), over their displeasure with the company's failure to provide community services in exchange for aggregates, as agreed in the contract. The protesters presented their grievances and then dispersed.

On 11 March 2026, eight armed individuals (described as convicted felons who broke out of the prison and armed bandits) attacked and wounded an officer from the Criminal Investigation Department and looted his valuables in the Bazungua area in Yambio Town (Yambio county, Western Equatoria state). The officer was treated at a hospital for head injuries.

On 11 March 2026, suspected Pakam Dinka armed youth from Lakes State attacked individuals from Tonj East County's Wunlit Payam (likely from the Jalwau section of the Rek Dinka who live in the area) in Kak Village of Malueth Payam (Rumbek North, Lakes), killing one person. The victims had migrated to the area for grazing land. They were attacked in a suspected retaliation following a 7 March incident (coded separately) at Buul Mathiang cattle camp in Tonj East County involving communities from Warrap and Lakes states.

On 11 March 2026, armed youth suspected to be from Tonj South County (likely Tonj South communal militia who live in the area) attacked two traders in Manyang-Ngok Payam (Tonj South, Warrap), injuring 1 of them. The attackers also raided 8 cows from the victims. Victims are likely from the Thony section of the Rek Dinka who live in the area where the incident occurred.

On 10 March 2026, cattle raiders suspected to be from Lakes State's Rumbek East County (likely members of the Agar Dinka who live in the area) stole 28 cattle at Wun-Manga cattle camp in Gher Payam (location coded to Ramayang in Yirol West County, Lakes State). Local youth (likely from the Buok Clan of the Atuot who live in the area) pursued the raiders, engaged them in an exchange of fire, and recovered 20 of the stolen animals. Additionally, security personnel pursued (means unspecified) the attackers who fled with the other 8 animals toward Rumbek East County. There were no casualties.

On 10 March 2026, unidentified armed youth suspected to be from Jamjang Payam (coded as unidentified communal militia) attacked a Falata/Mbororo cattle camp in Jam Jang area (Panriang, Unity). The assailants shot and wounded 1 Falata member and raided an unknown number of cattle. Authorities in the Ruweng Administrative Area deployed security personnel (means unspecified) to pursue the attackers. Outcome not reported.

On 10 March 2026, youth from Wunlit (likely from the Jalwau section of the Rek Dinka who live in the area) killed a youth from the Pakam section of the Agar Dinka, who was residing with the Luachjang community in Tonj East along the border area with Lakes State, in Wunlit Payam (Tonj East, Warrap). Following the incident, Pakam youth reacted by killing a Luachjang member who was residing at an unspecified Pakam cattle camp. Motivation unknown/not reported.

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 9 March 2026, armed youths suspected of being members of the spiritual leader Gai Machiek force (a suspected rebel general belonging to South Sudan People's Movement/Army) killed at least 7 members of Misseriya pastoralists and raided 379 cattle at Kuerchiedieng forest located north of Mayom county (location coded to Mayom in Kuerbuone, Unity state).

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: Around 9 March 2026 (between 9 - 10 March), armed men suspected of being from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle) attacked a convoy of ten WFP trucks and killed a Somali WFP truck driver at Averdok village in Panyang (Duk county, Jonglei state). A conflicting report stated that the incident occurred in Apiir Donga. Nine truck drivers sped off without any damage or injuries. The convoys were delivering relief aid.

On 9 March 2026, individuals suspected of being members of the Murle community from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area attacked Lou Nuer cattle keepers in Thakuach area of Walgak Payam (location coded to Walgak in Akobo County, Jonglei State), leaving 5 people injured. Motivation unknown/not reported. The incident happened despite a peace dialogue ongoing between the 2 communities.

On 9 March 2026, members of the Kurenen age set of the Murle from Kongor area clashed with their counterparts from the Guzule age set from Munchak in Likuangole Payam (Pibor, Jonglei), while the former were pursuing their stolen cattle. The incident resulted in 4 fatalities.

On 9 March 2026, unidentified armed individuals (coded as unidentified communal militia) raided 4 goats from a Ciec Dinka family in Majak Jok Village of Tinagau Payam (Yirol East, Lakes). Yirol East youth (Ciec Dinka) intervened and recovered all the stolen animals. Casualties unknown.

On 9 March 2026, an unidentified group of youth (coded as unidentified armed group) ambushed a convoy of commercial trucks, transporting assorted food items, contracted by the UN that was traveling from Payuel to Lankien in Payuel area (location coded to Duk Payuel in Duk County, Jonglei State), killing one of the drivers, a foreign national. Before the ambush, one of the trucks had developed a mechanical issue that had led the convoy to stop. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 8 March 2026, porters held a protest at a United Nations agency warehouse in Rejaf Payam (Juba, Central Equatoria), demanding to be employed by the contractor. Police were deployed and the protesters dispersed (means unspecified). Later on 11 March 2026, RRC representatives, the contractor, and the protesters held a meeting but the outcome was unknown/not reported.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Risk and Strategic Management, Corporation
properties.notes: On 7 March 2026, armed land grabbers suspected to be Dinka community members beat family members of the Molubur village chief and demolished their home in Lado payam, Northern Bari (Juba county, Central Equatoria state). The extent of injuries unknown/not reported. Village youths were also attacked, valuables and houses were burnt, and an unspecified number of children and women were displaced. The victims of the attack likely Bari, based on the payam. 40 suspects were arrested over the land dispute, including military officers. Members of SSPDF are allegedly engaged in forceful land grabbing in the payam.

On 7 March 2026, members of the local community in Twic East County (likely Twic East Dinka who live in the area) clashed with suspected armed Murle youth in Gadiang area (Twic East, Jonglei). The clash led to the abduction of 1 person who was later released. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 7 March 2026, unidentified armed individuals (coded as unidentified armed group) attacked an INGO-contracted fuel truck near a government checkpoint in Panyang Payam (location coded to Abiemnhom in Abiemnhom County, Unity State), leaving the driver injured. However, the driver and other passengers managed to escape to nearby bushes. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 7 March 2026, armed youth suspected of coming from the Jalwau section of the Rek Dinka shot and killed a member of the Pakam section of the Agar Dinka at Buul Cattle Camp in Wunliit Payam (location coded to Wunlit in Tonj East County, Warrap State), as part of revenge attacks between the 2 communities. The victim was visiting his relatives when the attack occurred.

On 6 March 2026, armed youth suspected of being members of the Lou Nuer community ambushed 2 Murle members, traveling along Pibor-Akobo Road, at Wechnyuon Area in Nyandit Payam (location coded to Burmath in Akobo County, Jonglei State), killing both. The victims were traveling to Akobo County for a peace dialogue. Following the incident, authorities intervened to de-escalate the situation. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 6 March 2026, armed individuals (coded as unidentified armed group) raided 176 cattle from members of the Pakam section of the Agar Dinka at Ayen cattle camp in Madol Payam (location coded to Biar in Rumbek North County, Lakes State). The cattle keepers engaged the attackers in an exchange of fire and recovered 175 of the stolen animals while 1 of the animals was killed. There were no casualties.

On 6 March 2026, residents (coded as unidentified communal militia) of Nyik area clashed over a land dispute in South Renk Payam (location coded to Payuer in Renk County, Upper Nile State), leaving 3 people with gunshot injuries. Local police responded (means unspecified) and arrested 1 suspect.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Miraya; Radio Tamazuj; Sudans Post
properties.notes: On 5 March 2026, unidentified raiders (coded as Unidentified communal militia) killed a United Nations Mission in South Sudan truck driver who was on leave and wounded another person at Abiemnhom (Unity state) in a cattle raid incident. Ten cattle were raided.

On 5 March 2026, armed youth suspected of coming from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (likely from the Murle community who reside in the area) shot and injured a Nuer community member in Pieri Town (Uror, Jonglei). The victim was taken to an INGO facility in Lankien Town for treatment. Motivation unknown/not reported.

Change to armed group: On 4 March 2026, the SPLM-IO chairperson and 15 officers announced their defection into the SPLM party at Guit (Unity state), citing SPLM-IO's lack of clear mission, mandates, and updates. A former SPLM-IO commissioner of Rubkona County stated that the defectors are not members of SPLM-IO.

properties.source: Aid Worker Security Database; Risk and Strategic Management, Corporation
properties.notes: On 4 March 2026, unknown attackers (coded as an unidentified armed group) ambushed a convoy of UN contracted commercial trucks, traveling from Pading to Bor along the Yuai-Bor Road, at an unspecified location 10km away from Yuai in Uror Payam (Uror County, Jonglei State). The incident left 1 driver injured. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 4 March 2026, suspected Murle armed youth ambushed a convoy of commercial vehicles, traveling from Pibor to Manyabol, escorted by combined Government security forces (coded as police and SSPDF) in Bolkan area of Gumuruk Payam (location coded to Gumuruk in Pibor County, Jonglei State), resulting in the injury of 1 officer. Motivation unknown/not reported.

Looting: On 4 March 2026, unidentified armed assailants (coded as unidentified communal militia) raided 10 cattle from locals (likely the Gok Dinka who live in the area) at a grazing land in Duony Payam (Cueibet, Lakes). The victims unsuccessfully pursued the attackers towards Rumbek Centre County, Lakes State.

On 4 March 2026, a group of foreign traders closed their shops and held a protest at Rumbek market in Matangai Payam (Rumbek Centre, Lakes) over the reduction of prices of commodities at the said market. The protest was fueled by the arrest of 30 traders on 27 February 2026 due to extreme fluctuation in the prices of commodities.

On 4 March 2026, two inter-sectional groups (described as from the Doma community and coded as unidentified communal militia) clashed in Doya Payam (Ulang, Upper Nile), over a suspected revenge attack resulting in 1 fatality and 2 injuries. Authorities intervened (means unspecified) and restored normalcy.

On 4 March 2026, an armed individual (described as being from the Cie-lek community and coded as unidentified communal militia) shot and killed 2 people, including a chief, from the Manbath sub-section of the Lou Nuer in Doma Payam (Ulang, Upper Nile), over a revenge related matter. The incident created fear of mobilization from the 2 communities but leaders intervened and de-escalated the situation.

On 3 March 2026, suspected Murle community members shot and injured 4 Lou Nuer members in Pamai Boma of Wechkol Payam (location coded to Yuai in Uror County, Jonglei State). Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 3 March 2026, 10 armed assailants (coded as unidentified armed group) shot at a logistics convoy of 38 United Nations-contracted trucks, escorted by UN protection forces (coded as UNMISS), while traveling along the Bor-Pibor Road in Anyidi Payam (Bor South, Jonglei), prompting the UN forces to fire back. The attackers escaped and the convoy proceeded to Pibor. There were no casualties.

On 3 March 2026, members of the Kongor subsection of the Akop section of the Rek Dinka clashed with individuals from the Pagok sub-section of the Langdiing section of the Gok Dinka in Abei Cok Village (Cueibet, Lakes), over a marriage-related dispute resulting in the injury of 1 person, who later succumbed to the injuries. The clash erupted when relatives of the bride attacked the groom's family creating tension between 2 rival sections.

On 2 March 2026, suspected armed youth from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle) killed at least two people, severely wounded four people from Uror county (likely Lou Nuer, based on the location) and raided 25 cattle in a forest 3 hours walking distance from Nyirol (location coded to Nyirol in Thol, Jonglei state). The victims of the attack were a group of men returning from Nyirol with 25 cattle (bride price).

On 1 March 2026, Kuom residents held a demonstration against a court demolition order in Aroyo Payam (Aweil Centre, Northern Bahr el Ghazal) where they pelted stones at police officers implementing the order. The incident left 14 people injured, including 1 with gunshot wounds. No further details on the shooting.

On 1 March 2026, police officers arrested 35 youth IDPs, also Nuer members, from Mangateen IDP camp (Juba, Central Equatoria), over their involvement in a clash with Bari community members over a piece of land located at Kujjiek area in the vicinity of SSPDF checkpoint. The arrested individuals were held at Gudele police division.

On 1 March 2026, suspected Logir community members attacked Lolianga area, which is about 50 kilometers east of Torit, in Ikotos Payam (location coded to Ikotos in Ikotos County, Eastern Equatoria State), where they raided an unspecified number of goats. Following the raid, Mnyomiji youth from Lolianga (coded as unidentified communal militia) pursued the attackers and recovered 48 of the stolen animals. 1 of the raiders was killed.

On 1 March 2026, armed Dinka from Warrap State attempted a cattle raid at Madul Village in Mankien Payam (location coded to Mankien in Mayom County, Unity State), resulting in an exchange of fire with armed Bul Nuer cattle guards. 2 Bul Nuer cattle guards were killed.

On 29 February 2026, armed Gok Dinka youths attacked members of the Tiek/Tiik sub-section of the Ruop section of the Agar Dinka in Malek Payam (Rumbek Centre, Lakes), killing 1 herder and raiding an unspecified number of cattle. This incident created tension between the 2 communities.

On 29 February 2026, armed youth from the Ruop section of the Agar Dinka from Malek Payam raided 6 cows from members of the Gok Dinka community in Ralkou area of Duony Payam (location coded to Duony in Cueibet County, Lakes State). Following the incident, the attackers were engaged in an exchange of fire with police leading to the recovery of 2 of the stolen cows while the former escaped with the other 4. There were no casualties.

On 29 February 2026, unidentified armed assailants (coded as unidentified communal militia) stole 113 cattle from local cattle keepers (likely Gok Dinka who live in the area) at Tatar cattle camp in Duony Payam (location coded to Duony in Cueibet County, Lakes State). During the raid, 2 raiders were killed while 2 people, from both sides, were injured.

On 29 February 2026, suspected NAS abducted 4 local youths at an unnamed location between Mitika and Lasu in Lasu Payam (location coded to Lasu in Yei County, Central Equatoria State). Motivation unknown/not reported.

properties.source: Aid Worker Security Database; Risk and Strategic Management, Corporation
properties.notes: On 29 February 2026, an unidentified group (coded as unidentified armed group) ambushed a convoy of 18 UN-contracted trucks at an unnamed location along the route between Abiemnhom and Mayom in Pup Payam (location coded to Pup/Pub in Mayom County, Unity State), resulting in the injury of 1 driver. Motivation unknown/not reported.

Property destruction: On 28 February 2026, soldiers (coded as SSPDF) removed community fences (likely belonging to Bari, based on the payam) at Jebel Lado in Northern Bari (Juba county, Central Equatoria state). Members of SSPDF are allegedly engaged in forceful land grabbing in the payam.

On 28 February 2026, SSPDF and NAS clashed in Lasu Payam (Yei, Central Equatoria), resulting in 10 fatalities from both sides and 4 injuries. The clash led to the displacement of an unknown number of residents. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 28 February 2026, armed land grabbers suspected of being from the Nuer community clashed with Bari members in Lado area (Juba, Central Equatoria), over a land issue. The land grabbers also set on fire several houses in the area. Casualties unknown.

Looting: On 27 February 2026, suspected Boya raided an unspecified number of cattle (likely from Toposa based on the location) at Kapoeta North county (location coded to Riwoto in Najie, Eastern Equatoria state).

On 27 February 2026, suspected Toposa (described as coming from Riwoto payam, Kapoeta North county) raped two women (likely Boya, based on the location), beat another woman (the beaten woman went into a coma as a result) and raided seven cattle and other valuables at the Napak area in Loriyok (Budi county, Eastern Equatoria state). The victims were collecting firewood, vegetables, and wild fruits in a bush. The commissioner of Kapoeta North County denied the alleged rape incident but admitted that the youths did loot.

On 27 February 2026, armed youth suspected of being from the Mure community attacked Lou Nuer youths who were hunting in a bush in Dothiel/Geni area of Dengjok Payam (location coded to Dengjok in Akobo County, Jonglei State), killing 1. The incident is said to have disrupted a planned peace discussion between armed Murle youth from Nanaam and Luo Nuer youth in Wechbuony village, Akobo County.

On 27 February 2026, unidentified armed youth (coded as unidentified communal militia) abducted 2 boys and stole an unspecified number of cows at a grazing land in Maker cattle camp of Madol Payam (Rumbek North, Lakes). Both abductees were later released but one had serious injuries. Victims are likely from the Pakam section of the Agar Dinka who live in the area.

Looting: On 26 February 2026, unidentified armed youth (coded as unidentified communal militia) stole an unspecified number of cows from locals in Kueryiek Payam (Mayom, Unity). Victims are likely from the Bul Nuer who live in the area.

On 26 February 2026, armed youth suspected of being from the Murle community attacked locals (likely members of the Eastern Jikany section of the Nuer who live in the area) in Kiir Village of Jikmir Payam (location coded to Mading in Luakpiny/Nasir County, Upper Nile State), killing 1 person. Motivation unknown/not reported.

Looting: On 26 February 2026, unidentified armed youth (coded as unidentified communal militia) stole 3 cows from locals (likely members of the Bongo ethnic group who live in the area) in Majook-Palou Village of Wulu Payam (location coded to Wulu in Wulu County, Lakes State). The victims attempted to pursue the attackers but were unsuccessful.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); National Salvation Front; Radio Tamazuj; Sudans Post
properties.notes: Property destruction: On 25 February 2026, NAS claimed to have attacked an SSPDF ammunition depot at the Giyada military barrack in Juba (Central Equatoria state) through setting it alight. At least eight people were wounded (including a woman who miscarried later as a result). NAS spokesperson claimed that their special forces attacked the depot but, the SSPDF spokesperson denied the claim and attributed the explosion to heat.

On 25 February 2026, suspected armed youth from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle) attacked a family, killed at least one person and abducted a woman and two children at an unspecified location between Pulturuk and Malakal (Location coded to Pulturuk in Nyirol county, Jonglei state).

On 25 February 2026, members of the Pabol section of the Luacjang Dinka engaged in a fight, over the killing of a member of a rival section, in Makuac Payam (Tonj East county, Warrap state; coded to Makwoich), resulting in 5 fatalities and 9 injuries. SSNPS officers were deployed to de-escalate the situation (means unspecified).

On 25 February 2026, several individuals (described as members of the Pabicieny and Dhiende Giling clans of the Kucghoor Section of the Padang Dinka and coded as Padang clan militia) clashed in Kolang Village of Jamjang Payam (location coded to Jam Jang in Panriang County, Unity State), resulting in 17 injuries. Motivation unknown/not reported. Police were deployed (means unspecified) to de-escalate tensions.

On 25 February 2026, armed cattle raiders suspected of coming from Cueibet County in Lakes State (likely Gok Dinka who live in the area) attacked a herder from the Akook section of the Rek Dinka in Manyang-Ngok Payam (Tonj South, Warrap), killing him. This triggered an armed clash between locals and the attackers, leaving 1 of the latter dead.

On 25 February 2026, armed youth suspected of being from the Murle community ambushed a group of civilians, traveling from Duk to Uror, in Pathat Boma of Tiam Payam (location coded to Tiam in Uror County, Jonglei State), killing 1 person and injuring another. The assailants also stole 50 cows from the victims.

Looting: On 25 February 2026, armed youth suspected of being from the Buya/Boya community raided an unspecified number of cows from the Toposa community in Riwoto Village of Najie Payam (Kapoeta North, Eastern Equatoria). Following the incident, a dialogue between leaders from the Buya/Boya community and the Toposa was initiated to ensure the return of the stolen animals.

On 24 February 2026, soldiers (coded as SSPDF) fired at civilians (likely Bari, based on the payam) at Jebel Lado in Northern Bari (Juba county, Central Equatoria). Unspecified numbers of people were displaced, casualties unknown. SSPDF are allegedly engaged in forceful land grabbing in the payam.

Looting: On 24 February 2026, suspected Toposa (described as being from Kapoeta North County) raided at least 28 calves and 47 goats at Imehejek (Lafon county, Eastern Equatoria state). There is no further information on the identity of the victim/s.

On 24 February 2026, an armed group suspected of being from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle) killed at least three women and abducted one woman at Poktap in Payuel (Duk county, Jonglei state). The victims were with a group of 16 women who were moving from Poktap to Payut.

On 24 February 2026, a clash ensued between members of the Thubezwa clan of the Murle and another group (described as the Manyumen community and coded as unidentified communal militia) in Manyumen Boma, near Manyeran (Pibor, Jonglei), resulting in 1 injury. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 24 February 2026, armed youth (described as coming from Maper Payam in Rumbek North County and coded as Pakam section of the Agar Dinka) abducted 2 minors and raided approximately 500 cows from Pamiakeer cattle camp in Makuac Payam (location coded to Tonj in Tonj South County, Warrap State). The abductees were later released and handed over to authorities in Lakes State.

On 23 February 2026, the county commissioner and his bodyguards beat and seriously wounded and arrested seven members of a family in Fashoda county (location coded to Kodok, Upper Nile state), for causing nuisance (a crying baby).

On 23 February 2026, suspected Anyuak killed one person and severely wounded two people at Tiergol stream at Akobo in Bilkey (Akobo county, Jonglei state). The reason for the attack is unknown. The victims are members of a local football team (soccer) who just concluded a match.

Looting: On 23 February 2026, unidentified armed assailants (coded as unidentified communal militia) raided around 120 cows from locals in Waarmiir Village in Kuac South Payam (location coded to Awanyen in Gogrial West County, Warrap State). The attackers then released 115 of the stolen animals and left with 5.

On 23 February 2026, a group of locals threw stones at 3 religious leaders, who had been accused of sexual harassment, in Aweil Town Payam (Aweil West, Northern Bahr el Ghazal), resulting in the injury of 1 person. Following the incident, police arrested the religious leaders. The accusations against the leaders were aimed at removing individuals who were not from South Sudan from the church leadership.

On 22 February 2026, cattle raiders suspected of coming from Gogrial East, Warrap state (coded as Dinka) shot and killed a man (likely Bul Nuer, based on the county) in a forest in Mayom county (location coded to Mayom in Kuerbuone, Unity state). The victim was cutting firewood in the woods. The perpetrators targeted a cattle camp that was on the move in search of pasture and no cattle were raided.

On 22 February 2026, an unknown armed attackers killed at least seven people (including 4 women and a girl) and abducted a woman and her child in Duk county (location coded to Duk Padiet in Padiet, Jonglei state). The victims were collecting firewood. No further information.

On 22 February 2026, SSPDF officers from the Tiger Division from Bor South County shot and injured a trader from the Murle community and arrested another in Mogiri Boma (Juba, Central Equatoria). Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 22 February 2026, suspected NAS militants abducted 9 male individuals in Hai Dam village, near Lataya (Yei, Central Equatoria). 3 of the abductees managed to escape but the remaining 6 were taken towards the South Sudan-DRC border, passing through the Abugo area located between Lasu and Akiba.

On 22 February 2026, armed youth suspected of being from the Murle community attacked members of the Lou Nuer community in Nyalilik Village of Pulturuk Payam (location coded to Pulturuk in Nyirol County, Jonglei State), where they abducted 6 people, including 2 women and 4 children. Armed Lou Nuer youth attempted to rescue the victims but were unsuccessful (no violent interactions were reported).

properties.source: South Sudan Voice of Voiceless; Sudans Post
properties.notes: On 21 February 2026, suspected members of the military intelligence in military armored vehicles shot at the driver of a personal vehicle of the SPLM-IO military spokesman at Gudele II in Munuki (Juba county, Central Equatoria state), in what is described as an assassination attempt against the SPLM-IO the military spokesman, who have received death threats before. There is no further information on the extent of the injury.

Change to armed group: Around 21 February 2026 (as reported), high-ranking members of NAS and 600 armed soldiers defected into SPLM and subsequently into SSPDF and were received at Juba International Airport (Juba county, Central Equatoria).

On 21 February 2026, gunmen (suspected to be from Greater Pibor Administrative Area, coded as Murle) killed at least three women and abducted another woman in the Apirdong area near Poktap town in Payuel (Duk county, Jonglei state) on their way to collect dried fish. They were with 16 other people, mostly men who escaped.
Around 21 February 2026 (week of), members of the Kurenen and Buzulei age sets of the Murle clashed at Pibor (Jonglei state). Two people were killed, and one person was wounded.

On 21 February 2026, armed cattle herders suspected to be from the Bor Dinka community shot and killed a local (likely from the Kakwa community who live in the area) at an unnamed location along the Yei-Maridi Road in Yei Town Payam (location coded to Yei in Yei County, Central Equatoria State). The incident is a retaliation following the killing of a cow by unidentified members of the local community.
Around 20 February 2026 (as reported), members of NAS clashed with SSPDF at the Moji/Moje area in Wonduruba (Juba county, Central Equatoria state). Casualties unknown. 5400 people were displaced.

On 20 February 2026, armed men suspected of coming from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (described as Pibor youth, coded as Murle) ambushed two families and abducted a woman and her two children on a road at Bir village in Pulturuk payam (Nyirol county, Jonglei state). One family escaped unharmed (the victims likely Nuer, based on the location).

On 20 February 2026, unidentified armed assailants (coded as unidentified armed group) attacked the local community (likely the Gawaar Nuer who live in the area) in Wienkuer area of Wau Payam (location coded to Wau in Ayod County, Jonglei State), where they raided an unspecified number of cattle. Local youth pursued the attackers and recovered all the stolen animals. The encounter resulted in 6 fatalities, including 5 attackers, and 1 injury.
On 20 February 2026, members of the Murle community clashed in Chindor Boma of Likuangole Payam (Pibor, Jonglei). 1 person was killed. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 20 February 2026, Guzulle age set members of the Murle attacked 3 Kurenen members of the Murle, who were traveling from Kongor village to Pibor Town, in Wunkok Village of Likuangole Payam (Pibor, Jonglei), resulting in 2 fatalities on the Kurenen side and the injury of 1 Guzulle member while 1 Kurenen member went missing. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 20 February 2026, unidentified armed assailants (coded as unidentified armed group) clashed with a local militia (likely Maban ethnic militia who live in the area) in Jamam Town (Maban, Upper Nile), resulting in 3 fatalities and 6 injuries. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 19 February 2026, an unidentified group (described as suspected land grabbers, coded as unidentified armed group) and police officers clashed in Kasire residential area in Rejaf Payam (location coded to Kasire 1 in Juba County, Central Equatoria State). There were no casualties. No further information.

On 19 February 2026, unidentified armed assailants (coded as unidentified armed group) attacked a group of locals (likely from the Lou Nuer who live in the area) at an unnamed location along the Thol-Lankien Road in Thol Payam (location coded to Thol in Nyirol County, Jonglei State), killing 2 people and injuring 3 others. Additionally, 5 others went missing. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 19 February 2026, unidentified armed assailants (coded as unidentified armed group) shot and killed a police officer under the wildlife section who was walking from his duty station to his house, in Kelengang village in Likuangole Payam (location coded to Likuangole in Pibor County, Jonglei State). Motivation unknown/not reported.

Looting: On 19 February 2026, unidentified armed youth (coded as unidentified communal militia) raided 9 cows from locals in Ngap Payam (location coded to Agngrial in Cueibet County, Lakes State). Victims likely from the Gok Dinka who live in the area.

On 18 February 2026, unidentified armed youth (coded as unidentified communal militia) attacked fishermen at an unnamed location along the Sobat River in Chuil Payam (location coded to Chuil in Nyirol County, Jonglei State), resulting in 2 fatalities. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 18 February 2026, armed youth suspected of being from the Murle community ambushed 2 members of the Lou Nuer community near Chowguar fishing camp in Thol Payam (location coded to Lankien in Nyirol County, Jonglei State), killing both. The victims were traveling to Lankien with their fish when they were attacked. Motivation unknown/not reported.

Looting: On 18 February 2026, unidentified armed assailants (coded as unidentified ethnic militia) raided 30 cows from locals in Thol Payam (Nyirol, Jonglei). Victims likely from the Lou Nuer who live in the area.

On 18 February 2026, for a second day, armed groups (described as Rirnyang and Ying communities of the Jikany Nuer and coded as Jikany Clan Militia) clashed in Ying Boma (Ulang, Upper Nile), resulting in 2 injuries. The incident is connected to past conflicts between the 2 Jikany Nuer communities of Rirnyang and Ying.

On 17 February 2026, armed Bor Dinka youth attacked a Murle businessman in Mogiri Market area (Juba, Central Equatoria), killing him. The incident is linked to the ongoing intercommunal conflict in the Greater Jonglei region.

On 17 February 2026, a clash ensued between two clans (described as the Cienyankok and Cie-nyak subclans of the Padang community of the Gawaar Nuer, coded as Gawaar Clan Militia) in Ghap village, near Wau (Ayod, Jonglei), resulting in 2 fatalities. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 17 February 2026, armed youth suspected of being from the Murle community shot and injured a local chief at his premises in Makuac village (Bor South, Jonglei). 5 armed individuals (likely Bor Dinka who live in the area) who were at the victim's premises shot at the attackers who fled the scene. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 17 February 2026, unidentified armed assailants (coded as unidentified armed group) attacked an SSPDF base in Nokuor village of Budang Payam (location coded to Chotchara 1 in Rubkona County, Unity State). Motivation unknown/not reported. There were no casualties.

On 17 February 2026, a group of armed assailants (described as from Rirnyang village and coded as Jikany Clan Militia) attacked locals in Ying Boma (Ulang, Upper Nile), resulting in 2 fatalities. The incident is connected to past conflicts between the 2 Jikany Nuer communities of Rirnyang and Ying.

On 16 February 2026, a group of youths peacefully protested at a youth center in Buong Payam (location coded to Bunj in Maban County, Upper Nile State), against unnamed grievances. Representatives of the group held a meeting with the county commissioner and presented him with their grievances.

On 16 February 2026, a group of Agwelek forces, who were pursuing Fallata cattle keepers, encountered and clashed with local armed youth (likely Mathloum of the Padang Dinka who live in the area) in Akoka Payam (Baliet, Upper Nile), resulting in 1 fatality from the Agwelek side. Following this incident, necessary unified forces were deployed to the area (means unspecified) to prevent escalation.

On 16 February 2026, suspected members of the Dongjol Dinka community (coded as Dinka ethnic militia) killed a Shilluk community member in Kurbur Lul Bianythiang residential area (location coded to Akoka in Baliet County, Upper Nile State), over land disputes. The incident created tension between the two communities and government security forces were deployed to the area (means unspecified) to de-escalate the situation.

On 16 February 2026, a clash that began as a minor fistfight ensued between members of the Pan lual sub-sub section of the Lou Paher sub-section of the Akop section of the Rek Dinka and those of the Pamuol sub-sub section of the Lou Paher sub-section of the Akop section of the Rek Dinka, in Marial-Lou Payam (Tonj North, Warrap), resulting in 2 fatalities and 6 injuries. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 15 February 2026, suspected Murle killed two people, wounded two people and raided 200 cattle in Pieri payam, coded to Pieri (Uror county, Jonglei state). The victims of the attack are likely Lou Nuer, based on the location. Recently, the Murle and Lou Nuer communities have signed an agreement to reduce and address intercommunal violence between the two communities.

On 15 February 2026, cattle raiders (described as coming from Cueibet county, likely Gok Dinka based on the location) killed a police officer at Apet in Mayom (Rumbek Centre county, Lakes state), after the officer questioned them about the livestock. After killing the officer, they fled, without the goats.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Risk and Strategic Management, Corporation; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 15 February 2026, gunmen dressed in a military uniform (coded as SSPDF) attacked a commercial car driven by a Somali foreign national and wounded 4 people at the Rotriak junction in Budang Payam (Rubkona, Unity). Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 15 February 2026, armed assailants suspected of being members of the Murle community from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area attacked an SSPDF soldier (likely off-duty given the activity he was doing) who had left the barracks and was collecting firewood in Ageer Payam (location coded to Jual in Duk County, Jonglei State), injuring him. Motive unknown/not reported.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; VOA
properties.notes: On 14 February 2026, wounded soldiers and veterans threw stones and clashed with the police using sticks and machetes during a demonstration at the Finance Ministry in Juba (Central Equatoria). The group was demanding payment of medical allowance. The police fired live bullets to the air, while a wounded soldier also fired to the air with his gun. At least 17 people were injured, four are in critical condition.

On 14 February 2026, a group of unidentified armed assailants (coded as unidentified armed group) ambushed 4 SSPDF soldiers, traveling from Owinikybul to Waligo town, near the South Sudan-Uganda border in Pajok Payam (Magwi, Eastern Equatoria), leaving 2 soldiers injured. Motive unknown/not reported.

On 14 February 2026, armed assailants suspected of being from the Murle community from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area attacked Bor Dinka youth who were hunting in Gadiang area (Twic East, Jonglei), killing 11 while 2 others went missing. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 14 February 2026, an SSPDF officer engaged in an exchange of small arms fire with a group of armed assailants (described as coming from Pagor Payam and coded as the Waat sub-section of the Macar section of the Gok Dinka clan), who had raided 27 goats from Apeet Boma (coded separately), west of Apeet (location coded to Malek in Rumbek Centre County, Lakes State), killing two of them. The stolen animals were not recovered.

On 14 February 2026, armed youths suspected of coming from Cueibet County's Pagor Payam (coded as the Waat sub-section of the Macar section of the Gok Dinka clan) attacked Apeet Boma in Malek Payam (location coded to Malek in Rumbek Centre County, Lakes State), where they raided 27 goats. There were no casualties.

On 14 February 2026, unidentified armed assailants shot at three locals traveling on a motorcycle (likely taxi drivers due to context) in Achuol Village (Kuac area) of Nyang Payam (location coded to Nyang in Gogrial East County, Warrap State), injuring 1 person. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 14 February 2026, armed assailants suspected of coming from Jur River County (likely Jur River communal militia who live in the area) carried out a suspected revenge attack in Nyang Payam (Gogrial East, Warrap), where they killed a Rek Dinka community member and injured 2 others.

On 14 February 2026, armed assailants suspected of coming from Jur River County in Western Bahr el Ghazal State (likely Jur River communal militia who live in the area) attacked Kiiric village, near Kirik (Tonj North, Warrap), killing 1 person and injuring 2 others. The attack is described as a retaliation for a past incident (further details unknown/not reported).

On 14 February 2026, an armed clash ensued between suspected NAS militants and cattle keepers from the Bor Dinka community in Jorobe area, approximately 15 kilometers from Mundri Town, (location coded to Karika in Mundri West County, Western Equatoria State), resulting in injuries of an unknown number of people. Motive unknown/not reported.

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; Risk and Strategic Management, Corporation
properties.notes: On 14 February 2026, suspected Murle ambushed and clashed with 9 Dinka Bor men from Bor Town who were hunting in Baidit Payam (location coded to Baidit in Bor South County, Jonglei State), resulting in the death of 3 of the hunters, the injuries of 2 of them while 4 others went missing.

On 13 February 2026, raiders (described as coming from the Gogrial East county and likely the Apuk-Giir section of the Rek Dinka, based on the location) ambushed and clashed with cattle keepers at Mankien payam (Mayom county, Unity state). Two people were killed, two children were abducted, and 50 cattle were raided. The victims of the ambush are likely Nuer, based on the location.

On 13 February 2026, cattle raiders (described as coming from Gogrial East, likely Rek Dinka based on the location) clashed with cattle keepers (likely Nuer, based on the location) at a cattle camp in Mankin in Mayom county (coded to Mayom in Kuerbuone, Unity state). Two people were killed, two children were abducted, and 50 cattle were raided.

On 13 February 2026, 4 unidentified armed youths clashed with members of SPLM-IO at an airstrip in Mathiang town in Malual (Longochuk county, Upper Nile state), after the youths attempted to prevent the aircraft transporting Longechuk county commissioner from Juba from landing. Two youths were wounded and taken to be treated in the hospital. Unidentified politicians, accused of attempting to overthrow the commissioner, are alleged to have mobilized the youths. Four youths were arrested.

On 13 February 2026, unidentified armed individuals (coded as unidentified armed group) attacked a commercial truck, traveling from Kapoeta to Torit, at Lobira junction (location coded to Lobira (Huma boma) in Ikotos County, Eastern Equatoria State), abducting four persons, including the driver. Additionally, locals looted the truck's cargo.

On 13 February 2026, a clash ensued between members of the Bunno Clan of the Toposa and those of the Nyianginyang community (coded as unidentified communal militia) in Lopua area (location coded to Buno (Kotten boma) in Kapoeta East County, Eastern Equatoria State), resulting in 9 injuries and the displacement of approximately 11,000 locals. The clash erupted over grazing land.

On 13 February 2026, armed youths suspected of coming from Warrap's Gogrial East County (likely the Apuk section of the Rek Dinka who live in the area) attempted to raid cattle and clashed with an unidentified communal militia in Akorok Boma in Roc Roc Dong Payam (location coded to Roc Roc Dong in Jur River County, Western Bahr el Ghazal State). 2 people were injured, including a woman.

On 12 February 2026, the Bunno and the Nyianginyang sections of the Toposa clashed using stones and sticks at Lopua in Narus (Kapoeta East county, Eastern Equatoria state), over a Lokisele Lopua water point which is claimed by both sections. Between 9-11 people were critically wounded, and 11,000 people were displaced. A conflicting report states one person might have died, fatality coded as 0.

On 12 February 2026, SSPDF attacked two SPLM-IO military bases, one in the Wunaliet cantonment site in Terekeka county (Central Equatoria state) and one in Tindilo/Tindalo (coded separately). Five people were killed, including 1-2 civilians caught in the crossfire. 3 SPLM-IO were captured, and two civilians (one described as a chief and attributed to the Tindilo event) were abducted. Five fatalities split over two events coded as 2.

On 12 February 2026, SSPDF attacked two SPLM-IO military bases, one in Tindilo/Tindalo (Terekeka county, Central Equatoria) and other in the Wunaliet cantonment site (coded separately). Five people were killed including 1-2 civilians caught in the crossfire. 3 SPLM-IO were captured and two civilians (one described as a chief) abducted. Five fatalities split over two events coded as 3.

On 12 February 2026, suspected members of Murle killed three people and abducted a child at Kaikuiny in Diror (Akobo county, Jonglei state). The victims of the attack are likely Lou Nuer, based on the location. Recently, the Murle and Lou Nuer communities have signed an agreement to reduce and address intercommunal violence between the two communities.

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; Risk and Strategic Management, Corporation; Sudans Post
properties.notes: On 12 February 2026, suspected Murle youth abducted five Lou Nuer girls at Nyale, opposite Dengjok payam, and along the Sobat River (Akobo county, Jonglei state). Local youth pursued the abductors and rescued four abductees (no clashes reported). Recently the Murle and Lou Nuer communities, have signed an agreement to reduce and address intercommunal violence between the two communities.

On 12 February 2026, armed youth from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (likely Murle, based on the area) killed at least three people, abducted two children and critically wounded three people at Yakuach boma in Chuil payam (Nyirol county, Jonglei state), the victims of the attack are likely Lou Nuer, based on the location. Recently, the Murle and Lou Nuer communities have signed an agreement to reduce and address intercommunal violence between the two communities.

On 12 February 2026, suspected members of the Murle killed at least one person at Yedit/Yedid in Barmach (Akobo county, Jonglei state), the victims of the attack are likely Lou Nuer, based on the location. Recently the Murle and Lou Nuer communities, have signed an agreement to reduce and address intercommunal violence between the two communities.

On 12 February 2026, suspected Murle pastoralists killed at least two people and injured 10 others at Thep cattle camp (coded to Akobo in Bilkey, Jonglei state). The victims of the attack are likely Lou Nuer, based on the location. Recently the Murle and Lou Nuer communities, have signed an agreement to reduce and address intercommunal violence between the two communities.

On 12 February 2026, suspected armed Murle shot and killed two Lou Nuer at Dualieth village in Diror (location coded to Diror, Akobo county, Jonglei state). Recently, the Murle and Lou Nuer communities signed an agreement to reduce and address intercommunal violence between the two communities.

On 12 February 2026, local youths attacked the SSPDF barrack at Nasir town in Nasir (Luakpiny/Nasir county, Upper Nile state). The SSPDF responded by shelling the town using heavy weapons and artillery. Two people were killed, six people were wounded, and the market and the compound of an INGO were looted.

On 12 February 2026, suspected armed Murle individuals attacked a Dinka Bor woman who was collecting firewood in a bush in the Malithor area (Bor South, Jonglei), killing her. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 12 February 2026, armed youths suspected of coming from Lakes State (likely Gok Dinka who live in the area) attacked Malual-Amer village in Wunlit Payam (location coded to Wunlit in Tonj East County, Warrap State), killing 15 people and injuring 4 others. The attackers also raided 25 cattle from the victims. Victims are likely members of the Jalwau sub-section of the Kongor section of the Rek Dinka.

On 11 February 2026, the Jarwa/ Jarwau (likely a different spelling of the Jalwau section of the Rek Dinka) and Gok Dinka clashed in Abarkou (Cueibet county, Lakes state) and Makuei (coded separately). One person was killed, and eight people were wounded. One fatality coded to this event.

On 11 February 2026, the Jarwa/ Jarwau (likely a different spelling of the Jalwau section of the Rek Dinka) and Gok Dinka clashed at Makuei (Cueibet county, Lakes state) and Abarkou (coded separately). One person was killed, and eight people were wounded, fatality coded as 0 (one fatality is attributed to Abarkou and coded separately).
