properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Risk and Strategic Management, Corporation; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 11 February 2026, the SSPDF attacked and clashed with armed youths (coded as unidentified armed group) at Dawech Kuanylual Thoan in Nasir (Luakpiny/Nasir county, Upper Nile state), after an SSPDF shot a person four times, injuring him. The clash resulted in 18 fatalities, including 12 SSPDF soldiers, while 11 others were injured, 7 youths and 4 soldiers. Additionally, an unspecified number of people were displaced, and houses and properties were burned and looted.

On 11 February 2026, an unidentified armed assailant shot and killed an SSNPS sergeant (likely off-duty as he was traveling and his duty status was not reported) at an unnamed location while en route to Wunkuel village in Ayod Payam (location coded to Ayod in Ayod County, Jonglei State). Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 11 February 2026, suspected armed Murle individuals ambushed civilians, travelling along the road between Lankien and Yakuach, in Chuil Payam (location coded to Chuil in Nyirol County, Jonglei State), killing 2 children and injuring 2 cattle keepers. The assailants also abducted 3 children. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 11 February 2026, a clash ensued between members of the Panyar section of the Agar Dinka and the Rek Dinka in Maual Amel, near Tiap Tiap (Cueibet, Lakes), resulting in 10 fatalities and 22 injuries. Motivation unknown/not reported. The incident also led to the displacement of an unknown number of locals.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Risk and Strategic Management, Corporation
properties.notes: On 10 February 2026, and for the second consecutive day, armed youths (described as being from Merial-Wau and likely Jur, based on the location) ambushed and clashed with a police convoy and a security escort at Tharkueng checkpoint in Wau Bai (Jur River county, Western Bahr el Ghazal state), resulting in 3 injuries. Additionally, three of the community members were also arrested.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Risk and Strategic Management, Corporation; The City Review (South Sudan); VOA
properties.notes: On 10 February 2026, SSPDF attacked 3 youths who were fishing at Torjuoch near Wech Yaradiw barracks in Nasir (Luakpiny/Nasir county, Upper Nile state), killing 1 and injuring 2 others. The incident created tension between the military and locals.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 9 February 2026, unidentified gunmen ambushed and fired at a WFP convoy escorted by UN peacekeepers in the Macdit area of Anyidi (Bor South county, Jonglei state). UNMISS peacekeepers returned fire, repelling the attackers. There were no fatalities.

On 9 February 2026, and for two days, armed youths (described as being from Merial-Wau and likely Jur, based on the location) ambushed a police convoy at a Tharkueng checkpoint in Wau Bai (Jur River county, Western Bahr el Ghazal state). There were no fatalities.

Change to armed group: On 9 February 2026, 792 people defected from the SPLM-IO and the National Congress Party into the SPLM party and subsequently into SSPDF and were received at Central Equatoria state (location coded to Juba).

On 8 February 2026, five boys (described as internally displaced persons from Pigi and Baliet counties) beat and threw a member of the host community into the river which resulted in his death at an unspecified location in Melut (Upper Nile state). They were arrested. The incident has created tension between the IDPs and the host community, and the host community harassed and demanded that the IDPs return to their place of origin.

On 8 February 2026, an armed clash ensued between members of the Kurenen and Guzule age-sets of the Murle in Likuangole Payam (Pibor, Jonglei), leaving 3 Guzules dead and 1 injured. The clash erupted after some Guzule members were accused of sexually assaulting 2 Kurenen females along the Likuangole-Pibor Road.

On 8 February 2026, armed individuals suspected of coming from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (likely Murle who lives in the area) attacked Werkok Village in Makuac Payam (Bor South, Jonglei), injuring 1 person and abducting 9 elderly females (likely from the Deer sub-section of the Bor Dinka who lives in the area). Makuac youth pursued the perpetrators but no interactions were reported. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 8 February 2026, suspected Toposa youth from Eastern Equatoria State's Kapoeta North County attacked a Kurenen age-set member of the Murle in Meer Village of Gumuruk Payam (location coded to Gumuruk in Pibor County, Jonglei State), injuring him. Motive unknown/not reported.

On 8 February 2026, armed individuals suspected of being members of the Rek section of the Dinka community from Warrap State's Tonj South County ambushed cattle traders from the Apak clan of the Atuot community from Alauk-luak Payam in Lakes State's Yirol West County, who were transporting cattle from Tonj to Rumbek, in Maleng-gok Village (location coded to Cueibet in Cueibet County, Lakes State), seriously injuring 1 trader. The perpetrators stole approximately 50 cattle.

On 8 February 2026, a group of refugees attempted to forcefully grab clothes from aid workers and disrupted the distribution of non-food items by INGO personnel in Wedweil area of Gomjuer East Payam (Aweil West, Northern Bahr el Ghazal). Police in the area responded and contained the situation. There were no casualties. Motivation unknown/not reported.

Property destruction: Around 7 February 2026 (as reported), pastoralists (described as being from Jonglei and the Bahr el Ghazal and likely Dinka, based on the locations) burned a local chief and sub-chief houses and destroyed unspecified numbers of farms at an unspecified location in Tore payam, coded to Tore (Yei county, Central Equatoria state).

On 7 February 2026, members of the Apuk section of the Rek Dinka shot and killed three members of the Marial Lou section of the Rek Dinka at a residential area of the eastern bank at Wau Town in Wau North (Wau county, Western Bahr el Ghazal state). The incident is said to be connected to the ongoing conflict between the Gogrial East and the Jur River communities.

On 7 February 2026, unidentified armed assailants ambushed a convoy, traveling from Unity State to Twic County, that SSPDF officers were escorting in Aweng (Twic, Warrap) resulting in a response by the troops (no interactions reported). Motivation unknown/not reported. The officers arrested some of the attackers and took them to Turalei for investigations. Casualties unknown.
On 7 February 2026, Lou Nuer youths ambushed a member of the Murle community, traveling from Akobo to Burmath, in Mer, near Ulali (Akobo, Jonglei), killing him. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 7 February 2026, armed youth from the Gok section of the Dinka from Malou-Pech Payam of Cueibet County in Lakes State attacked a man from Aguka Boma, who was traveling to Tonj Town, in an unnamed area (location coded to Warrap Town in Tonj North County, Warrap State), killing him. Motivation unknown/not reported.

Looting: On 7 February 2026, suspected armed youth from Lakes State's Cueibet County (likely Gok Dinka who lives in the area) raided an unspecified number of cattle in Manyang-Ngok Payam (Tonj South, Warrap). Victims are likely from the Thony section of the Rek Dinka who lives in the area. There were no casualties.

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 6 February 2026, Toposa youth attacked two individuals in the Ngauro/Lauru area of Nauro (Budi county, Eastern Equatoria state), as an act of revenge (no further details on the incident that provoked the revenge attack). Conflicting reports indicate that the individuals either sustained injuries and were treated at a hospital or were killed, fatalities coded as 0.

On 6 February 2026, armed youths suspected of being from the Murle community abducted two women who were collecting firewood from a bush in Poktap Village, Ageer Payam (location coded to Jual in Duk County, Jonglei State). The perpetrators also stole 45 cattle in the area.

On 6 February 2026, landgrabbers suspected to be from the Dinka community clashed with Bari youths on their farmland in Bori Boma, near Lado (Juba, Central Equatoria), prompting mobilization by the latter who pushed the attackers towards the Khor-Jamus River. This led SSPDF to intervene (means unspecified), resulting in 1 fatality from the Dinka side and 2 injuries on the Bari side while eight people were arrested.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan); Xinhua
properties.notes: On 5 February 2026, armed members of the Apuk section of the Rek Dinka attacked and clashed with the police at a police station in Tharkueng in Wau Bai (Jur River county, Western Bahr el Ghazal state). Over 20 people were killed including, a high-ranking police officer, a military police officer and national security officers (coded as military intelligence), and an unspecified number of houses and shops were burned.

On 5 February 2026, unknown armed assailants attacked a commercial vehicle, traveling along the Juba-Yei Road, in Ganji Payam (Juba, Central Equatoria), killing 1 female passenger, and injuring 5 other individuals, including the driver. Motivation unknown/not reported. Following the incident, SSPDF officers responded and pursued the perpetrators (means unspecified).

properties.source: Sudans Post; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 4 February 2026, members of Lou Nuer pursued and clashed with members of Murle at an unspecified location in Akobo county (coded to Akobo in Bilkey, Jonglei state) following the Thep cattle camp clash (coded separately). At least 3,452 cattle were recovered, and four children were rescued. Casualties unknown.

On 4 February 2026, unidentified assailants ambushed Government Security Forces (likely military) along the Moje-Lainya Road (location coded to Lainya in Lainya County, Central Equatoria State), killing 4. Motivation unknown/not reported. The incident led to the displacement of locals to Lainya Primary School and Bereka Church.

On 4 February 2026, suspected youth from the Ngok section of the Dinka from Abyei Administrative Area attacked a police officer escorting commercial vehicles from Mayen-Abun to Nyin-Deng Ayuel village at Wunrok area in Wunrok Payam (Twic, Warrap), where they shot and killed him. The attackers noted that the officer might have entered their area of responsibility the night before.

On 4 February 2026, suspected Murle youth attempted a cattle raid in Wechkol Village in Payai Payam (location coded to Faiyai in Uror County, Jonglei State). During the incident, the attackers shot and injured a 61-year-old cattle herder (likely a member of the Gun sub-section of the Bong section of the Lou Nuer who lives in the area) and carted away his firearm. The victim was taken to a health facility in Yuai but succumbed to the injuries the next day.

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 4 February 2026, Toposa youth from Kapoeta South County attacked and killed a Didinga woman in Lotukei Village (Budi, Eastern Equatoria), as an act of revenge following a 25 January 2026 incident at Takiyang gold mine that left 5 Toposa members dead (coded separately).

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; Risk and Strategic Management, Corporation; Sudans Post; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 4 February 2026, armed members of Murle clashed with members of Lou Nuer at Thep cattle camp in Buong Payam (location coded to Buong in Akobo County, Jonglei State), at least 2 people were killed, and 10 people were wounded. The attackers are suspected of being opposed to a peace dialogue between the Lou Nuer and Murle communities.

On 3 February 2026, a member of Kurenen age set of the Murle ambushed a group of members of the Guzule age set of the Murle at a location approximately 8 kilometers north of Likuangole (location coded to Likuangole in Pibor County, Jonglei), resulting in 3 fatalities, all Guzules. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 3 February 2026, unidentified individuals (coded as unidentified communal militia as dispute over bridge is linked to local communities) threw a hand grenade at the Wau Mayor's residence in Wau Town (Wau, Western Bahr el Ghazal), injuring a minor. The motive for the attack is linked to the naming of the Clement Mboro bridge.

On 2 February 2026, attackers suspected of coming from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (likely Murle, who lives in the area) killed a cattle keeper and raided 500 cattle at Duk Padiet in (Duk county, Jonglei state).

On 1 February 2026, attackers suspected of coming from Budi county attacked gold miners and killed at least eight people including three women (three wounded people died of their injuries later) and critically wounded three people at the Namorunyang gold mining area in Longeleya (Kapoeta South county, Eastern Equatoria state).

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; Risk and Strategic Management, Corporation; The City Review (South Sudan)
properties.notes: On 1 February 2026, four armed men, two suspected of being senior SPLA-IO officers, attacked and shot at the newly appointed State Minister of Agriculture (also from the SPLM-IO) at his house in the New site suburb at Wau in Wau North (Wau county, Western Bahr el Ghazal state). The Minister ran, unhurt, to the police station. A woman and a girl were wounded during the incident.

On 1 February 2026, armed youth suspected of coming from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (likely Murle, who lives in the area) attacked and raided an unspecified number of cattle at Panaru cattle camp, near Duk Padiet (Duk, Jonglei). Victims are likely from the Hol clan of the Dinka who lives in the area. Local youth pursued the attackers and recovered the stolen animals (no interactions reported). There were no casualties.

On 1 February 2026, suspected members of the Rek Dinka community from Tonj East County attacked members of the Panyar section of the Gok Dinka at Barjiek cattle camp, near Citcok (Cueibet, Lakes), killing 5, including a woman, and injuring 2 others. The incident was a revenge act from a past incident (further details unknown/not reported).

Looting: On 1 February 2026, suspected armed youth described as being members of the Akok-Deng Achuil community of Tonj East County (coded as unidentified communal militia) raided at least 60 cattle at Buul cattle camp, near Manyang-Ngok (Tonj South, Warrap). Victims are likely members of the Thony section of the Rek Dinka. There were no casualties.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Sudans Post; Xinhua
properties.notes: On 31 January 2026, pastoralists from the Luanyjang/Luach Jang Dinka clashed with the Pakam section of the Agar Dinka at cattle camps in Aloor payam (Rumbek North county, Lakes state). According to two sources, at least 38 people were killed, 34 people were wounded, and an unspecified number of houses were burned. The Warrap state minister of information accused youth from the Panyijiar county and the Gok Dinka of being involved.

Around 31 January 2026 (week of), members of wildlife protection services clashed with an unknown armed group at an unspecified location in Kajo Keji county (location coded to Kajo-Keji in Lire, Central Equatoria state). One suspect was arrested. Casualties unknown.

On 31 January 2026, armed men shot and killed a senior police officer (assumed off duty) at his residence in Lokojo village (location coded to Kajo-Keji in Lire, Kajo Keji county, Central Equatoria state), the reason for the attack is unknown. The local authority arrested some of the suspects.

On 31 January 2026, armed men suspected of coming from Mayom county (likely Bul Nuer, who lives in the county) shot and killed a cattle keeper and raided an unspecified number of cattle at Akattuok village in Aweng (Twic county, Warrap state). The raided cattle were recovered.

On 31 January 2026, armed youth from the Pakam section of Agar Dinka from Rumbek North County attempted to raid cattle from members of the Luach Jang Dinka at Mabor Adel cattle camp in Makuac (location coded to Makwoich in Tonj East County, Warrap State) resulting in an armed engagement that left 20 people dead and 130 others injured. The incident created tension in the area.

On 31 January 2026, a family-related disagreement resulted in an armed clash between members of the Yar section of the Rek Dinka and another group described as from the Apuk-Jokwier community (coded as unidentified communal militia) in Wanhalel area, near Wanh Alet (Tonj South, Warrap), resulting in 2 fatalities, both from Wath-Alel Payam, and 5 injuries.

On 31 January 2026, suspected armed Murle youth shot and injured a member of the Long sub-section of the Gawaar Nuer, traveling between Kuachdeng and Ayod Town, in Kuach-deng Payam (location coded to Pagong in Ayod County, Jonglei State). Motivation unknown/not reported.

Looting: On 30 January 2026, armed youth suspected of coming from Panyijiar County (likely to be Nuer who live in the area) raided 13 cows from local cattle keepers of the Ciec section of the Dinka in Nyang (Yirol East, Lakes). Following the incident, local cattle keepers and organized security forces pursued the attackers but did not recover the stolen animals (no interactions reported).

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Miraya; Radio Tamazuj; Sudans Post; VOA
properties.notes: On 29 January 2026, SPLA-IO soldiers ambushed the Unity State governor's convoy and clashed with SSPDF at the SPLA-IO base Barkuol Ngol in Nyuel Nyuel (Rubkona county, Unity state). At least 6 people were killed, two senior military officers were wounded, and the SPLA-IO withdrew from the base, both parties in conflict accused each other of the attack. A conflicting report stated 18 SSPDF people were killed, an unspecified number of people were displaced and raped, and an unspecified number of cattle and other valuables were looted.

On 29 January 2026, suspected SSPDF and Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition clashed in Barkur area of Budang (location coded to Chotchara 1 in Rubkona County, Unity State), resulting in 2 fatalities and 2 injuries. Additionally, 4 people were abducted and taken to Mayom County. At the same time, 2 others remained at the SSPDF HQ in Rubkona Town while 2 opposition soldiers were taken to an unknown location by the SSPDF. At least 1000 livestock and assorted food items belonging to civilians were looted by forces allied to the SSPDF. No further information.

Property destruction: On 29 January 2026, suspected armed youth from Tonj East County (likely from the Luach-Jang section of the Dinka who live in the area) attacked Gok Dinka and set fire to an unspecified number of houses in Abar-kou village, near Citcok (Cueibet, Lakes). Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 29 January 2026, youth suspected to be from the Murle community attacked Tanyang Village (Akobo, Jonglei), leaving an unspecified number of casualties. Additionally, the attackers set fire to several houses in the area causing displacement of an unknown number of civilians.

On 28 January 2026, suspected armed Murle youth from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area shot and killed 3 people (likely from the Gawaar section of the Nuer who live in the area) in Pajiek Payam (location coded to Fankur in Ayod County, Jonglei State). Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 28 January 2026, a member of the Bothonya age set of the Murle ethnic group shot and killed 2 individuals from the Lango age set of the Murle ethnic group in Jebel Boma Town (location coded to Boma in Pibor County, Jonglei State) following a disagreement. Members of the Lango age set group responded to the incident by killing the attacker. Additionally, an SSPDF soldier was injured under unclear circumstances.
On 28 January 2026, cattle keepers from the Bor section of the Dinka abducted a teenager from the Moru community in Karika Village (Mundri West, Western Equatoria). Motivation unknown/not reported.
Looting: On 27 January 2026, suspected armed Murle youth raided 24 cattle from Kuony-Kew Boma, near Walgak (Akobo, Jonglei).

On 27 January 2026, suspected NAS ambushed two boda-boda motorcyclists in Mitica area of Assole Boma (location coded to Lasu in Yei County, Central Equatoria State). The motorcyclists escaped unhurt but their motorcycles were taken by NAS towards South Sudan's border with the DR Congo. Motivation unknown/not reported. Following the incident, SSPDF soldiers pursued NAS along the border but outcome unknown/not reported.

On 27 January 2026, unidentified armed assailants ambushed a convoy of vehicles in Ajakkuac Payam (Twic, Warrap), killing 2 drivers, both foreign nationals, while another person was injured. Motive unknown/not reported.

On 26 January 2026, an armed group suspected of coming from northern Panyijiar county (likely Nyuong Nuer, who lives in the county) attacked and clashed with a group (likely Nuer, based on the location) at a funeral house in Panyijiar (Panyijiar county, Unity state), in what is described as a revenge incident. One person was killed, 2-3 people were wounded and one attacker was arrested.

On 26 January 2026, armed men suspected of coming from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (likely Murle, who live in the area) killed a woman, abducted two women and a child, and gun-wounded four people at Guer (Ayod county, Jonglei state). The Pibor minister of information denied the accusation. Two women and a child were released later.

On 26 January 2026, an unidentified group (described as cattle raiders) kidnapped and killed a youth (IDP) leader at an unspecified location in Twic East county (location coded to Panyagor in Kongor, Jonglei state), the reason for the attack is unknown.

Weapons seizure: On 26 January 2026, the SSPDF confiscated over 150 different types of weapons, including 137 Kalanchikosv, 50 other types of guns, and an unspecified number of bullet magazines from unauthorized persons at Wau in Wau North (Wau county, Western Bahr el Ghazal state).

On 26 January 2026, suspected armed Murle youth ambushed a group of females from the Lou section of the Nuer at Payoy area near Pathai (Uror, Jonglei), killing 1, injuring 2 others, and abducting 2 others, including a teenager. Motivation unknown/not reported. Following the incident, local youths pursued the perpetrators and rescued the abducted victims (no interactions reported).

On 25 January 2026, armed raiders suspected to be from the Gok section of the Dinka and local cattle keepers (likely Luach-Jang section of the Dinka) clashed at Agobic cattle camp (location coded to Makwoich in Tonj East County, Warrap State), resulting in 4 fatalities from both sides. Additionally, an unspecified number of cattle were stolen during the incident.

On 25 January 2026, youth from Cueibet County (likely Gok section of the Dinka who live in the area) and Manyang Ngok youth (likely from the Thony section of the Rek Dinka who live in the area) clashed at Aliap Thony cattle camp, near Manyang-Ngok (Tonj South, Warrap), resulting in 2 fatalities. The clash led to the recovery of stolen cattle following the intervention of youths from Tonj South County.

On 25 January 2026, suspected armed Didinga from Budi County attacked people at a mining area in Lorobola village, Pwata payam (location coded to Kapoeta in Kapoeta South County, Eastern Equatoria State), killing 5 and injuring 3 others. Motivation unknown/not reported.

properties.location: UN House/UN Protection of Civilians Site
properties.notes: On 25 January 2026, a clash ensued between members of the Dok section of the Nuer and the Jikany section of the Nuer at the PoC Camp 3 (UN House/UN Protection of Civilians Site, Juba, Central Equatoria), resulting in 3 injuries, including the camp chairman. The Dok Nuer were responding to a 24 January 2026 incident (coded separately) that left two people dead. SSNPS officers responded to the incident (means unspecified), calmed the situation, and arrested a few individuals linked to the clash. Additionally, tension remained high at the camp.

Change to armed group: Around 24 January 2026 (week of), five senior military officers and 1,500 soldiers defected from SPLM-IO and SSOA into SSPDF and subsequently into the SPLM party at Bentiu (Rubkona county, Unity state), citing the opposition's inability to become a leading party.
On 24 January 2026, protesters marched in the streets of Turalei (Twic county, Warrap state) to denounce the presidential decree to expel the spiritual leader, Gai Machiek, from Ajak Kuac payam.

On 24 January 2026, armed raiders attacked and clashed with cattle keepers at Pagew village in Uror county (location coded to Pim-piny, Jonglei state). Three people were killed, one person was severely wounded, and unspecified numbers of cattle were raided (the attackers and the victims of the attack are likely Lou Nuer, who lives in the county).

On 24 January 2026, unidentified assailants (coded as unidentified armed group) attacked and injured a local chief at his residence in Litoba Boma (location coded to Kiri in Kajo Keji County, Central Equatoria State). Motivation unknown/not reported. The incident caused panic in the area resulting in the displacement of residents, some towards neighboring Uganda while others settled near the border.

properties.location: UN House/UN Protection of Civilians Site
properties.notes: On 24 January 2026, members of the Dok section of the Nuer clashed with their Jikany section of Nuer at the PoC Camp 3 (UN House/UN Protection of Civilians Site, Juba, Central Equatoria) over a disagreement arising from a social-related issue. The groups used blunt weapons, resulting in 2 fatalities.

On 24 January 2026, porters employed by a UN agency protested at the Malakal humanitarian hub (Malakal County, Upper Nile State), against a pay dispute. Despite a conversation with their supervisor to address their demands, the efforts were futile, thus temporarily impacting operations at the agency's logistics warehouses.

On 23 January 2026, raiders suspected of coming from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (likely Murle, who live in the area) attacked and killed at least three people, wounded one person and raided 2,500 cattle at a cattle camp in Looch between Duk Pagak and Padiet payam (Duk county, Jonglei state).

On 23 January 2026, attackers killed a trader at an unspecified location in Mankien (Mayom county, Unity state) in what is described as a revenge incident. One perpetrator was arrested (the attackers and the victim of the attack are likely Bul Nuer, who lives in the county).

On 23 January 2026, unidentified attackers killed at least 15 people, including women and children, and wounded seven people traveling on a commercial car from Gambella to Akobo near the Ethiopia and South Sudan border (location coded to Akobo in Bilkey, Jonglei state). The wounded were treated at the hospital.

On 23 January 2026, a clash ensued between members of the Atuot community and those of the Pakam section of the Agar Dinka from the IDP camp, at the new residential area in Munuki (Juba, Central Equatoria). Tensions between the two communities arose after Pakam Dinka youth accidentally killed a member of the Achiek community leading to the clash. Casualties unknown.
Looting: On 22 January 2026, unidentified cattle raiders raided over 20 cattle from Madwany village in Ramula boma (location coded to Ikotos, Eastern Equatoria state).

On 22 January 2026, armed cattle raiders shot and killed a motorcycle taxi (boda-boda) rider and a passenger along Ramula-Ikotos Road in Ikotos county (location coded to Ikotos, Eastern Equatoria state) the reason for the attack is unknown.

On 22 January 2026, armed Murle youth from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area attacked a group of Lou Nuer youth who were hunting in Kaikuiny (Akobo, Jonglei), leaving 1 person dead and another injured. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 22 January 2026, a clash ensued between a group of cattle keepers from the Akeer section of the Aliab Dinka community (coded as Aliab Clan Militia) over a disagreement on a grazing land in Tut Tom (Awerial, Lakes). Government security forces (likely SSPDF due to nature of incident) responded (means unspecified) and calmed the situation. There were no casualties.

On 22 January 2026, unidentified armed individuals (coded as unidentified armed group) attacked an off-duty SSPDF soldier at his residence in Tambura (Tambura, Western Equatoria). The attackers fired 5 rounds of small arms fire at the officer, but no injuries were incurred. Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 21 January 2026, suspected Woroworo youths of Isohe payam (coded as UAG) shot and killed a man from Cahari payam at Isohe in Lomohidang North (Ikotos county, Eastern Equatoria state) the reason for the attack is unknown. The incident created tension between communities from the two payams.

On 20 January 2026, attackers suspected of coming from Pibor (likely Murle, who live in the county) ambushed and killed two traders between Kut-Budi and Tedo areas (location coded to Pibor in Jonglei state). The reason for the attack is unknown.

On 20 January 2026, unidentified armed youths (coded as unidentified communal militia) clashed with security officers (coded as police officers) as the youth attempted to raid cattle on the outskirts of Abiemnhom town (Abiemnhom, Unity), resulting in 3 youth deaths and 2 injuries incurred by the officers.

On 20 January 2026, unidentified armed individuals ambushed and killed two traders, transporting goods from neighboring Gambella region of Ethiopia, in Kutnguech along the Pochalla-Pibor Road (Pochalla, Jonglei). Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 20 January 2026, suspected armed raiders from Warrap State (coded as unidentified communal militia) attacked Pub (Mayom, Unity), killing one person and raiding an unspecified number of cattle (victims are likely Bul Nuer, who live in the area). Local youth pursued the attackers, but did not recover the stolen animals.

On 19 January 2026, a skirmish erupted between two communities of Buya/Boya in Lotukei (Budi, Eastern Equatoria), resulting in the death of a primary school teacher. Motivation unknown/not reported. Security forces intervened (means unspecified) and calmed the situation.

On 19 January 2026, suspected armed Nuer youth clashed with Apuk sub-sub-section of the Pacdoch sub-section of the Akop section of the Rek Dinka (described as Apuk youth) in Akop (Tonj North, Warrap), resulting in 4 fatalities and 7 injuries. The reasons for the clash are unknown.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Risk and Strategic Management, Corporation
properties.notes: On 19 January 2026, gunmen suspected of coming from Abyei (likely Ngok Dinka who lives in the area) allied with members of Nuer attacked members of the Twic Dinka community at Anyiel Kuac boma in Turalei (Twic county, Warrap state), killing 3 people while an unspecified number of others were injured. The attackers also burned a healthcare facility, a school, and government buildings, looted valuables, and raided unspecified numbers of cattle.

On 18 January 2026, suspected members of NAS killed two people, including a soldier (assumed off-duty), wounded two people, and burned a truck at Dindiro, Litoba boma in Kangepo l payam (location coded to Kiri in Kajo Keji county, Central Equatoria state). The reason for the attack is unknown. The NAS spokesperson denied the accusation.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Risk and Strategic Management, Corporation
properties.notes: On 18 January 2026, armed raiders suspected of coming from Tonj North county (likely Rek Dinka who lives in the county) killed 1 - 15 people, shot and wounded 2 others, and raided 1,500 cattle at a cattle camp belonging to the Bul Nuer community in Madul village in Riak (Mayom county, Unity state). Fatalities coded as 1.

On 18 January 2026, armed youth from the Apuk section of the Rek Dinka based in Gogrial East County attacked members of the Marial Bai Dinka community killing 7 people, including a military officer (likely off-duty as the officer was at his house), injuring 5 others and burning an unspecified number of houses at Achoum-Choum in Jur River county (location coded Acongcong in Marial Bai, Western Bahr el Ghazal state). The attackers also stole 100 cows and an unspecified number of people were displaced.

On 18 January 2026, six suspected armed Murle youth abducted two children of the Lopit Community in Bulek Boma (location coded to Lafon in Lafon County, Eastern Equatoria State). Motivation unknown/not reported. Local youth unsuccessfully pursued the attackers.

On 18 January 2026, Lango age-set members of the Murle clashed with the Kurenen members of the Murle in Manybicha Village (location coded to Verteth in Pibor County, Jonglei State), leaving one Kurenen dead. The reasons for the clash are unknown. Local authorities responded (means unspecified) and normalcy resumed.

On 18 January 2026, 5 armed assailants clashed with SSPDF soldiers after trying to ambush a convoy of a UN agency and commercial vehicles traveling along the Abiemnhom-Mayom Road in Pup (location coded to Abiemnhom in Abiemnhom County, Unity State). The convoy later proceeded safely and there were no casualties.

On 18 January 2026, suspected armed Murle youth attacked Bor Dinka community members in Gakyuom, near Makuac (Bor South, Jonglei). Motivation unknown/not reported. The attackers also abducted a minor. Local Bor Dinka youth pursued the attackers but were unsuccessful. Casualties unknown.

Change to armed group: Around 17 January 2026 (week of), 45 commanders and 120 soldiers defected from SSOA into the SPLM-In Kitgweng in Jonglei state (location coded to Akobo in Bilkey), due to the government's lack of commitment to integrating opposition forces into the Joint forces.
On 17 January 2026, an unidentified armed individual shot and killed an off-duty police officer at his residence in Jebel area, near Rejaf (Juba, Central Equatoria). Motivation unknown/not reported.

On 17 January 2026, an armed individual from the Noi sub-section of the Kuacthii section of the Rek Dinka randomly opened fire at people during a cattle-related dispute at Wun-Khec cattle camp, near Awul (Tonj North, Warrap), injuring one person. Police arrested the perpetrator.

Property destruction: On 17 January 2026, armed youth suspected to be from Jur River County of Western Bahr el Ghazal State (coded as unidentified communal militia) set on fire several houses in Gierich Village of the Manyang contested area (location coded to Gogrial, Gogrial West County, Warrap State). The incident is suspected to be fueled by ongoing land disputes in the area. There were no casualties.

properties.source: Radio Tamazuj; Risk and Strategic Management, Corporation
properties.notes: On 17 January 2026, members of the Lith subsection of the Pakam section of the Agar Dinka clashed at a cattle camp in Pook village in Mayen Payam (location coded to Mayen in Rumbek North County, Lakes State) over a cattle-related dispute. 7 people were shot, wounded, and treated at a hospital.
On 16 January 2026, suspected armed Murle youth attacked and killed a Lou Nuer community member in Pathai (Uror, Jonglei). Motivation unknown/not reported.

Looting: Around 15 January 2026 (month of), youths from Mayom County (coded as Bul Nuer) raided Rubkona (Unity state), seizing 40 sheep. The victims of this raid are likely the Leek Nuer community, predominantly residing in Rubkona.
On 15 January 2026, unidentified gunmen shot and killed a traditional chief of the Payuel payam at his residence in Poktap town in Payuel (Duk county, Jonglei state) in a cattle raid attempt.

On 15 January 2026, unidentified armed assailants ambushed a convoy of 4 commercial trucks, contracted by a UNMISS contractor to transport fuel to Bentiu, between Abienmhom and Awila in Panyang, near Abiemnhom (Abiemnhom, Unity), leaving 1 person dead and another injured. The victims were both Somali foreign nationals and the motive for the attack is unknown.

properties.location: Malakal UNMISS Protection of Civilians site
properties.notes: On 15 January 2026, approximately 50 women IDPs protested against poor conditions of WASH facilities at the Malakal UNMISS Protection of Civilians site (Malakal, Upper Nile). Calm later returned to the area after a UN agency managing the site agreed to address the protesters' issues.

On 15 January 2026, unidentified armed assailants ambushed and killed a police officer and a community member in Paloc (Rumbek East, Lakes), for unknown reasons. The deceased were traveling from Amongping Payam to a cattle camp in Paloch when they were attacked.

On 15 January 2026, suspected Murle youth attacked 3 Ethiopian foreign nationals in Polet, along the Ethiopian-South Sudan border, near Alali (Akobo, Jonglei). Motivation unknown/not reported. The incident left one person dead and another injured, while one was abducted.

On 15 January 2026, suspected members of the Mor section of the Lou Nuer from Akobo County attacked a member of the Cie-Chuil section of the same Lou Nuer community (coded as Lou Nuer) at his residence in Guangchat (Uror, Jonglei), killing him. The incident is suspected to be a revenge attack (further details unknown/not reported).

Looting: On 15 January 2026, suspected armed Turkana youth from Kenya raided at least 200 cattle from the Toposa community at Mugil hills, along the South Sudan-Kenya border, in Natinga (location coded to New Site, Kapoeta East County, Eastern Equatoria State). Toposa youth pursued the attackers attempting to recover the stolen animals but failed (no interaction was reported). There were no fatalities.

Property destruction: On 15 January 2026, suspected individuals from the Jalwau section of the Rek Dinka from Tonj East County set fire to around 300 houses owned by members of the Panyar sub-section of the Macr section of the Gok Dinka in Tiap Tiap (Cueibet, Lakes). Motivation unknown/not reported. Government security personnel were deployed to the area following the incident due to heightened tensions. There were no casualties.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Tamazuj; Sudans Post
properties.notes: On 14 January 2026, suspected armed youth from the Abyei Administrative area (likely Ngok Dinka who lives in the area) shot and killed one person, and tortured and abducted three women fishing along Kiir River in Rayen village in Twic county (location coded to Turalei, Warrap state). The abductees were released later. A conflicting report stated Twic Dinka and the forces of Gai Machiek as perpetrators.
Looting: On 14 January 2026, armed men suspected of coming from Greater Pibor (likely Murle, who live in the area) raided 76 cattle from cattle keepers at Walgak (Akobo county, Jonglei state).

On 14 January 2026, armed youth from the Padang Dinka clan ambushed a group of male refugees, traveling from Yida via Gumriak, Ajuong to Thok Refugee Camp, in Jam Jang (Panriang, Unity). The attackers shot and injured one of the refugees and then stole assorted personal items from them.

On 14 January 2026, armed members of the Leer subsection of the Kuachtii section of the Rek Dinka community clashed with their counterparts from the Nyang Section of the Rek Dinka due to disputes over the Toch swampy area in Pagol (Tonj North, Warrap), resulting in 7 fatalities. The incident created tension between the 2 sections.

On 13 January 2026, armed youth suspected of coming from Panyijiar county (likely to be Nuer, who lives in the area) killed two people, including an SSPDF, and shot and wounded two people traveling on a motorbike (taxi operators) to Luel village along Paloch-Amongpiny road at Kuel-Malony (location coded to Amongpiny, Rumbek Centre county, Lakes state). The SSPDF is described as being from the wounded heroes faction and hence off-duty.

On 13 January 2026, approximately 60 teachers protested in front of the UNMISS Aweil Field Office compound in Aweil Town (Aweil West, Northern Bahr el Ghazal) against the alleged reduction of their salaries by the government and the arrest of three teachers during a similar protest on 12 January 2026 (coded separately). The protesters dispersed later after handing over a petition to the UNMISS representative.

Looting: On 13 January 2026, armed youth from the Aguok section of the Rek Dinka community raided 200 goats and set on fire an unknown number of houses belonging to members of the Kuach section of the Rek Dinka community in Wundok and Akaach villages (locations coded to Kuajok in Gogrial West County, Warrap State). The motive for the attack is due to prior land disputes between the two sections. There were no casualties. 200 goats were stolen.

On 12 January 2026, an SSPDF soldier in a military uniform entered and indiscriminately shot at the UNMISS sentry post and other installations in the UNIMIS base at the Juba Na Bari/Tongping area in Northern Bari (Juba county, Central Equatoria state), the motivation is unknown/not reported. The United Nations peacekeepers shot and killed the shooter.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Miraya; Sudans Post
properties.notes: On 12 January 2026, teachers held a demonstration in Aweil (Aweil West county, Northern Bahr el Ghazal state) against an alleged deduction of their salaries. Rioters pelted stones at military police officers, injuring some of them, and vandalized the Ministry of General Education office. Police responded by beating demonstrators, resulting in at least 30 injuries, and arresting between 27 to 300 teachers. Demonstrators denied allegations of vandalism. Extent of injuries unknown/not reported.

properties.location: UN House/UN Protection of Civilians Site
properties.notes: On 12 January 2026, rioters from the Nuer community clashed with Mundari members near the IDP Camp 3 in Juba (location coded to UN House/UN Protection of Civilians Site in Juba County, Central Equatoria State). Two Nuer were injured. The clash was prompted after Nuer attacked and injured a Mundari female (motivation unknown/not reported). Following this, leaders of both communities at the camp met to mediate peace between the two groups.
On 12 January 2026, a member of the Kongor sub-section of the Akop section of the Rek Dinka shot and killed a local in Aliek (Tonj North, Warrap) over a cattle-related dispute.

On 12 January 2026, members from the Yanyjiok sub-section of the Mor section of the Lou Nuer clan (described as Cie-Jang Gai) ambushed, shot, and killed a member from the same sub-section of the Lou Nuer clan (described as Cie-Yanyjiok) in Walgak (Akobo, Jonglei). The victim was targeted after attending a court session and the incident is alleged to be a revenge attack.

On 11 January 2026, suspected Kurenen age set of the Murle shot and killed 2 people, a local national INGO staff member and another local (likely Murle due to the location of the incident), in Likuangole (Pibor, Jonglei). The reason for the attack is unknown/not reported.

On 11 January 2026, armed youth suspected to be from the Pakam section of the Agar Dinka from Rumbek North County abducted a 16-year-old boy and raided 76 cattle from the Rek Dinka Community at Wun-Ayot cattle camp in Makuac (location coded to Majak Tat in Tonj East County, Warrap State).

Displacement: Around 10 January 2026 (as reported), more than 50,000 people fled from the ongoing conflict in Sudan and crossed to South Sudan in weeks (location coded to Joda border point in Geger, Renk county, Upper Nile State).

Around 10 January 2026 (week of), traders protested at Custom Market in Juba (Central Equatoria state), the reason for the protests is unknown. The security apparatus (coded as police) fired gunshots to disperse the crowd and a woman (non-protester) was accidentally gun-wounded and treated at a hospital.

On 10 January 2026, attackers from Pibor (likely to be Murle, who lives in the area) attacked and killed a man at an unspecified location in Thol payam (Nyirol county, Jonglei state). The reason for the attack is unknown/not reported.

On 10 January 2026, unidentified armed assailants ambushed a motorcyclist (taxi operator) who was traveling along Torit-Imotong Road, 1.5 kilometers from the SSPDF Sherika Barrack (location coded to Hiyala in Torit County, Eastern Equatoria State). The reason for the attack is unknown/not reported and the victim sustained minor injuries.

On 10 January 2026, members of the Kuac Ayok section of the Rek Dinka (coded as unidentified communal militia) clashed with their counterparts from the Aguok Kuei section in Malual-thou residential area (location coded to Kuajok in Gogrial West County, Warrap State), resulting in 3 deaths. The reason for the attack is unknown/not reported. The incident created tension between the two sections.

On 9 January 2026, protesters marched to the joint operation base at Jebel Yesua area in Munuki (Juba county, Central Equatoria state) during a demonstration to condemn the killing of a civilian earlier that day (coded separately). Officers fired gunshots in the air to disperse the crowd.

Looting: On 9 January 2026, six cattle raiders (described as being from the Aguok community) raided 60 cattle from cattle keepers (described as being from Kuac, Aguok, and Jur River county) at Warmiir village (location coded to Warrnyel in Kangi Jur River county, Western Bahr el Ghazal state), in a cattle incident. The local authorities returned raided cattle to the owners.

On 9 January 2026, unknown attackers stabbed and killed an INGO security guard at a health facility in Lotukei payam (Budi County, Eastern Equatoria). The reason for the attack is unknown/not provided.

On 9 January 2026, suspected Murle individuals abducted 3 local women in Tiergol area, close to the Ethiopian border, near Alali (Akobo, Jonglei). The victims were cutting grass when they were abducted. Local security personnel were informed of the incident.
Looting: On 9 January 2026, suspected armed Nuer individuals from Guelguk stole an unknown number of cattle from locals in Khor Adar, near Panomdit (Melut, Upper Nile). There were no casualties.

Looting: On 9 January 2026, suspected Aguok section of the Rek Dinka armed youths raided 60 cattle from the Jur River community in Waar-miir (location coded to Awanyen in Gogrial West County, Warrap). Security personnel (likely police due to nature of incident) intervened and recovered all the stolen animals (no interactions reported).
Looting: On 9 January 2026, armed individuals suspected to be Gawaar Nuer clan members from Ayod County stole 700 cattle from the Lou Nuer community in Hawgak, near Pading (Nyirol, Jonglei).

On 9 January 2026, clashes continued for a second day between members of the Paabai and Pakiech sections of the Luach-Jang/Luanyjang Dinka community in Pagor Payam (Tonj East, Warrap). The clashes began on 8 January 2026 and were suspected to be revenge-related (coded separately). There were no casualties.
On 8 January 2026, unidentified raiders killed one person and raided 540 cattle near Manyit in Riak payam (Mayom county, Unity state).

Around 8 January 2026 (as reported), unidentified cattle raiders attempted to raid cattle and clashed with cattle keepers in a grazing area at Paloc (Rumbek East county, Lakes state). A cattle keeper was shot and wounded.

On 8 January 2026, members of the Paabai and Pakiech sections of the Luach-Jang/Luanyjang Dinka community clashed in Pagor Payam (Tonj East, Warrap), resulting in 4 fatalities. The incident is suspected to be revenge-related.

On 7 January 2026, soldiers from the joint operation unit (coded as SSPDF) beat, dragged while handcuffed, and killed a man in the Jebel Yesua area in Munuki (Juba county, Central Equatoria state) after the victim reported a theft incident. A conflicting report stated the victim was a theft suspect.

On 7 January 2026, unidentified armed men highjacked a passenger car and abducted unspecified numbers of people along the Juba-Bor Highway (location coded to Bor in Bor South, Jonglei state). Motivation unknown/not reported. The abduction occurred in the context of ambushes targeting civilians in the area. The whereabouts of the abductee(s) are unknown.
On 7 January 2026, suspected Murle youths allegedly killed a local in Kaikuiny (Akobo, Jonglei) for unknown reasons. Local youths attempted to apprehend the perpetrators but were unsuccessful.

On 7 January 2026, unidentified armed assailants (coded as unidentified armed group) ambushed a convoy of 3 vehicles and clashed with SSPDF officers who were escorting the vehicles from Torit to Kapoeta in the vicinity of Kidepo Bridge, Kimotong Payam (location coded to Kimotong in Budi County, Eastern Equatoria State). The clash resulted in 1 fatality on the attackers side and the officers recovered the deceased's weapon.

Looting: On 7 January 2026, armed youth suspected of being from the Aguok section of the Rek Dinka community raided 30 goats from members of the Kuac section of the Rek Dinka community in Lol-Thou village, Manyang contested area of Gogrial Payam (location coded to Gogrial in Gogrial West County, Warrap State).

Weapons seizure: On 5 January 2026, the SSPDF confiscated over 300 weapons including heavy machine guns, AK47, PKM, RPG, and Colt Monitor from unauthorized persons at Gondokoro payam (Juba county, Central Equatoria state). The SSPDF were deployed to the area to disarm civilians. The local chief (traditional chief) said only five weapons were collected.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Miraya; Radio Tamazuj; VOA; Xinhua
properties.notes: On 5 January 2026, youths suspected of being from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle who live in the area) and Jonglei community youths clashed on the outskirts of Kadiang (location coded to Pamaideng in Panyang, Duk county, Jonglei state) during an attempt to recover raided cattle. Unspecified fatalities coded as 3.

On 5 January 2026, two clans (described as Atuot-luach Likely members of the Luac subsection of the Atout clan) clashed using spears and wooden sticks at the Nyinloou cattle camp (location coded to Yirol in Yirol West county, lakes state), over the Ral river water. One person was killed and six people were stabbed and wounded.

On 5 January 2026, street vendors held a demonstration at Custom Market area (Juba, Central Equatoria), due to a conflict with the National Police Service over administrative matters. During the demonstration, some of the traders assaulted a police officer, causing him injuries. This led to the deployment of joint security units in the vicinity with the market remaining closed and a possibility of the closure extending for a few days.

Looting: On 5 January 2026, an unidentified group raided 11 cows from Gok Dinka cattle keepers in Duony Payam (Cueibet, Lakes). The cattle keepers pursued the attackers towards Rumbek Centre County, but did not manage to recover the stolen animals (no interactions reported).

On 5 January 2026, suspected armed Nyuong Nuer youth (coded as Dor Clan Militia due to their affiliation) attacked a grazing land belonging to the Agar Dinka community in Golkou swamps (location coded as Paloc, Rumbek East, Lakes) where they raided 300 cattle. However, locals pursued the attackers and recovered all the stolen animals but one person was injured in the incident.

On 5 January 2026, armed assailants suspected of coming from Banzua Boma attacked Mbororo nomads in Namutina (Tambura, Western Equatoria) killing four people and stealing 20 cattle and an unknown number of goats. Following the incident, several sources mentioned that members of the Banzua community are fearful of a potential revenge attack from the Mbororo nomads.

On 5 January 2026, 2 communities (described as Lualrioi and Pirpiu and coded as unidentified communal militia) clashed at the Pirpiu cattle camp in Abang Payam (location coded to Abang in Yirol West County, Lakes State), resulting in 1 fatality and 4 injuries. Motivation unknown/not reported.

Around 4 January 2026 (as reported), an unidentified armed group shot and killed a man at Panthou payam (Aweil South county, Northern Bahr el Ghazal state). The reason for the attack is unknown and three suspects were arrested.

Around 4 January 2026 (as reported), cattle raiders suspected of coming from Tonj North county (coded as Rek Dinka clan who are habitants of the county) raided 57 cattle and killed a cattle keeper at an unspecified location in Riak payam (Mayom county, Unity state) during a cattle raid incident (victims of the theft are likely Bul Nuer who are habitats of Mayom county).

Looting: Around 4 January 2026 (as reported), an unidentified armed group attacked cattle keepers and raided 380 cattle at Panlaw village, north of Pading Payam (location coded to Ayod in Ayod county, Jonglei state), in a cattle raid incident.

properties.source: Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Miraya; Radio Tamazuj; VOA; Xinhua
properties.notes: On 4 January 2026, youths suspected of being from the Greater Pibor Administrative Area (coded as Murle who lives in the area) attacked two cattle camps and raided around 7,000 cattle in Poktap town in Payuel (Duk county, Jonglei state). At least 28 people were killed, 30 people were gun wounded and over 5000 people, mainly children and women, were displaced.

Looting: On 4 January 2026, an unidentified group raided an unknown number of cattle from a grazing land in Jam Village, near Cuei Ker (Bor South, Jonglei). Bor Dinka youths recovered all the stolen animals (no interactions reported).

On 4 January 2026, an unidentified group ambushed and shot at African Resources Company's cars in Anyidi, along the Kolnyang-Mareng Road (Bor South, Jonglei). The reason for the attack is unknown/not reported. A national security officer (coded as SSPDF) escorting the convoy was killed.
Looting: Around 3 January 2026 (week of), unidentified assailants raided an unspecified number of cattle at Pajut in Panyang (Duk county, Jonglei state).

On 3 January 2026, fighting between two groups of local cattle keepers (coded as unidentified communal militia) ensued at Koor cattle camp, near Malek (Rumbek Centre, Lakes) over a cow ownership. The altercation resulted in 3 injuries, while local authorities arrested one suspect.

Looting: On 3 January 2026, five armed assailants suspected of coming from Cueibet County (coded as Gok Clan Militia) raided 50 cows in Guba Village, Wulu Gediem Boma (location coded to Wulu, Wulu, Lakes). The cattle owners attempted to recover the stolen animals by pursuing the attackers but no outcome was reported. Casualties unknown.

On 3 January 2026, an armed engagement ensued between cattle keepers and cattle raiders in Aluak-luak (Yirol West, Lakes) where the latter stole an unspecified number of cattle. However, the cattle keepers managed to recover 45 of the stolen animals. No casualties were incurred.

On 2 January 2026, armed youths from Twic allied with Gai Machiek (coded as SSPM/A) and Ngok Dinka clashed at Athony Ayuok (coded to Athony 2 in Wunrok, Twic county, Warrap state), Ayuok (coded separately) and Makuac Lueth village (coded separately). A conflict exists between the Ngok and Twic Dinka, authorities from Warrap and Abyei accused each other of attacking. At least five people, including an SSPM/A, were killed and five people were gun wounded. Fatalities split over three events and coded as 2.

On 2 January 2026, armed youths from Twic allied with Gai Machiek (coded as SSPM/A) and Ngok Dinka clashed at Ayuok (coded to Wunrok in Twic county, Warrap state), Athony Ayuok (coded separately), and Makuac Lueth village (coded separately). A conflict exists between the Ngok and Twic Dinka, authorities from Warrap and Abyei accused each other of attacking. At least five people, including an SSPM/A, were killed and five people were gun wounded. Fatalities split over three events and coded as 2.

On 2 January 2026, a group of outsourced porters working for the WFP staged a peaceful sit-down protest at the WFP warehouse in Rumbek town (location coded to Matangai, Rumbek Centre, Lakes), to demand their wages. However, the situation was resolved later in the evening when the contractor paid them.
Property destruction: On 2 January 2026, armed youth from Marial Bai set fire to 21 houses and shelters in Biltong area, Pagor, near Fanok (Tonj East, Warrap), over an unknown motive.

On 1 January 2026, armed youths from Lake state attacked cattle keepers and raided over 400 cattle from Panyijiar (Unity state) in a raid incident. Seven cattle keepers were wounded. The raided cattle were recovered.

On 1 January 2026, armed Lou Nuer youths who were allegedly intoxicated exchanged fire in Bilkey, near Akobo (Akobo, Jonglei), resulting in 1 fatality and two injuries. The motive behind the incident is unknown.

On 1 January 2026, armed Ngok Dinka youths attacked Ayuok village, near Ajakkuac (Twic, Warrap), killing 4 people, among them an SSPDF soldier (presumed off-duty), and injuring seven others. This was in retaliation to a 31 December 2023 incident in which Twic Dinka youths are alleged to have ambushed and killed a senior official and his bodyguards (coded separately).

On 1 January 2026, youths from Lakes State raided an unspecified number of cattle in Pachaar, near Lang (Panyijiar, Unity). There were no casualties. At least 40 of the stolen animals were recovered following intervention by the Panyijiar and Lakes State's authorities.
